Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text:
My husband and I had dinner at Alain Ducasse to close out our short trip in London. No disrespect, but Alain Ducasse was our second choice after we found out that Clare Smyth's restaurant was booked up.

For our experience at Alain Ducasse, the service was top-notch. The food was artfully executed but not palatable to our taste. I felt the same way at The French Laundry (Yountville, CA) and Kashiwaya (Osaka, Japan). Unfortunately, you don't always have a great meal at a 3-star Michelin restaurant.

1st course: This was my favorite of the entire tasting menu. A lovely scallop dish topped with Kristal caviar and beurre balance sauce was the perfect bite.

2nd course: A cauliflower-hazelnut dish created with seasonal ingredients but just tasted very mid.

3rd course: Lobster was slightly overcooked.

4th course: Turbot was perfectly prepared. It was delicious, but I have to say I barely tasted the sea urchin.

5th course: Venison, also perfectly prepared and delicious.

At this point, nothing really blew me away. Everything tasted good but not amazing.

The next 2 courses were dessert courses and, as expected, were not exciting.

6th course: This course included 3 types of cheeses, one being particularly pungent. While I do enjoy some cheeses, I find myself unable to appreciate stinky cheese.

7th course: The final course was a green apple sorbet of sorts, sorry to put it so simply. It was very, very tart, but not bad.

Since we were celebrating an anniversary, the chef sent us a baba au rhum, which was very kind of him/her.

Alain Ducasse is such a culinary legend, and I really wanted to like his food, but I just didn't. I'm very sorry to say this tasting menu was not very fun.

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text: They are not accommodating. They don't care , they just want your money. I flew in from London and I arrived sick, I had severe motion sickness and dehydrated. I called to cancel my reservation since I was so sick and told them if I end up going there, I would throw up. They didn't care about my health. They charged me 500 pounds for cancelling. I should have showed up and just thrown up at the restaurant!! They don't care about you at all!!

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text: This was my first 3 Michelin star experience in London and I wanted to make sure I picked one that had been there the longest. When we sat down someone greeted us right away and then it took about 10 minutes for anyone to come back over. That was the only hiccup during the whole evening but all the food with the presentation and flavor was excellent. It is one of those restaurants that you need to check off the list. Definitely give it a try if your able to score a reservation.

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text:
Very difficult! A three star Michelin restaurant. Expectations are high. One spends a few thousand dollars or a few thousand pounds for not only the experience but heavenly food. While the food was good and the service was good...it was not mind blowing by any stretch of the imagination. Everyone was disappointed.

The staff was courteous and did their roles. I was wearing a black suit, they only had white napkins which I have not seen before. Possible white lint on a black suit is why I always have seen different colored napkins available. There were times where one wine glass was different from the others. Thought that was odd. A little sloppy.

They were very good at planning menu options for anyone with allergies.

The food did seem to have an over citrus flavor theme throughout. Not a big citrus fan. So I personally had a problem. There was one dish that features a small bit of sardines to add variety of flavor. Seemed very poorly executed. Was not spread evenly to give the full consistent taste. One bite had none. Another bite that sardine is all I tasted and another was perfect. The steak dish had no flavor at all. Even a little salt would have helped.

We enjoyed the cream that came with the caviar, scallop and the lobster dish the most. Most of the dishes were not memorable.

I would not come back here. Once again there are so many good options available.

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text: Dining at an Alain Ducasse establishment is always a transcendent experience, and this restaurant was no exception. The attention to detail is palpable from the moment you walk in -- the ambiance is both luxurious and welcoming. The menu is a symphony of flavors, each dish showcasing Ducasse's commitment to culinary excellence. The staff was impeccable in their service, ensuring our evening was flawless. A special mention to the sommelier, whose wine pairings elevated each course to perfection. This is more than just a meal, it's a journey. Highly recommended for those seeking an unparalleled dining experience.

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text:
The waiters are beyond helpful and communicative. Our waiter was so wonderful that when I asked how the kitchens were run, he brought us back to the kitchens to meet the chef.

As for the food, it starts and ends with the lobster dish. It was the absolute best. The scallop dish was also phenomenal. My husband jokingly told the waiter it was the second best scallop he'd ever had... Not sure why my husband said that, but rest assured, it was the best scallop.

The ambience was nice and open so you were not close to any other tables, and had privacy in conversation.

We also liked that they offered wine in half bottles, as often a full bottle is too much.

Excellent evening.

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text:
I called from my hotel JW Marriott and was told that I could come by. One of the 3 all-white female hosts saw my Asian face told me to wait so that she could check. She took a while to go inside and came out to tell me that there was no seat available and told me to check with the Chinese restaurant next door!

If you are an Asian, you should avoid this racist restaurant!

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text:
In pictures and in words, I cannot do this experience justice.

The name Alain Ducasse guarantees that the food will be perfection (and indeed it was). We thought we were going to enjoy a three course lunch and maybe some bread, but we got to sample so many lovely surprises along the way! From the richly flavorful canapes to an exquisite amuse bouche to the post-dessert treats (the leaf-thin chocolate pastries alone would justify a revisit) we enjoyed the most precise, perfected flavors from sour to savory to sweet. The (included!) glasses of red and white wine were a lovely touch that surely contributed to our ascent to culinary heaven.

We've tried and loved many a bread-and-butter but we've reached a new peak with the delightful bread trolley, an incredible (lemony?) whipped curd and fluffy homemade butter.

And needless to say, the lunch itself was delicious. My soft boiled egg with radish in chicken jus was the best I'll ever eat, a meticulously arranged harmony of textures and appetizing acidity. The homemade agnolotti was filled with bursts of unidentifiably otherworldly savory flavor. My mom thought her fillet of lemon sole with sweetcorn was life-changing - who knew corn could taste so good!?

My chocolate / hazelnut praline / caramel dessert is the glittering standard to which all desserts should be held. A flawless marriage of textures, temperatures, and nuttiness that filled my tastebuds with overwhelming freshness (not sweetness), bringing out the best of each of its ingredients. I have never loved a dessert more and I think the only thing that will come close is a second serving :-)

Above and beyond the food itself, what made our experience today so magical was the service. From the minute we were ushered to our table, every detail was painstakingly thought through and the choreography of the meal cleanly executed; every person made us feel so comfortable and truly taken care of. For the hospitality alone, Alain Ducasse is unforgettable and unparalleled.

I've literally run out of caption space but this has been our best dining experience to date: this is everything fine dining should be.

Dined: August 25, 2021

Name: Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester
Review_Text: Alain Ducasse restaurants never disappoint. They have a standard that is top level. The three Star experience at the dorchester is more relaxed than the paris restaurants which is nice. Dim quiet interior. Helpful staff. They treat you great. As they should for the price. Extensive drink menu and knowledgeable sommelier. Started with a gin martini and then to wine. The meal is obviously very elevated. My stars where the first few dishes. The Jerusalem artichoke was amazing. And the trio of cauliflower was inspired. The new builds to a surprisingly refreshing dessert. I enjoyed that. After such a decadent meal I don't need a heavy sweet. But, if you have a sweet tooth don't worry they give you plenty of chocolate. If I am being nit picky and hyper hyper critical, I wish the later dishes packed more of a punch and I wish the beef was seared a bit more. That is a pretty minor thing. Perfect place for a birthday or anniversary.

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
Honestly, this is one of my most memorable and amazing meals that I've had. A 3 star Michelin restaurant with a chef whom is consistently present with her staff and has the passion and empathy to say hi to her guests while making her menu financially accessible to more people considering the status of her food.

It was a genuine pleasure to be serviced by the waiting staff and chefs. Clare Smyth is a major reason to visit, but her staff and their warmth and professionalism is on another level of service. Genuinely, it broke my mind the way we were treated.

I ordered the classic menu while my date had the seasonal spring menu. We also ordered a bottle of wine!

Overall, cannot say enough amazing things about my experience here.

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
Took my wife here to celebrate our first big trip since the pandemic. From start to finish the experience was extraordinary.

Clare Smyth's cuisine and service embody excellence across the board, and truly she is one of England's greatest chefs.

Booking was by the numbers. While you have to be ready to get a table when released, thankfully, it was not impossible.

We took the tube to Notting Hill, and it was a pleasant walk to the restaurant through some lovely neighborhoods. Upon checking in we were greeted warmly and taken to our table.

Two tasting menus were offered - the classic tasting menu and the "Core Seasons." We got one of each, why not try each dish? We also got a wine pairing.

We prepared our palates with some champagne and cocktails, and sat back to enjoy the experience. Each dish was a breathtaking melange of color, expertly arranged and plated. The flavors and how all the ingredients were sublime.

The wait staff were very knowledgeable about all the wines served and we enjoyed their stories of the provenances of each vintage.

On the way out we got to meet Clare and thanked her for a wonderful evening we would not forget.

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. My bf and I have a few shows we watch together, Top Chef being one of them. So when I saw a reservation for lunch open for this restaurant while we were on vacation, I knew I had to book it.

We traveled by metro to the restaurant and got there a little early. The hostess was very gracious and let us store our bags in the front closet. We had the earliest reservation, so there we were quite outnumbered by the wait staff. Once the restaurant filled up a bit more, I watched in wonder at a well-oiled machine. Everything from the escort to the restroom, to pulling out chairs, to describing every single dish was impeccable.

Now, the food, every single dish, was delicious, well balanced, and presented like an absolute work of art. We started with 3 pieces of amuse bouche to get our palates ready, and my palate was still not ready! The scallop tartare has probably ruined me. I don't know how, if or why I would ever eat scallops after this. To say they were fresh would be an understatement. Potato and Roe, every time I go to a fine dining restaurant, I am always amazed by all of the flavors they can put into a modest food such as a potato. The roasted cod was delicious. The lamb carrot was quite a surprise as the carrot was magically stuffed with roasted lamb. The venison was very tender and juicy. The Core Apple was magical, as it looks like a fuji apple but is a delicious stuffed mousse. The Wild Strawberry is also a beautiful optical illusion as it represents a caprese salad but is a refreshing dessert.

Just when I thought I couldn't fit in another morsel, here comes the Petit Fours. With my second stomach that's usually reserved for desserts, I managed to devour a chocolate tart that was reminiscent of a fresh baked cookie and their wonderful jellied wine. This reminded me of a super potent wine jello shot but way more refined.

I can not recommend trying to secure a reservation to this restaurant if you're on vacation and want to splurge on a Three Michelin Star meal.

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text: I booked for 2 people for Core Restaurant at 9.45pm, my plane was delayed by over an hour to return to London, so I asked the restaurant and asked the attendant if I could change my booking or come half an hour late. She said she could change my booking but will charge me a cancellation fee or keep my booking for half an hour. I received an email prior to half an hour to say I will be charged $300GPD cancellation fee and they stoped picking up my calls. It's disgusting!

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text: What an amazing experience we had. This review is a bit late as we were there in October 22'.. You walk in and immediately you are transported. We were lucky to snag an afternoon lunch resv. Which was absolutely perfect time. The sun coming through the restaurant.. the food was just so beautiful .... next couple of hours were pure joy ...all the senses engaged. Can't wait to come back to see what's next..

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
Words can't describe what a beautiful, delicious, and perfect experience our dinner was. As soon as you enter the door, to every minute of the well choreographed dinner to our departure - perfection. There is an abundance of staff and one has to admire the level of efficiency of the staff's movements around the dining room. A finished plate never sat on the table for more than 30 seconds before someone came to whisk it away and clean the table. Each dish was presented perfectly and staff was knowledgeable and energetic to present the next course. The dishes were phenomenal tasting. The creativity, beauty, and just overall taste of each and every dish. Nothing was heavy, while most dishes were quite bright. The desserts were just ok but the rest of the meal more than made up for it.
Chef was in the kitchen and was able to even get a quick greeting on the way in and out. Would come back in a heartbeat.

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
Set your alarms to get reservations because they get booked quick! I was fortunate enough to get reservations about 2 months out for our trip to London for a birthday dinner. We were excited to dine here after seeing Chef Clare on Chef's Table on Netflix. Dining at Core was a wonderful experience. Our host grabbed us to get seated after we had a cocktail in the waiting area. Right when we entered the dining room, we saw Chef Clare and her friendly staff members waive and greet us with the most welcoming hello! I enjoyed her open kitchen layout to see the chefs hard at work.

We decided to pick one of each on the tasting menu so we can try a variety of Chef Clare's dishes. I love that we have the option of choosing different tasting menus when it was just us 2 dining. Typically, high end restaurants require you get the same tasting menu for the whole table since it's easier to prepare.

All of the dishes had it's own unique taste with a gorgeous presentation. The sauce for her signature potato dish was divine and the potato was cooked perfectly. Be prepared for a TON of dessert dishes. I wish they offered more savory compared to sweets. The staff was very knowledgeable and gave us a full description of each dish while serving us. I highly recommend giving this 3 Michelin Star restaurant a try!

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text: Loved this restaurant and would definitely try to go back when I'm in london! I say try because reservations are hard to come by. There were two menus to choose from and we got one of each so that we could try everything! The classic tasting was fine, but between the two we both enjoyed the core seasons menu more. The service was great and although I was scared of finishing really late (our reservation was at 9/9:30) time surprisingly flew by quickly and I wasn't as tired as I thought I would be. Presentation was phenomenal as well!

Name: CORE by Clare Smyth
Review_Text:
I tried doing the no-reservations thing at CORE twice, back before the Covids, but they only ever had seating at the bar, not in the main dining room. Like an idiot, I passed, both times.

I was a little worried that a couple was allowed to enter with their baby, but the infant was seated far from my table, so, few worries. And now that I've finally been properly seated, I found the food, service, ambiance to be exceptional.

Of course, there are plenty of exceptional restaurants, worldwide. Here, I was very pleased to see that Chef Clare Smyth, who I believe to be one of only 4 women who have ever earned a third Michelin star, has selected her restaurant staff to include women and men of various diverse backgrounds, on both sides of house, at all levels. The kitchen (and staff) is fully visible to the patrons at the Chef's table, but every diner gets a glimpse as they walk by.

It is not until you've visited a handful of these super high-end restaurants to realize that Chef Smyth's diverse staff is extremely rare.

I'll have to return soon.

2022 09 23. M3.

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text:
display and presentation are both great
service is fantastic.
Truely remarkable Michelin experience.
however, quite a few us suffered GI issue within hrs after the finish.
it was a pity

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text:
We had not been since they used marbles on the menu for you to select your dishes. While that was cool, my wife had not been expecting it so we are glad they went back to the traditional menu approach.

The team was excellent and even humored us speaking in Italian to us at times (we are learning). We did the five course menu with the wagyu which was fantastic. The pairings were really nice throughout the meal and it was a really nice evening. The lobster was especially delicious and their take on onion soup was quite inventive.

This is definitely in our rotation and we will see how the menu evolves over time

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text: The dishes here are museum quality. Each one is a work of art. Service is excellent as is the setting. The taste is absent in some of the dishes. Some are a bit bland, and some are excellent. The wagyu beef was outstanding, like butter, but the 125 pound upcharge was outrageous. The baba rum also had an 18 pound upcharge for the 30-year-old brandy that was drizzled with. All in all our meal for two was over 500 pounds without any liquor.

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text: None of the 7 courses are tasty. Very mediocre! I really don't understand how can it get Michelin 3 stars. All 1 or 2 stars restaurants I tried were way better than this one

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text:
This was my first time eating a 3 Michelin star restaurant and wow I wasn't prepared for just how much of an upgrade the dining experience would be.

We opted for the full tasting menu with the wine pairing. Their menu is seasonal so I won't go into much detail about the food because it was all amazing and this review would be 10 pages long.

The level of service and attention to detail is truly astonishing. The staff were amazing and super friendly. A lot of times it can feel intimidating to sit down at such renowned place but they made it super comfortable. They also reached out beforehand and asked if we had a special reason for visiting the restaurant to which we said for our anniversary and they hand wrote a very nice card for us.

Even days after they emailed me and thanked us for our visit. Made our first night in London so special.

Thanks again!

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text: My family and I have been fortunate enough to dine at the top Michelin restaurants around the world. This restaurant delivered sharp service and executed imaginative delectable dishes. We will be back for the chef's table and sommelier tasting when we return. Thank you for a memorable night and for entertaining our 8 year olds palate. She thoroughly enjoyed her creative mock-tails.

Name: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught
Review_Text:
Instant contender for one of my top meals ever.

I can't say enough about our meal at HD.
It was top level dining from start to finish in all categories.

The ambience and service were fantastic and the food was world class.

Full disclosure, I had a couple of martinis at the hotel lobby bar (which is also fantastic) before dinner, so that plus the (generous and delicious) wine pairings started to make things a little fuzzy towards the dessert courses... but I can tell you with 100% certainty that despite that this was a night I won't soon forget.

I will spare you the dish by dish rundown but each course was an incredible display of technique, beauty, flavor and attention to detail.

I mentioned the service earlier, but it can't be overlooked how important they are to the overall experience and at HD they were attentive, knowledgable, friendly, fun, accommodating... I have run out of adjectives, but the staff was superb.

Hélène Darroze is playing in the top level culinary sandbox as a three Michelin star tasting menu restaurant and they have proved to me that they can go up against any meal in the world.
They nailed it.
We were blown away.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
First of all, from the outside, the restaurant looks very unassuming, almost like a house or apartment building door that you could easily miss. But when you walk in, it feels like you are entering a mysterious room. Then you see the smiling faces of the staff.

We were seated right away. The dining room was very intimate with elegant decor and a quiet atmosphere--I could barely hear the other diners, just a whispering noise. When we received the menu, they explained that there were three options: the surprise option and two others where you know what you are getting. They also checked with us about any allergies.

Throughout the meal, I kept thinking about how the staff brought food to the different tables with such etiquette. They would walk to the doorframe for their boss to check the food before bringing it to the tables, placing all the plates in front of each customer simultaneously. It reminded me of the movie "The Menu," but in a good way.

My son and I chose the surprise menu, while my daughter opted for the six-course meal. We received tiny portions of food with amazing flavors. Initially, we thought we might leave hungry, but by the end of the experience, we were in a very pleasant food coma.

This is definitely an experience that will stay with me for the rest of my life, and I am for sure coming back the next time I am in London. It was worth every penny. Thank you, Gordon Ramsay, for this amazing restaurant. Thank you to the chef for the incredible taste and presentation of the food, and last but not least, thank you to all the staff who made it such a special day!

See you soon!

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: My wife and I traveled to the UK for our honeymoon and decided to make Restaurant Gordon Ramsay our celebratory dinner. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by their friendly and very helpful staff. The atmosphere was lovely with the color pallet consisting of white, gold and purple used was consistent and seen on everything from the walls to the furniture. We both ordered different things to taste a little bit of everything. My wife ordered the scallops for her starter while I ordered the ravioli. Both were delicious and set the expectations for the flavor profiles we were about to experience. For entrée, my wife ordered the cornish turbot and I had the Cumbrian blue gray. Her fish was so moist and flavorful. The blue gray was exquisite with the black garlic. The mushrooms alone on my plate could of been the highlight of any other meal. We did order and try the cheese before dessert but they were a bit too funky for our taste. For dessert we ordered the pecan praline and the strawberries and creme. Both were very good and not too sweet for my tastes (I don't really have a sweet tooth so it was right up my alley). The service was over the top with the staff constantly checking in and making sure everything was taken care of (they even go as far as to make sure you don't pour yourself your own water.... sorry about that haha). As we didn't have time during our wedding to finish our meals, thank you everyone who works there for making our celebratory wedding dinner one to remember forever.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
Well deserving of its three Michelin stars!

Taste-9.5/10
Creativity-10/10
Presentation-10/10
Service-10/10
Ambience-10/10


Honestly it's hard to not give 10's across the board. Each dish was amazing. I supposed you could quibble with the 9.5 for taste, and make that a 10 - but on the caviar dish, the caviar flavor was swamped out by the other ingredients and was lost. If the caviar had been more highlighted then this would easily be a 10/10 meal. Realistically it was probably a 10/10 even despite this.

A few photos included... obviously the menu changes frequently.

100% go with the Carte Blanche (chef's choice) menu. You will not be disappointed. Also add the wine pairing but be forewarned, you will get fairly tipsy.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: We didn't see Gordon but, this place is amazing, the food was great, the staff was professional and friendly.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Very well run business like a well oiled machine. Waiting staff listened and were in a relaxed and comfortable uniform. Cleanliness was impeccable. We went for Christmas lunch and we were not disappointed. Dishes were well balanced and a little unusual to the "traditional" British dishes. The flair and beauty of the dishes were worth the money, for special occasions. It was a great dining experience and we were pleased that the puddings were just right, not too filling to make you regret eating them. Good wine menu.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
Tl;dr - 5 Star Service, 4 Star food (in terms of fine dining). 4.5 stars overall, rounded up because there were more highlights than lowlights.

We capped off our trip to London with a dinner at Restaurant Gordon Ramsay. We took a cab into Chelsea and walked around before walking to the restaurant, arriving approximately 15 to 20 minutes before our reservation.

We checked in at the front door to confirm our reservation before entering. We were greeted with complimentary champagne and an amuse-bouche of various tarts in the front room, while we awaited our dinner reservations.

It's a unique experience, both in the front room, and dinning room, to have the table pulled out for you. We were taken back at this level of service and it was consistent throughout our dinner.

We decided on Prestige menu and worked with the sommelier to find a wine pairing that would work with the meal.

The first course was an off-menu soup. It was light, simple and had fresh, herbaceous flavors.

The second course was the summer salad. Similar to the soup, it was light and refreshing. The elderberries popped each bite and delightful.

We were served dinner rolls in between the second and third course. The rolls were light, buttery, and a nice treat. I can't say it's the best bread that I've had, but it was good.

The third course was the world-famous Lobster Ravioli and it lived up to expectations. It was rich and had a wonderful umami flavor. I could've had several more.

The fourth course was the Cornish turbot. It was mild and smooth, with good mouth feel. However, I found the flavors to be rather mild.

The fifth course was the Cumbrian Blue Grey. It was underwhelming. The texture wasn't as tender as I would've expected and the flavor was rather mild.

We were rather full, so we skipped the cheese course.

The first dessert course was the sorbet with a crisp topper. The sorbet was refreshing, sweet and has a nice tart, while I felt guilty eating the intricate crisp.

The final dessert course was a chocolate pecan praline ice cream and to put it simply it was the single best ice cream dish that I've had period. It was creamy, rich and refreshing, with a slight smoke to it. It was addictive.

Overall, I found the food to be very good. I would gladly eat every dish again. However, I was hoping for more vibrant and explosive flavors that left lasting impressions. A few dishes reached these heights, such as the ravioli and the pecan praline ice cream, while others felt very "safe," yet good, like cumbrian blue grey and Cornish turbot, with mild flavors.

The service is what elevated the experience to a 5-star review for me. While the food was very good, I would expect more from a 3 Michelin Star restaurant, give other meals that I had in London (and back in the U.S.), but the service was unparalleled.

The staff was extremely friendly and took the time to accommodate a gluten allergy that we had, walk us through the menus, wine listing and share information with us about the restaurant.

Watching the service take place was an elegant, organized chaos, with every detail accounted for throughout the dining room. If your table was dirty, they cleared it. If you dropped your silverware or napkin, they replaced it. They changed the plates and silverware in between each course so you had an untainted experience and it created an amazing atmosphere where every course was as though it was your first.

Beyond that, the server's personalized our experience, by acknowledging that we were celebrating a trip to London and our anniversary, which made it all the more special.

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone, especially those who are familiar with Gordon Ramsay's work, because it speaks to the great talent that he is, what he's built and who he's surrounded himself with.

Technicality the food is flawless. I just wish the flavors were a bit bolder.

I would definitely come back, if for nothing more than the world class service. Though, I hope for a slightly more inspired and transcendent flavor experience next time.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Beef Wellington was amazing. Definitely worth the price. Service was top notch. Everything was perfect!

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Beef Wellington was amazing. Definitely worth the price. Service was top notch. Everything was perfect!

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: The food was excellent. We had the scallops, ravioli with lobster, pigeon, Dover sole, beef, and the chocolate and a souffle. Not a complaint. Standouts were the ravioli and Dover sole. This was our second visit in 30 years. It was a standout then.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
This was our 3rd time having dinner there.
We went on 11/08/23 for our 30th anniversary celebration. We ordered CARTE BLANCHE menu which we thought will be special.
For the food, the 1st 2 appetizer came out quite good and creative, and the next few courses were a miss. the main dish, VENISON was gamey, it was ordinary and there's no WOW factor given this is a 3* michelin restaurant. My wife asked to replace it with Steak which was much better.
For the service, it was OK, we ordered a wine pairing (240 pound for 6 glasses), the 1st 2 wines paired well, the rest of 4 did not. I am not a wine snob, I just felt that the wine were served were ordinary considering being charged 40 pound per glass. and when my wife told one of the server about not liking the choice, he only said OK. We have to keep calling someone else till get it replaced with other wine.
For the grand finale, the restaurant presented us a very small cake to commemorate the special occasion, 30th anniversary. the cake was as small as the amuse bouche, what a joke !!!
Can't say we will be back again this time.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Second time visiting here, a bit disappointed, specially for the wi e paring, don't think it's worth the price, so sorry

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
*Sigh* this is an interesting one to write. My wife and I love Chef Ramsay so much & he's one of the few celebrities for us that if we saw him we'd be starstruck.

Unfortunately, I have to give the experience 3.5 stars out of 5, but I'll round it up to 4. We have been to many Michelin starred restaurants all over the world and what separates these restaurants is the service/experience, less so the food. The food here was outstanding, and ultimately saves it. The service, timing, and ambiance weren't. Don't get me wrong, the staff was extremely nice and attentive, but there were things that made the visit less than stellar.

1) Timing of the courses was quite inconsistent or delayed. I realize it can't always be perfect but when the first few courses are spaced out less than 5 minutes apart and then it takes 10-15 minutes before the main, you notice the gap. It was also a ~15 minute wait between them taking our last plates away and us receiving the check that we had to ask for. What was most disappointing was that when I'm at a restaurant of that caliber, the last thing I should be thinking is "where is the check so I can leave?"

2) The ambiance wasn't there. There was only one room for dining and it seemed like there was maybe one too many tables in there. Sitting down at my table I was about a foot away from the guy sitting at the next table and I can tell you every word of their conversation. They faced everyone towards the center of the dining room which I liked, but it was difficult to get out from the table to visit the restroom or avoid bumping the guy to my side at the other table. A small thing to complain about but again, when you're at a place like RGR you expect these smaller details to be taken care of.

3) Service felt frantic. They take the approach of "no one should have an empty glass" and "if you see an empty tray or unfolded napkin, take care of it" - a real collaborative mentality. They take it so far that it's a detriment to the service. I don't need my water glassed re-filled every time I sip it and I'd like consistency on who is serving me so I can build a rapport over the meal. Service also wasn't very crisp. It felt a little disjointed and like the staff was pretty green or had just started working together.

After ~$750 spent for two, I expected more. I'm glad the food was bomb and we enjoyed every single bite, but they need to make some updates on service. If I'm the one dolling out stars - no chance based on last night I'm awarding more than 1.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
Listen, if a restaurant wants to tell you how you should tip up, I don't mind. It's their restaurant. They have standards. It's a statement of intent. I'm up for it.
It's just that if their standards then dip below what they set, you're going to pile in.
Which is what I'm doing. It feels mean and nitpicks but they asked for it.
A Jacket is preferable when you go to Gordon Ramsey's. It's hot, but mantit sweat marks are something I'm prepared to allow for food from a place that's been three Michelin Star since I last went 20 years ago. That's some feat and I' not going to argue.
Let me be clear. The food itself was perfection. This is possibly part of my quibble though.
There aren't many edges to this place, and none of them are textured.
The service is perfectly charming.
The food is immaculate.
And the night went swimmingly.
There just wasn't much to challenge the mind or the palate.
The three menu choices were fun. A seven course tasting menu. A la carte. And a seven course tasting menu thought up on the day derived from whatever they felt was good from the produce delivered. Sounds like a laugh but I'm not wholly convinced they approve of laughter in the dining room. We went for two normal tasters and a surprise.
The room is beige. If you like beige, you'll love the room.
There's some sort of light feature in the middle of the room hanging from the ceiling that looks like an xxxl shower curtain holder. This is the most noticeable thing about the room. That and the sound of silence Art Garfunkel himself might have been deafened by as we enter.
Thankfully things did liven up as the tables filled but that first impression isn't knockout like it is when you walk into somewhere like Core.
Actually, The Fat Duck is similarly underwhelming in terms of its surroundings but they then proceed to charm you senseless with the food and the experience. A charm that's lacking here.
Amuse bouches roll out and are happily tucked away. The cheese balls I wouldn't have questioned if they had been from Papa Johns. I often wonder when eating high end food that the irony is we end up saying 'amazing, it tastes just like snickers/wotsits/Ritz crackers'. The closer you get, the better. Just like a Snickers but £45 more expensive. Winner. Anyway, the cheeseballs tasted good. Like I was watching football in front of the telly surrounded by pizza boxes and money off leaflets for my next order.
Second course in was introduced as a smoked salmon salad.
It was in fact smoked duck breast.
No worries.
Except that for the grand I'm dropping here, I thought that sort of thing was completely ironed out in the training. I literally don't care that they announced the wrong main ingredient. I can work it out for myself. That is until I remind myself that the whole reason I'm paying a small fortune for this is that nothing like this is ever supposed to happen. And they preferred I wear a jacket. I've watched The Bear. I've understood that these people have gone through nervous breakdowns to attain perfection. And I understand that means I'm going to have to shell out. I understand I need to do this in a slightly restricted jacket. So when it isn't perfect, however innocent, it rankles. That and the fact that they 'preferred' me to wear a jacket on a boiling hot night. Well if I'm paying all this money and melting at the same time, I'd prefer to know that the dish is smoked duck breast rather than smoked salmon. See, places like this turn you into a twat. I don't want to be a twat. I just want to be a normal person enjoying great food in a nice T shirt. But they wouldn't let me do that so say hello to Mr Twat.
We had a delicious concoction which was a sort of broth top layer with a cream underneath that was sheer delight. The star of the show and a hint to head chef's talent and her background coming from south east Asia.
The Somellier was wonderful and gleefully imparted his knowledge and a couple of fine suggestions.
Other than that, nothing to report other than excellently executed dish after dish enjoyed in neutral surroundings served by very proper staff although one girl loosened up enough to chat a bit about her job which was fascinating and fun. More of that please.
My son turned 18. That was the reason for our visit.
He loved every moment. It felt special to him. He'd never eaten food as good and he marvelled at all the watches in the room.
This wisened old git just wanted something with a bit more oomph. I yearned for some prefect imperfection. A Lee Scratch Perry cow moo, a Stan Bowles shirt hanging out as he ghosts past three defenders. A quirk, a bit of derring do.
For that, I'd come back donning two jackets and a corset.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: The best experience I've ever had. Everything was absolutely perfect. My first three star Michelin restaurant and it def set the standards so high for the others I went to after. Everything on the menu was absolutely DELICIOUS. The service was out of this world. The ambiance wasn't really there at first but once ppl started drinking, it got louder and better. I can't wait to go back one day and have the food. Everything was so good!!!!

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
I was so excited to have beef Wellington at this restaurant. I am a big kitchen nightmares fan. It was so bland, I had to ask the waitress for some salt. It was not bad, but lacked so much flavor. Waitress gave me salt, and never asked why I thought the meat needed it. Maybe they are used to it.

Should have suspected it, when every restaurant near was full and when we sat down there were only 2 other people in the place at 8pm.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
Caveat: I own a Forbes 5 star restaurant. Just this year we were at noma , geranium , aoc, jont, providence, headed to core and Helene later this week.
I would say that R. Gordon Ramsay is a hard pass if you're visiting from abroad and limited with your time. It's a nice meal but not a Michelin 3 star.
1) service was close to proper , but not a single staff member was engaging or remarkable; in this day and age stuff doesn't quite cut it anymore. The som was confused about what we ordered considering that entire table had gotten the same tasting menu. Our water glass were empty for more than 5 min on several occasions. Table was never crumbed or staines addressed
2)decor was clean and modern, restrooms up kept
3) food: price was reasonable for carte blanche tasting . Flatware were beautiful, plateing composition was inspiring . Now for taste: menu needs whole reset. The cheese puff amuse was like a mouthful of day old mac/cheese. If you're going to make bread a "course" then game needs to be upped, dinner rolls and shared butter doesn't quite do it. Lobster course was chewy. John Dory was a tad over cooked, mention my preference on some things., like the beans to staff and never heard back from kitchen or saw chef. The squab course from delicious, but temp was off, plates should have been fired much warmer. Entire pace of dinner was way too slow, at some point we waited 20min between courses. Total time for tasting was 4.5hrs for a 10 course meal.
I would also say I left hungry, I prefer to be present with too much food at this price point and be able to make decision to eat less.(you have be in excess at this level to cater to different guest appetites)

So overall: good for a local drop in for dinner if you have not been, beyond that, it's not a 3 star Michelin and should be stripped of some of its accolades. 1 out 10 course being good...is very bad, I don't expect to love it all, but I didn't expect to hate most of it .

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Table for 4 at lunch time during the week. 3 out of the 4 ordered the tasting menu, only had 4 glasses of wine. The bill was $1600.00. This is lunch for 4 people. Sorry this just seems exorbitantly extreme for lunch. Everything was ok, not incredible and just not worth this type of money. Understand that it is a personal choice in choosing the restaurant and menu items but sorry, that is sticker shock to some and should be noted.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: This unit is horrendous. The staff is rude, the management is terrible. I would stay far far away from this location. They allow overly infectious individuals to eat on premise because if they don't they are extorted. BE WARY! There is also an active health department investigation into this unit. I would choose another location that cares about the customer a little more.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: Great service and elevated pub fare. The beef Wellington was tender and flavorful. My mom really enjoyed her special night

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text: I'd give this restaurant 4.5 stars if I could, but I'm rounding up because certain aspects of it--not least the service--were extraordinary. We opted for the menu prestige, and all of the little surprise appetizers and amuse bouches were outstanding. The prize goes to a revolutionary savory custard tart with the absolute freshest of spring produce and the perfect amount of caviar. This dish took my breath away. The bread and butter course was also truly sublime. Interestingly, the one course we were both disappointed with was the meat course: I had the Cumbrian blue grey and my husband had the bigger. While we understand that being spare with seasonings will help us focus on the taste of the meat, we did not find the taste of either meat noteworthy, and they tasted underseasoned to us. The cheese course, however, was a revelation. The cart and selection are jaw-dropping, and those who like washed rind stinky cheeses will NOT be disappointed here: the Epoisses was perfect, the best I've tasted; and the Muenster was the discovery of the night. The young woman who introduced the cheeses and helped us make our selection was absolutely superb--as, frankly, we're all the staff. I can easily say that this was the most polished service I've ever experienced at a restaurant. The staff have a way of making everyone feel welcome, luxuriously cared for, and at ease. Not overly fussy or pretentious at all, despite the doting care one would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. And, trust me, despite the small portion sizes, you will not leave hungry, as there are A LOT of portions to taste. A once in a lifetime experience.

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
Can't recommend this place enough! This experience exceeded our expectations! We had heard so much about Restaurant Gordon Ramsey for years and were worried it was all hype...but it's even better that we could have imagine On top of each delicious courses, the amazing staff and stunning decor complete the experience (there was even a bench to put my purse!).

We did the 7 course Carte Blanche with new dishes designed by the Chef and you never know what's coming next. With the complimentary canapés, amuse boucle, palate cleanser, and additional dessert (not pictured), it felt more so like 11 amazing courses!

For libations we did the wine pairing, while not an inexpensive addition was great to have all the thought taken out of drink selection and know what we were having complimented each course.

Would highly recommend for an elevated night out and/or celebration!! We can't wait to go back!

Name: Restaurant Gordon Ramsay
Review_Text:
We came here on a saturday noon. It is advisable that you book beforehand.

We got the £250 carte blanche menu cause we want to be surprised. And every plate indeed is a lovely surprise. I am still in awe of how soft the bread rolls were, it was literally a bread roll from heaven. I did make a request that if they have lamb in one of the courses, please change them to another meat because I cannot eat lamb and they happily oblige. My piece of steak was done just to my liking. We ended with pre dessert, the dessert and some small candies afterwards. I'll forever remember the taste of the chocolate- so deep and dark with almond aftertaste

Since this is a three michelin star establishment, it is of course very professional in terms of service level. You are greeted at the door and someone will take your coat away. All the servers are knowledgeable and provide for nice banter.

Restaurant ambiance is very intimate. Limited tables and table sizes are usually small.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I'll start by saying that the atmosphere is really cool and the bathroom is really creative. This place might be worth going to once.
The food was alright.
The staff was so polite and kind except for the man who served my table.
He must've been having a pretty bad day. I get it, we all have off days. He rushed me to start my afternoon tea sandwiches before it arrived on the table and before I even got the 1st course... which they forgot. My 1st pot of tea arrived and it was the wrong pot. The timing of the food and the tea was wrong. Food would show up and then tea took forever.
For the price of this afternoon tea, I expect the server to be on top of it.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Wonderful service and food was delicious. We had a big celebration for our Girl Scouts the host returned with sweet macaron desserts with candies for our 3 tables. Great experience.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
The food was superb. The ambiance was a modern bridgerton equipped with color, Class and champagne. The service was beyond amazing and they catered to my young child and treated her like a princess. We will be back.

Thank you sketch for a memorable experience

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
My biggest advice is to not go toooo hard on the earlier courses (especially the tower with pastries and sandwiches) because we totally forgot there were still scones and cake to come! But the sandwiches, desserts, and tea are all you can eat so I think overall worth the value. My favorite was the mini lobster rolls and all the little cakes were delicious!

The decorations are a big part of the experience too! I've heard it changes seasonally but when we went in June, our room had a pink and classy vibe, with a live quartet. And it's an open secret but don't forget to check out the restrooms - the craziest designs I've e seen for a restroom.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: I booked an anniversary dinner here and was quite looking forward to it. On arrival we were quickly welcomed and shown the way to our reservation area. Several hosts and hostesses wished us a happy anniversary which was very nice. Unfortunately that's where the positives ended. Staff do a good job with greeting but cups and plates lingered far too long and we had to ask for our check. Crumbs were left on our table through 2 courses. It may not seem like much but I feel these are the bare minimums for being deserving of a Michelin star. For food we went with the 3 courses from the origins menu. Two of the three dishes were a miss for me. My appetizer of white asparagus was unremarkable and forgettable. The cod as a main with spinach sauce was cooked well in terms of doneness but was quite bland and the sauce didn't taste like much. The dessert was quite nice-floating island of meringue with a beautiful scoop of ice cream underneath in addition to a basil pool. This was my favorite dish of the dinner. We were given a nice cake for anniversary celebration as well and that was much appreciated. However seeing two tables who were seated after us get their checks prior to us was a disappointment. The bathrooms are an experience, do check them out. Given my experience and expectations of this dinner I can't recommend it and would not come back.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I had an amazing dinner in the Lecture Room & Library. It's easy to see why Michelin awarded it three stars.

The decor is bright and unusual but still fancy.

My meal was incredibly good. My favorite courses on the tasting menu were the haddock, langoustine, and the veal. The wine pairings were good but next time I will probably get the standard instead of splurge.

Service was impeccable!

My only disappointment was waiting almost 20 minutes to get a taxi after the end of the meal. It's difficult to believe there was a huge demand at 10pm on a Wednesday. But, unlike most other fine dining restaurants I have been at--Hide, for example, typically orders a taxi for me and let's me know when it arrives so I spend no time waiting out on the street. Ditto The Ledbury--Sketch will not organize a taxi for guests.

Instead, guests can ask the doorman to waive over a taxi if an available one happens by. There does not seem to be many drop offs on the section of Conduit Street in the evening so it was a long wait.

Otherwise, it was a fantastic experience.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
This review is for the lecture room and library, and our dinner here was hands down the best dining experience of our lives! We were absolutely blown away and amazed for every second of our evening here. The service was the most friendly, fun, knowledgeable and attentive I have ever experienced. The ambiance left us speechless. The evening here was the highlight of our two week trip in Europe, and we had some amazing experiences.
The hostess' tour after our dinner of the other rooms really left us feeling like we had the most magical and epic time.
I know I haven't mentioned the food yet, it was exceptional and it alone warranted the 5 star review, but we knew going to a 3 Michelin star restaurant would give us perfect cuisine, but the service and impeccable ambiance stunned us and left us feeling like this truly was a highlight from our holiday abroad. Thank you, Sketch for a memory my wife and I will always cherish.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
If you find yourself in London and you don't go check out Sketch, you have made a huge mistake.
Truly one of the coolest places I have ever been to.
From the GORGEOUS forest themed back bar to the other worldly bathrooms, It is a fully immersive dining experience unlike any other.
Great service, incredible food and masterful cocktails!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: My husband and I are on our honeymoon and chose this restaurant as a special date night and are so glad we did! Upon arrival we were treated with the upmost hospitality. The restaurant was beautiful and unlike anything we have ever experienced before. We both did the tastings menu and shared a bottle of white wine recommended by the sommelier. We were constantly checked on and explained each dish. The menu had a wide variety of foods, many of which I have never tried before. The staff also sent us links in an email for other foods to try during the rest of our honeymoon. They also gave us a tour after our meal and we got to see the famous bathrooms! I hope to be able to make it back one day. Most amazing dining experience we've ever had!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I had very high hopes for Sketch and in the end had a fairly mixed experience.

The venue itself is great. The reservations were difficult to secure, so book early (though I'm not totally sure why as it wasn't overwhelmingly crowded? I think maybe some of the rooms were closed at the time we went). There are 5 rooms, so be sure to at least glance at each of the various themes. We landed a spot in the parlor. This was fine-the pictures online do it a bit of a favor. Grabbed a spot on one of the couches, which overall was a very normal cocktail bar seat. Everyone had told us to check out the bathroom, which is an interesting little art installation (explanation is on the wall walking up).

The drinks themselves were very fine. The prices are likely reflective of the overall experience so we weren't so interested in getting more than one.

The service at first was great, super friendly and attentive. However, halfway through our experience they were inundated with ?a birthday party? of about 20 people at once, at which point we became essentially non-existent to them as they tried to sort this out, so getting the check was a bit of a hassle.

The vibe of the parlor beside the seating was not my favorite. The DJ's choices were a bit aggressive for the amount of people in the room who were simply having conversations. Also, there are signs posted about being respectful of taking pictures in the area and being mindful of other patrons when doing so, so I found it a bit off-putting when I found myself in the background of the DJ filming what I assume was some sort of live social media moment.

Overall, the hype is focused on the venue space and you can probably get this from the pictures themselves online.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
From the moment you step into Sketch London, you're enveloped in a mesmerizing atmosphere. The vibrant decor and dynamic energy captivate your senses immediately. The stylish, warm, and welcoming hostess explained the multiple bars and restaurants, one of which boasts three Michelin stars (be sure to reserve in advance for that culinary experience).

We explored the three downstairs bars, each with its own unique charm. Two of them had DJs playing lively music, perfect for a Saturday evening. Despite being busy, they were incredibly accommodating for walk-ins. My friend and I indulged in some delightful small bites and exquisite drinks at the middle bar, where everything was absolutely wonderful, and the service was impeccable.

Just when I thought my night was ending, I met Simon. He convinced me to stay a little longer and experience more of what Sketch has to offer. He graciously escorted me to the East Bar, a futuristic haven that feels like stepping into a spaceship and being transported to a world of mesmerizing art and fantastic music. Luc (Luke), the charming bartender, crafted phenomenal drinks and engaged in delightful, meaningful conversations with his guests. The couple next to me couldn't stop raving about their cocktails and service.

Every staff member I encountered that night exuded pride in their roles and went above and beyond to ensure I had a memorable experience. I had an outstanding evening, with every aspect surpassing my expectations. My gratitude goes out to the team at Sketch for their warm hospitality and for making the night truly unforgettable. I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Great decor and the drinks were amazing! They even did a surprise birthday dessert. Espresso martini was amazing.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
The fancy Sketch restaurant was even more beautiful in person. The bathrooms are their most popular spot, so definitely don't miss that. It looks even better than some art museums. We had to come here after seeing so many instagram posts over the years!

This was the first afternoon tea that I've ever heard of being all you can eat, and you can get boxes at the end to bring stuff home. So that got me really excited... however, your second order will take FOREVER to come out. Sometimes they won't even remember that you wanted more of a certain item. And even after constantly reminding them, they still don't bring it out. So was it worth £80? Probably not.

Also don't get bamboozled by the £1 at the end, they automatically add it to your bill but you can ask the server to remove it.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: What a treat for a fancy afternoon tea. The sandwiches were amazing, and the sparkling rose was perfection. The decor is so fun, and the staff is so kind.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: I have seen posts about this place for over a year, so I was SO excited to finally be able to experience it!! Made reservations for High Tea. Such cool, interesting decor! Tea service was about 4 courses, so we ended up taking A LOT of food home!! Some of it was "interesting" (caviar lolipops??) but definitely a great time!! I had to visit the famous bathroom and they did not disappoint!! Hard to explain but very futuristic and modern!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Imagine stepping into a technicolor dream in the heart of Mayfair. That's exactly what Sketch feels like! I visited in January 2024, and it was an experience that's still glowing bright in my memory.

Forget beige tablecloths and predictable decor. Sketch is a kaleidoscope of vibrant spaces, each one more outrageous than the last. One room feels like you've stepped into a Wes Anderson dream, all sunshine yellow and plush velvet. Another is a gallery come to life, with fantastical art that practically leaps off the walls (with the help of a cool AR app!).

But the beauty goes beyond the aesthetics. The service at Sketch is like a perfectly choreographed ballet. The staff are attentive without being intrusive, their knowledge of the menu and wine list is impressive, and they play their part in the overall theatrical experience.

Speaking of the menu, well, that's another adventure entirely. Chef Frédéric Don's creations are playful and artistic, with flavor combinations that will surprise and delight. It's more than just a meal; it's a journey for the tastebuds.

Now, be warned, Sketch isn't for the faint of wallet. It's a splurge, for sure. But if you're looking for a truly unique and unforgettable dining experience, then this is your place. In January, the festive spirit must have added another layer of magic to the whole sunshine-filled atmosphere.

So, if you're looking to escape the ordinary and treat yourself to a night of culinary and visual delights, then Sketch is a must-visit. Just be prepared to have your world turned upside down (in the best way possible)!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: This was definitely not the place for a true Afternoon Tea experience. The food is sub par and the most unthinkable thing happened. . . They ran out of 3 teas that we requested. How does a restaurant serving tea time with only 10 tea choices run out of tea? Even the ambiance is pretty cheesy, except for the restroom. So I guess just walk in and request to use the bathroom and save yourself $100 per person.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Honestly such a vibe ! This place not only has amazing tea but also is so beautiful. I really love how the staff was completely attentive the whole time and kindly catered to my needs. I will be coming back here consistently! Now my favorite place in London !

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: The ambiance is amazing. It's definitely an experience. The tea is delicious and the treats are abundant.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Best afternoon tea. Great service. Amazing place. Has a real cool vibe. Beautiful interior. A must try.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
When you enter through the dim hallway going deep inside this building, you feel like Alice passing through the looking glass and following the rabbit down the hole. The two separate dining rooms have different motifs, one with an under the sea Little Mermaid vibe and the other, a brightly painted whimsical Wonderland. You would think this place popped out of Lewis Carroll's head. The atmosphere is surreal and you feel like you're joining the Mad Hatter, the March Hare and the Dormouse for high tea. And there is a three piece string ensemble in the corner playing popular tunes on violin, viola & cello. The ladies did very good instrumental renditions of Coldplay's Viva La Vida and Justin Bieber's Sorry.

We are here for high tea with friends and the tea selection is excellent. Since we could order as much and as many different teas as we wanted, I started with the black teas, first a pot of Earl Grey and then Darjeeling. All tea pots are individual and serves about 2 cups. Then I moved onto the Phoenix Honey Orchid, which was very mild and my favorite. Of course, I had to have it with honey, which came in a little carafe. My last pot was the Organic Dragon Well green tea.

The tea sandwich and cake tiered tray is the main event. Each of the sandwiches, the Coronation Chicken, Cucumber, Salmon & Ricotta and Croque Monsieur are cut into finger length rectangles. The chicken and ham & cheese of the Croque Monsieur were excellent, but I was surprised I really liked the cucumber as well. Request as many more sandwiches as you like and they will bring more. But don't forget the sweet side of the tiers with multiple cakes.

Then things got a little strange. Having consumed so much tea, I was first to seek the rest rooms, which were in an adjacent room. I thought I was transported to Woody Allen's movie Sleeper. Up the stairs into the stark white high ceiling room was a bunch of 6' tall white egg pods which reminded me of Robin Williams, Mork's spaceship from Ork. I had to ask the attendant in a maid's uniform to find me an available "egg". Someone please pinch me. At the bottom of the room was a round lounge area with 70's motif that the musician's took their breaks between sets.

The service was impeccable with exceptional attention to detail, as expected from a high end restaurant. Overall, this was an amazing experience that I would recommend to anybody visiting London. Don't forget to point your pinkie finger as you raise your teacup to your lips.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: We loved sketch! First of all the ambiance is so beautiful and there's so much cool art in there. The bathrooms were also so futuristic haha it was really fun to just see. The service is incredibly! My friend and I did the high tea and we also got some great cocktails with it. I didn't necessarily lovee their food (it's high tea ya know tea sandwiches, biscuits were ok), but I think you more so go for the experience and tea. Tea was fantastic as we got unlimited tea for our 2 hour experience. I'm so glad we decided to do this and it's certainly a fun experience if you never experienced high tea!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: The cocktails are incredible!!! We also love the vibe here. The music and decor is unique!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I must start this review by giving a special shoutout to Mr. Angus Agnew, the guest relations director at Sketch, who made our trip to Sketch such a memorable one.

If you don't know, Sketch is a gorgeous multi-space restaurant with a variety of dining experiences. From a three Michelin star restaurant to a bar located inside the bathroom, do your research and determine which of the many Sketch experiences you'd like to partake in. When visiting London, it's an absolute must to come here- even if just so that you can get that infamous bathroom mirror selfie.

We decided to do the afternoon tea experience. We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation, but our table was not ready. We immediately began chatting with Angus and loved his lovely, welcoming demeanor. After realizing our table was taking longer than expected, he made our wait worthwhile and took us on a mini tour of the space! We got to explore all the different exquisite restaurants and were blown away by the level of detail in the design of every corner of this space. It felt like our own little private tour and for two American tourists, it made for quite a memorable evening!

Once seated, we got to enjoy our afternoon tea. Because we came during New Years, we enjoyed the Christmas tea which included a variety of winter themed treats! You'd think that tea wouldn't be so filling, but by the last course, we were stuffed.

During the tea, we enjoyed the sounds of live musicians playing Beatles classics and a ballerina on pointe dancing throughout the room! What an experience.

Sketch is a must, period.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Ok, this place gets a solid 5 stars for ambience, decor, and friendliness. But if you are coming to eat, not just take Instagram photos, don't expect to walk away feeling completely satisfied.

The minute you walk in, the decor is on point. It really is dreamlike. They have such lovely staff working. Multiple greeting points, coat check, and super organized. I had high hopes at this point. We were greeted by our serves, both extremely friendly, but not overly fussy towards us.

The food, lackluster. There are two sides to the menu. Traditional and "open minded" we chose two from each side. The filet was pretty bland, and in my opinion, ridiculously chewy. Scallops (from the open mind section) were delicious, but only came with 3. The soufflé of scallop and fish was off putting. It basically tasted of only eggs with a mild scallop flavor, drenched in heavy cream. Surprisingly, the most flavorful dish was the gnocchi and the side of fries.

Again, lovely place. But the emphasis is on the aesthetic not so much the food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Solid 3.5 experience!

Ambiance (5/5): Wow, this restaurant is absolutely magical. I don't think I have ever dined at an establishment with a unique avant garde vibe. Their bathroom is a must see, you will be blown away! They also have different rooms throughout the restaurant, each with their own theme.

Service (5/5): Our server, Marco, was extremely attentive and honest. When we asked for his suggestions he didn't push the more expensive dishes on us, which we appreciated. He checked up on us frequently and made sure we had everything we needed. On top of that, the food came out in a timely manner.

Food (3/5): Their food and cocktails were average at best. Nothing really stood out. We ordered the scallop carpaccio, roasted venison, and artichoke heart. The scallop carpaccio was extremely gritty and almost tasted like we were eating sand. Additionally, it had zero flavor. Our server was kind enough to remove it off the bill and recommended that we try the grilled scallop instead. This dish was served with a pumpkin puree and we thought it sounded enticing so we agreed. Unfortunately, the dish was extremely underwhelming-- it's almost like they tried too hard to be creative with the pumpkin puree. Quite honestly, it did not pair well with the scallop and for $56 USD it most certainly was a waste of $$$. The venison was not bad, it came with a cabbage salad that we enjoyed and the artichoke wasn't terrible either but again for the price point we were expecting more. The food at Sketch was severely overpriced and underwhelming at best.

Overall, we have been to far better restaurants across the globe and the food at Sketch was not as creative as we had hoped it would be. For their price point, come and grab drinks by their bar so you can enjoy their unique ambiance-- if you are into that!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch you were lovely and worth all the hype I saw online.
Came to London and everyone recommended getting a resy at sketch! Online it was fully booked, but we walked in and asked (during the busiest time of year) and they had availability. They keep spots open for walk ins, we were able to come in for high tea the next day! It was lovely, food was delish and drinks were beautiful.
Highly recommend.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
The afternoon tea experience was incredible! We came in at the beginning of December after booking online. One of the reasons I chose Sketch was because they have special menus for those who have vegan and vegetarian dietary requirements. I emailed ahead of time to make sure I noted that on my booking, and a staff member responded quickly and assured me everything was taken care of.

When we checked in with the hostess, she brought us to a cute booth in the yellow dining room. I'm a little sad they changed the decor from the lovely pink I've seen in photos, but the new renovation is still beautiful. The waiter was with us shortly with a big smile on his face. He explained the courses we would get included with afternoon tea, and let us know we could order as much tea, coffee, and water as we liked. We were also able to order seconds of any of the pastries or sandwiches.

For my first pot of tea, I ordered the Phoenix Honey Orchid Oolong, which was earthy and nice. But after trying a sip of my cousins Vanilla Black tea, I just had to order some for myself! I loved it so much, I need to buy it. The vanilla came through strongly and gave such a creamy flavor.

As for the food, we were amazed from the first bite. We were given 2 appetizers, then brought a 3 tiered stand of our sandwiches and desserts. My favorites were the cucumber sandwich with a quail egg on top and the coronation chickpea salad sandwich, which I did get seconds of. Then we were brought scones (our choice of plain or with dried fruit) with cream and jam. Then we were offered more cake from their dessert table, and finished off with the lovely little macarons. We finished everything, but they did offer to box anything up.

Now we have to talk about the bathrooms, which is the other reason I chose to dine here. Not only are they clean inside and out (I have tons of video to prove it), but they are art. The entire restaurant is art from the moment you walk inside- the ballerina that danced through the tea parlor, the string duo, the decor, and the cute drawings within the menu. It was above and beyond what we could've imagined!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Quite possibly the worst food I have ever eaten, with rude service and slow inattentive service. The restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful tho and the hostess are lovely. Overall would not go again for food but more for a pleasant picture of the restaurant itself.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I'm absolutely sad not being the 1000th review as I had meant to write when Sketch only had 999. Oh well, 1001 will do. (Update, I left this draft for half a year so I think they're at 1036 now).

I was torn between 3 and 4 stars tbh. Heard this place got a few Michelin stars so we checked it out on our group's trip to Londontown. The first thing you notice is that there are multiple rooms with diff vibes and nice decor. We sat in what I think is the main room next to the bathroom (more on that later).

The menu is separated by traditional fare and more modern takes on food. Our group ordered appetizers and main courses from both.

Appetizers:
Would recommend the lobster bisque with 3 layers of rice. Would also recommend the escargot with foie gras dish. Would not recommend the oysters with ginger, not because it's not good, but because they jack up the price for something (literally) any restaurant could make.

Main course
We had a few fish/seafood dishes, pork, and steak options. I tried all my friend's dishes and they were all okay. Halfway through my dish, I noticed my fish was raw. I'm a sashimi fan, but wasn't expecting this...this didn't seem right so I said something to them. They quickly addressed this and made me another dish of my choosing.

I left this review as a draft for about half a year. My final decision is to bring it down to 3 stars. For a Michelin restaurant, I think the food was underwhelming. I do give props for the friendly staff and the vibes. They have a restroom that is well known for people to take pics in.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
After The Gallery at sketch renovated to that hideous yellow, I debated whether I even had to go. I decided the bathroom alone is worth the visit and last minute booked whatever was available in the building The Glade has a veggie-based (with seafood options!) menu than can be enjoyed in a vibey Alice in Wonderland-esque interior.

It's a prix-fix so you choose 2-3 courses from the menu. Overall, it tasted fine ‍ There's not much to say bc nothing stood out. Some dishes were def interesting for sure. I did enjoy the spelt risotto and its firm grainy texture was cool but that's about it. Can't rly recommend it but I do think it's a solid choice if your priority is the bathroom. Mine was for sure, and I was content by what was offered!

for Two Dishes £37
for Three Dishes £42

핑크핑꾸한 갤러리가 촌스러운 노란색으로 리모델링되어서 갈까말까 망설였지만 화장실은 꼭 가보고 싶어서 여기로 예약함. Glade는 육식 없이 생선&채소로만 이뤄진 메뉴고 2/3 코스를 선택해서 먹어야한다 (단품 ‍). 맛이 없다기보다 그냥 애매하고 택스쳐가 매우 난잡함. 그래도 인테리어 하나는 이쁘다!! 이상한 나라 앨리스 느낌의 벽지랑 데코가 눈은 즐겁게 해준다. 음식 퀄리티는 기대하지말고 화장실로 사진찍으러 가기

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
This evening has been in planning for a long time, as I wanted to treat my teenage daughter to an afternoon tea while in London over Christmas. Well, we were not disappointed. From the whimsical interior to the [well-designed] menu with a good selection of teas (Vanilla Black being this party's absolute favorite), sandwiches (with a particularly delicious Croque Monsieur and Cucumber/Egg ones) and pastries (especially the Redcurrant and Lychee Eclair) to the overall atmosphere - it was a lovely evening. The service seemed a bit overwhelmed at times, but it did not deduct much from the evening. Definitely recommend it for those looking for a tea spot in London.

Oh, do visit their restrooms - they are quite out of this world

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Sketch is DELIGHTFUL at Christmastime -- there was a trio of violinists, and they hired a ballerina to dance in the aisle! Our server, Marco, was just as delightful: his hospitality, kindness, and professionalism were remarkable. They went out of their way to accommodate any dietary restrictions we had, and when they found out it was the second time my friend and I had been there, Marco brought us a little tart with a candle in it welcoming us back! The food was delicious and beautiful, and we took some great pictures. I will be back for a third time!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Sketch certainly provides a fun, artistic ambiance for an afternoon tea. We enjoyed the violinists, and I can understand the hype behind the photographic decor. However, the food and prices at this teahouse are not the best. Quite frankly, you will pay a LOT for some pretty gross food yet cute tea experience. For example, it was $230 total (tip included) for 2 of us to eat here - wild! Even though we spent more than we had anticipated for our afternoon tea experience, we are glad that we went here and shared some laughs as we tried to fit in and eat the food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I was in London visiting my then fiance when I had stumbled upon Sketch. The Instagram page looked so aesthetic and vibey, I was excited to have brunch. I made a reservation easily online and we hopped on the tube to head into the city. Finding Sketch was a bit of a challenge, it blends in with the other buildings- I think this adds to the allure. Upon entering, it was dark with neon lighting. Each room had a different vibe- art pieces everywhere. It was a very cool vibe. We were sat in the Tea Room at a corner booth that was very cute. I wish we would have booked the pink room, though!

We ordered our breakfast and I don't think there was any delay in the service, our food came out promptly! I ordered the Avocado Toast and maybe because I am American, I was disappointed. The Avocado was a puree and the poached egg was very runny and burst open onto my clothes. I should have gone with my gut instinct which would have been a pancake but my fiance teased me!

The coolest room was the loo. There were colored tiles and pods! It was giving Alien vibes for sure. I may go back just for drinks!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
From the moment we walked in we were impressed. From the beauty of the decor to the incredible service from the reception desk to our server and the other team members we encountered.
