We were also able to meet the Director Of Guest Experience, Angus. His passion for Sketch and his guests is felt by everyone who enters.

We had lunch in the Parlour and hand a wonderful time. As we were talking at the table and enjoying our cocktails the music changed and a surprise performance happened.

Our server Sophia was fantastic. She was friendly and attentive. She took incredible care of us and she gave us wonderful recommendations and really made our experience memorable.

We started our meal with a Glow Shot and then moved onto a Burrata Salad while enjoying our cocktails. My friend ordered the Your Love which he really enjoyed. They also have my favorite tequila so I was excited about that and enjoyed it. We moved on to order the steak and salmon for our entrees and the steak was cooked to perfection. My friend really enjoyed his salmon.

We are still talking about lunch and I'll be visiting again soon to celebrate a friend's birthday!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Erm... I'll give them this: Sketch is beautifully decked out and makes for good photos. However, the ambience isn't quite as magical in person, and food is just absolutely not it. Granted, we came for a light lunch so didn't try a ton, but both the chicken and the club sandwich were mediocre at best. Chicken was bland, sandwich was almost stale.

It's cool getting to explore different rooms in the restaurant, and of course the bathrooms are iconic. Again, the place makes for better photos than actual experience. If you're there in person, decor is still cool but you can tell a lot of the stuff it's past its prime--bit older now. Overall a place worth checking out once, but wouldn't go back.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is all about the spectacle, and in a way, it has to be; a 3-star Michelin meal is travel worthy, attracting diners from across the globe to experience what is promised to be exceptional dining, unforgettable multi-course dinners, and unmatched service that treats you like royalty. The concept of the 5-branch restaurant aims to capture the magic of a great meal, appealing to elements of the fantastical.

And that is why my experience at Sketch, Lecture Room and Library was wonderful, yet extremely bizarre (in a good way). My family had a reservation for The Lecture Room at its opening hour, so we were the first customers to dine for the night. The six of us were led up a grand velvet staircase by a woman in French maid attire to double doors: the entrance to the most secluded part of the restaurant. Like a well-rehearsed play, the curtains opened and two identical groups of waiters in uniform, lined up at each end of the doors, turned to us, smiled, and in near perfect unison greeted us with a "welcome in." It was eerie, being the only customers in the restaurant for a good half-hour. We felt watched; seated at a long rectangular table, we were outnumbered by waiters, and if we were having a private conversation about let's say, wine for example, not ten seconds later three waiters would present us with an extensive list of sparkling, reds, whites, and rose. It was so quiet you could hear every inhale and exhale; a pin drop would equate to the sound of shattered glass.

Everything about the service at Sketch was theatrical, which is exactly what you pay for. I had ordered the dessert cheese plate which I thought would be similar to the size of a typical charcuterie board and next thing I know, eight massive desks of aged cheese are wheeled into the restaurant, which you can only imagine how that made the restaurant smell. The whole ordeal made everyone burst into laughter and will be the reason why Sketch gets a 5-star review for impeccable service and entertainment.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I wish I could rate the service separate because the staff was impeccable... but the food was THAT bad. As someone said earlier, I can see why influencers or a pretentious crowd would love this place as the decor is over the top and the service is on the borderline of smothering.

However, I am for the food first. We had the 7-course tasting dinner menu. There were a couple dishes like the duck that were pretty good but overall there was nothing that made me say "Wow I need to come back for this.." Some dishes just did not have flavor.

By the 4th course I was ready to call it a night because the flavors just did not marry together. I wish I could have just cut it short because the dessert course was the worst. I actually almost could not swallow it... one dish tastes like old perfume. The others once again the flavors were just not complementary. The "tiramisu" was the best of the dessert and it barely had any flavor or sweetness to it... but it was palatable.

I don't understand how this place got the 3-star rating frankly.. even the presentation of the food was not always uniform.

Bottom line: If you want to pay $600 for some cute instagram pics...give it a go! But don't come for the food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Insane restaurant. Just really pushes the envelope for an experience while dining. The rooms are wildly different and provides something for everyone.

The food is wonderful and don't miss the dramatic drinks.

The staff are very helpful and here to guide you through the experience

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
We just left this restaurant and I'm sorry to say that it was an interesting yet disappointing experience. I'm not a pretentious person, but this did feel like a pretentious place. Instagrammable, influencer types love it here, and of course, I can see why.
Ambiance: A+ very cool rooms and those toilets are very fun and interesting.
Food: Meh. I am left unimpressed. As a matter of fact, I was sick this morning coming off of dinner last night. The Sea bass had no flavor, I did have to use salt and pepper to give it something. The Chantilly lace was just ok. For a $200 dinner for 2, it wasn't really worth the food. The ambiance and drinks, I'd go back. But not for the food.
Service was great though. No complaints there.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: It's all a facade. They trick you with elaborate lighting and atmosphere to cover up the mediocre and under seasoned food. I was in the glade room which was the lunch room. The only food that I enjoyed was the small bite sized appetizers. The bathroom feels like an episode of the black mirror, it has egg shaped pods with doors that do not lock correctly. They have to maids dressed in the stereotypical black and white lace outfits. I do not recommend coming here if you value your money. It is overpriced for the quality of the food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Okay I'd honestly only go here for drinks and to take pictures! I had the oysters to start and they were overly fishy and I'm picky about my oysters and could tell they weren't fresh. The sea bass was okay nothing special. Now for dessert macaroons were very tasty but the chocolate cake tasted like cigarettes.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: We were very excited to go there but our experience was quickly ruined. We were seated 30 minutes after our reservation time and they started taking our orders us after another 30 minutes after seated. Tea arrived after another 30 minutes (so we have been in this place 1h and 30 minutes and we didn't even receive a glass of water). After our tea, we asked for another round of tea, another 30 mins. I asked for an espresso, the waitress came back after 20 minutes telling that she forgot I wanted an espresso and now is too late because they were closing :-). I asked if she could just give me a cup of coffee take away, she said they don't have to go cups. Snacks are ok, tbh a but stale. The place is not bad (in terms of decor), but very loud and hard to have a conversation in there if you don't drink any champagne that is overpriced and not that great. 3 people $500 for 2 rounds of tea, 1 bottle of champagne and assorted snacks. Never again, worst place ever.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Love love love this place! The vibe is everything! Well crafted cocktails, great DJ and great service. I suggest making reservations but not necessary.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Wow- this by far was the most beautiful restaurant I've ever been to. There are several different dining rooms/experiences. All decorated differently- but equally beautiful. The entrance is enchanting.
We had breakfast, and the food was delicious and beautiful!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
We went for afternoon tea and it was a fantastic experience. It's definitely a more unique type of afternoon tea vs. the more traditional tea you can find at other spots in London, but we adored our experience here.

Sketch is divided into several rooms for different meals and the afternoon tea is held in a beautiful parlor with pink velvet seats everywhere. There was a string quartet that played while we had our tea and they were very good!

I felt that they gave us a ton of food and sweets for tea, including as much tea as we wanted. The desserts were my favorite but also loved the croque madame and coronation chicken sandwiches, so we got seconds.

Service was helpful. This place is so photogenic so realllt just enjoyed the ambiance and finally making it to the place I've seen on Instagram everywhere :)

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Review of high tea. I enjoyed the experience, but I don't think this can be the best high tea place in London.

This is definitely one of the top places to go for tea in London, because separately another friend who was visiting London a couple weeks after me chose this place for tea. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the experience, however, as someone who doesn't love sweets, I think I would enjoy another tea place at this price point. Basic tea is 80 pounds and then you can add extra things.

We started with a Cherry & Lychee Martini and Beesou Spritz. Both were delicious, but I was jealous of my sister's martini. I didn't get it, because I don't like gin, but the gin was very subtle. I'd highly recommend it.

I really enjoyed everything savory, like the sandwiches and the scones. I wasn't entirely impressed with all the sweets and left them half uneaten on my plate. They were a little too sweet for me. It is a lot of food though and we saw a lot of people taking the final cake to go.

The string trio was a really nice touch and I like how the tea pots only carry like 2-3 cups of tea in each so you can try a couple flavors.

The most surprising part of this place is the bathrooms. My sister hyped it up, but didn't share exactly why they're iconic. I kept watching groups of people walk to the bathroom the whole time wondering what was in there. I just have to say, it lived up to expectations. I also find it hilarious that people take sultry pictures in there. Those bathrooms might be the main draw to eat here.

We got here 30 minutes early and they were nice enough to seat us. I wouldn't be mad if someone suggested coming here, but with all the high tea places in London I believe I'd like another one better.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
This is definitely an iconic spot to visit! I came for the colorful, space like bathroom pods. A great photo opportunity for sure. If you just want to order at the bar, no reservation is required.

The food was okay, but expensive for what it is. I ordered the chicken dish and it wasn't bad, but nothing spectacular or filling. The chicken came with a gravy and was slightly dry. I did not have a drink, but I heard drinks are good here.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Appetizers were good we got the Duck Foie Gras and Chantilly Lace. Both were insane. Def recommend. For mains we got the Fillet, Chicken Breast, and Veal. All pretty good but not the best I've ever had. Which is what I'm expecting at a three Michelin star restaurant. Aura was cool and there was a dj and bar in the bathroom lol. Would come back but get different main courses

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Wonderfully artsy ambience. Our group went for drinks only so I cannot review the food. Staff was attentive. Presentation and quality of drinks was impressive.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I can't say something more because the food are amazing!.
The first time, I and my family came here, everything so great. Good service, nice décor

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Marco (Croatian) went above and beyond to make our afternoon tea a wonderful experience! Not only was he an attentive server- he even pre-ordered extra croque sandwiches because I told him how excited I was to see them on the menu. I wanted to tip extra (American here for the weekend) but wasn't able to and didn't have lbs on me, what a bummer. I wish all the service charge went directly into his pocket ++. What a gem, Sketch is lucky to have him! Louis who came by a few times to check on us was also wonderful!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Wow, wow, wow! While we have been to Sketch before, this was our first time upstairs in the Lecture Room & Library. It is an amazing sensory experience on all levels. The food is incredible, among the best Michelin 3-star food we have ever had. The service is warm and genuine. The wine pairing with lunch was outstanding. Truly a wonderful afternoon.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Afternoon tea at the Parlour - must be the most artistic, stunningly creative restaurant. Everything from the museum-like exhibitions (computer algorithm aided, very modern website too!) to the neo-classical decor to egg-shaped bathrooms. They've really embodied the idea of "rethinking from the ground up" - every dish surprised me in some way. (Even the ketchup for fish and chips was house-made and with a twist of paprika!) The scones were incredible, especially the fig jam, and paired with vanilla black tea

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
My partner and I had the worst food poisoning of our lives from this place. Should have known from the name "sketch" that the food would be sketchy. If you want some overpriced mid-grade food with excessive mayonnaise that could potentially leave you violently throwing up for hours on end, this is the place !

I'm sure the restaurant will deny the food poisoning is from them, but this is literally all me and my partner ate that day.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is a Michelin-starred restaurant in Mayfair, London, that offers a variety of dining experiences. The Lecture Room & Library is the crown jewel of Sketch, renowned for its New French cuisine. The other sections of Sketch offer varied dining experiences, including breakfast and lunch at the Parlour, cocktails, and tapas at the Glade, afternoon tea and dinner at the Gallery, and small plates at the Eastbar & Pods.

This place is less 'dining room' and more 'castle banquet hall' meets 'Sherlock Holmes's study.' I'm talking sky-high ceilings decked with chandeliers, a seating plan that's more 'velvet throne' than 'Ikea dining chair,' and more books on the walls than in your average university library. Maybe it's their secret recipe collection, who knows?

The waitstaff here has clearly been to hospitality Hogwarts - they're so attentive, they'd probably notice if you dropped a crumb. And the menu? They know it like it's the back of their Harry Potter books.

This is your spot if you're after a dining experience that's less 'Tuesday night takeaway' and more 'Academy Awards of Eating.' But beware, they're not exactly giving it away - you'll need to dig deep into your pockets.

Pros:
* Interiors are lavish enough for a royal wedding.
* Cuisine is so creative it could host its own TED talk.
* Presentation is so stunning it should be on the catwalk.
* Flavors that will perform a Broadway show on your tongue.

Cons:
* Prices are so steep you'll need mountain climbing gear.
* Scoring a reservation is like finding a unicorn. Good luck with that!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Ambience is amazing. You should come here just for the bathrooms. There are three restaurants here, and I went to the part that is cheapest, and Allows walkins and doesn't require reservations. Food is awful though so don't bother even trying anything expensive. Finger sandwiches were inedible. Although the scallop soup was pretty good. The pastries were not very good. Also, cannot recommend the yogurt coffee drink. Service is so so.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
One of the best dining experiences we have ever had. The service was phenomenal, and so kind with recommendations and service. Came for afternoon tea, which had live music and an amazing spread of sandwiches and desserts.

Some of our favorites were the eggs drumkilbo, croque monsieur, apricot eclair and citrus tart. The jasmine silver needle was also an unbelievable cup of tea. Would recommend this to anyone who lives or is visiting London.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Go for the bathrooms stay for food! Very eclectic menu but fun and worth trying! The art and decor are amazing fun!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: The ambiance is amazing! I came for their afternoon tea in the gallery. They have live music, great decor, and the egg bathroom. The teas are unlimited so I was able to try 3 different types of tea which is great! However, the actual food was ok with amazing scones. I would definitely come once just to see the inside, but probably won't revisit considering the price (80pp but I heard it used to be better)

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: A must do when visiting London - we had a fantastic experience at the Afternoon tea. The ambiance is stunning and so unique. Our servers were very friendly and we never felt rushed. The food was beautifully presented - not everything was a hit but overall we enjoyed it and felt very full. Loved the teas and the string quartet was fantastic. Can't wait to try one of their other concepts.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is a fine dining experience you can't miss!
I came for the Afternoon Tea after seeing so many cool photos and videos and wow this place didn't disappoint!

Let me preface, since this restaurant is very popular book your reservation about a month in advance and you'll be stress free. Moving on to the Afternoon Tea experience, from the minute you walk in the place is beautiful! Staff was very friendly and quickly got us seated. The orchestra was playing as we walked in and makes you feel like you're in Bridgerton :D!

The only negative was that service felt slow at times but they were friendly nonetheless. The menu is preset and goes into detail on what to expect along with providing explanations for various tea options.
Loved everything that we had!

You can't miss the restrooms!! They're so pretty and feels futuristic - had to grab a few photos before I left.

Such a fun & memorable experience! Can't wait to come back and try other rooms!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: There was a mouse in the restaurant when we went Sunday lunch. Poor cleanliness and hygiene

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
My daughter and I came to dine for lunch at Sketch on Thursday July 29th of this year.
I chose this establishment for it's decor and the reviews on the food.
Although these two things did live up to their reputation I will say that the service was incredibly poor.
Our waiter was prompt to begin with giving us our menu's but then took quite a while to take our cocktail orders.
When we ordered our 3 course meal we also ordered a caraffe of wine requested to be served with our mains. We received our mains and proceeded to eat most of our food until we had to request for the wine from another server as ours had disappeared. Even then it took another 10 minutes before we got the wine.
While we were already seated another couple came in and was seated to the table next to us.
While we waited for dessert a different server gave them dessert which they looked a bit surprised at. The server came over to their table and obviously said there was a mistake but to enjoy the dessert with the restaurants compliments. We waited for half an hour for our dessert until again, a different server brought our saying it was mistakenly given to another table but offered no apology or even a complimentary glass of wine or coffee.
This was my first time in London to visit my daughter who was there from France where she lives and was supposed to be a very special lunch which I was treating her to.
For the $300 Canadian I paid for lunch I was extremely disappointed and a bit embarrassed in front of my daughter for the lack of respect your establishment showed us. There was absolutely no reason we should have been treated so poorly given the circumstances. It was not busy, I had made reservations weeks prior to our visit so I was expecting and hoping for a pleasant experience. I was beyond disappointed.
I understand that some servers and kitchen staff have bad days but this mistake should have been acknowledged with at LEAST an apology or something to make up for such shoddy service.
I do not live in London nor does my daughter and I can guarantee that I would never come back nor recommend it to anyone.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is definitely a must do when you're in London but I feel like it is hyped up more for the ambiance than the food. Not that the food was bad but I had high expectations from the start. Make sure to book a reservation in advance! As it's a popular spot seats fill up fast.

The inside is beautiful. With different rooms decorated in different ways it is very instagrammable. The bathrooms are especially cool. The restaurant was completely full the whole time we were there.

The service was top notch. The waiters were amazing. Always checking up on us and making sure we were taken care of. I had the beef fillet to eat which was delicious. Also had the Burgundian egg meurette and it was good as well. Our drinks were strong and delicious. I would give it 4 stars because I felt it was a little over priced but soon learned that in London everything is expensive.

So go for a cool experience, good photos, strong drinks and a unique meal.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Unfortunately not a great experience here. Some of the food was okay but was expecting a lot more from this place. Also went here for my birthday with a group of friends and a server spilled boiling water on my back. seriously???

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Great food but the worst customer service ever. We sat at our table for 20 min before someone asked for our drink order. Only 3 of the 4 drinks made it to the table and we only got the 4th drink after we asked after seeing it sitting on the bar for 10 min. We waited another 20 minutes for a waitstaff person to come over and ask us for our orders. She was very brief and unfriendly and made us feel as though we were inconveniencing her by asking questions about the menu. Then when we placed our orders which consisted of 4 entrees, 3 sides and a salad we were told our order was not above the minimum order per. Would not recommend. Definitely a little sketch.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: We just recently went to this place to celebrate our anniversary. Staff are really personable. Service is great. Food is good and desert was amazing. They also brought a small surprise desert for us. The bathrooms are uniquely designed and there is a small and cozy Dj area under the bathroom area which adds to the already amazing vibe of this place.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: The decor and ambiance were amazing. The drinks were nice and food was ok. Service was good.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Beijing Corn was so good me and my dad eat 5 tins a day (Translated from French)

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Oh my gosh best experience ever. I've been wanting to come for a while now and finally made it. The novelty and BATHROOMS in the gallery alone are worth it. Amazing food, amazing service, amazingness all around. Also pls if youre there, ask for Miguel. He has my whole heart

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
The interior design was simply stunning, with its unique blend of modern and artistic elements. The attention to detail was evident in every corner, and the overall aesthetic created a truly enchanting atmosphere.

Now, let's talk about the desserts. Oh, my goodness! They were absolutely divine. Each dessert I tried was a work of art, both visually and in terms of taste. The chefs at Sketch truly know how to create desserts that are not only delicious but also visually stunning. Every bite was a burst of flavors, and I found myself savoring each and every moment.

One of the things that stood out to me about Sketch was how lively it was. The energy in the space was contagious, and it added a vibrant and lively vibe to the whole experience. The staff were friendly, attentive, and passionate about their craft. Their enthusiasm was infectious, and it made the entire visit even more enjoyable.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is an excellent choice for fine dining in the London area. Each section of this establishment houses a different ambiance and aesthetic style. There are a number of offerings: breakfast, lunch, dinner, bar, afternoon tea, etc. Just think about the time of day and how hungry you are, Sketch will provide!

I was impressed by the kindness of the hosts, variety of offerings, live music, and the blend of art, architecture, and food.

Upon entry to Sketch, I appreciated there being hosts present to greet and provide direction to guests, especially since Sketch is a rather large establishment divvied up into separate rooms/experiences. One of the hosts started conversation with a greeting and an inquiry for any dietary restrictions or allergies (much appreciated!), though we had none. We had a brief conversation after that, which set the tone for the experience. Honestly, when employees seem genuinely happy to interact with guests, beyond simple pleasantries, I take this as a positive first sign about the establishment itself.

As someone visiting London for the first time and wanting a selection of tea to try, my partner and I booked a reservation for Afternoon Tea at Sketch. We were able to try four different teas during our two and a half hour window. I recommend the Jasmine Silver Needle and Blackcurrant and Elderberry, especially if you're a fan of fruity or flowery flavors. Plus, the aroma of both is an added bonus to the experience.

The assorted sandwiches, petits gateaux, and scones gave me many a smile. Salmon and ricotta sandwich, yes please. Apricot eclair, delicious. Raspberry battenberg, beautiful and tasty. Scones, so rich and buttery. Of the variety, I did not enjoy the Redcurrant and Chocolate Macaron (the texture was not smooth or creamy, which I have come to expect from macarons), Cucumber Sandwiches (not enough cucumber and unfortunately, quite flavorless), and Citrus Tart (dry and hard - my teeth said no thank you).

The live music was excellent. I could not imagine anything better suited to an Afternoon Tea session than a live string trio playing covers of famous songs. Ever since the release of Bridgerton's first season, my partner and I have made a game of seeing who could be the first to "Name that Song!" He won, again. Some of the songs played included Running Up That Hill (by Kate Bush), Mr. Brightside (by The Killers), and There She Goes (by the La's).

Finally, if there is one thing I ask that you do when attending Afternoon Tea at Sketch, it is to use the restroom. Seriously: Get ready to be transported to another world. Since I don't want to give too much away, I'll just say... the chicken must have been ginormous.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Ambiance was incredible. I went to the fairy garden room for breakfast. Super well decorated rooms. Very instagrammable. The food was okay, I wasn't very impressed. Portions were small, but also prices weren't outrageously high. Overall I would go again

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Very delicious afternoon tea and artsy designs.
The whole experience started with an amazing experimental artsy website. Super fancy interior and there was a small orchestra trio playing in the dining room. The menu was super cute and the server would explain everything in detail. I loved their afternoon tea set -- the sandwiches were well flavored, sweets were super cute (a little too sweet), and the tea pairing was amazing (highly recommend the phoenix honey orchid for the roasted oolong with sweet aroma)! The cake in the end was not as up to standard though, which was a bit unsatisfying end.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch Afternoon Tea in London is a whimsical experience that shouldn't be missed. From the moment you step into the restaurant, you're transported into a world of art and culinary wonders.

The afternoon tea menu includes a variety of finger sandwiches. The scones are freshly baked and served with clotted cream and preserves, adding a traditional touch to the experience. The pastries and desserts are delicately crafted and are a visual delight.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
** Review for afternoon tea **

They have one of the most beautiful tea rooms I've ever seen! Definitely a must-visit place if you ever visit London.

Reservation is required and the afternoon tea is actually available starting from brunch time. The servers were very attentive and professional and they were very well dressed too

What I love most about the experience is that you can try unlimited number of tea/coffee/juices and the items on the tray is refillable as well. So definitely come with a big appetite!

Lastly, you've got to check out the washroom -- It's like the ultimate Instagram spot!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: While in London we had dinner at Sketch - The Gallery. It was a beautiful spot, the atmosphere was definitely a big part of the restaurant. The staff were very attentive and came to check-in with us if we need anything pretty often. Though it was difficult to hear, a couple of the staff were quiet so it we did have to ask them to repeat themselves a couple of times. The drinks and appetizers were great, we ordered the Bavaroise of sand-grown carrots with aged balsamic vinegar and it was delicious. For my main I ordered the asparagus risotto, the risotto texture was perfect and overall I enjoyed the dish. One minor criticism was that I did find the dish a tad bit salty and as someone who enjoys salt it takes a lot for me to notice. Overall though we had a great experience and the food was very good. We would have checked one of the other rooms if we had time but had to head out for the night. I would recommend you check out this restaurant if you are in London and want to check out something different.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: My goodness. What a room (The Lecture Room and Library)! What an entrance! Food and wine are definitely a solid 3 star Michelin. Service is outstanding with minor glitches that only extremely judgmental people (like me!) would notice. Would absolutely recommend to anyone. Will return on my next trip to London.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Tea was amazing, insane, over the top and unforgettable. Service was top notch, great choices of teas, beautiful space, great tea-type foods (which are basically mayo-based things or sweet things), very cool dining area (as well as the rest of the place) and of course those crazy pod bathrooms.

Would gladly do the tea experience again and would definitely try the other dining areas of the place too. What an amazing and unique experience!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Beautiful ambiance every room is incredible. Service was really slow and I paid 120 pounds for one glass of champagne, sandwiches/pastries were ok. Worth the ambiance not food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Beautiful ambience and impeccable service. I enjoyed the filet which left me setting my fork down after each bite, as I needed a minute to contemplate how good food can really taste.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Had reservation for 830pm and they had us sit at 820pm. Ordered food around 830pm for our kids & for us. Asked server to get kids food started quickly if possible since kids were tired and about to sleep, they said ok. Every table around us that sat after us received their food, some even paid their bill and left. After an hour of waiting and seeing others get their food we stopped server to check on our order. Server said something but honestly couldn't understand because of music and their accent. Server never came to check on us to see if we wanted another drink etc. Also never brought the bread basket to the table that we ordered. The manager did happen to swing by the table in passing and say "all good?" Received our food 1 hour 10 min after being sat. By the time food came out our daughter had fallen asleep. We asked server to box her food but we were told they do not allow food to go due to 'safety concerns'??!. We explained we wanted to take her untouched food because she is 3yrs old and fell asleep waiting 1hr 10min for her food and they still said no. They removed her meal from the bill, however by the time we left it was 10:15 and no where was open for us to get food for her. We are visiting London and not able to go home and cook. To top it off we even put in our reservation we were celebrating our 10yr anniversary

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: I usually don't do reviews. If I don't like it I just don't go back, but this is special because price and taste + service definitely is not matching. You are more than welcome to go Sketch If you wanna spend $150+ per person and get ok food & terrible service. Still can't believe how terrible they are. Definitely not going back.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Excellent high tea! Such a fun dining and sensual experience! From the live music to the delicious food, to the incredible decor ... just fantastic!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Wow- this by far was the most beautiful restaurant I've ever been to. There are several different dining rooms/experiences. All decorated differently- but equally beautiful. The entrance is enchanting.
The bathrooms!!!
We had breakfast, and the food was delicious and beautiful!!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Prepare to be transported into a world where culinary artistry collides with extraordinary aesthetics and unparalleled dining experiences. Sketch, nestled in the heart of London, UK, is an establishment that transcends the boundaries of traditional dining. Brace yourself for an evening of sheer enchantment as you embark on an extraordinary journey through Sketch's mesmerizing dinner service.

From the moment you step foot into Sketch, you are whisked away into a realm of sophistication and creativity. The whimsical decor exudes an air of eccentricity, with every nook and cranny adorned with stunning artwork and captivating installations. It's as if you've entered a parallel universe where imagination reigns supreme.

As you are seated at your table, the anticipation builds, and you can feel the electric atmosphere buzzing around you. The attentive and knowledgeable staff guide you through the menu, ensuring that every detail of your evening is perfectly tailored to your desires. Their expertise and passion for their craft elevate the dining experience to new heights.

The culinary masterpieces that grace the menu at Sketch are a testament to the brilliance of their chefs. Each dish is a work of art, meticulously crafted and presented with unparalleled precision. The symphony of flavors that dance on your palate is nothing short of extraordinary, taking you on an exhilarating gastronomic adventure that will leave you craving more.

The menu at Sketch is a delightful blend of innovation and tradition. From the exquisite foie gras terrine with truffle-infused honey to the delicate roasted sea bass with saffron emulsion, each dish pushes the boundaries of culinary excellence. The ingredients are sourced from the finest suppliers, ensuring that every bite is an explosion of freshness and quality.

But it's not just the food that captivates your senses. The dinner service at Sketch is an immersive experience that leaves you awe-inspired. As you indulge in your culinary delights, the ambiance transforms seamlessly, with subtle lighting changes and a carefully curated soundtrack that enhances the overall atmosphere. It's like being part of a theatrical performance where each course unfolds like a scene in a captivating play.

At Sketch, every detail matters, and this attention to detail extends to their impeccable beverage selection. The sommeliers expertly pair each course with a carefully curated wine, elevating the flavors and creating a harmonious symphony of taste. The extensive cocktail menu is a testament to creativity, with mixologists crafting innovative concoctions that tantalize the palate and push the boundaries of mixology.

As the evening draws to a close, you are left with a profound sense of awe and gratitude. Sketch has not only redefined the art of dining but has also provided an experience that transcends expectations. It's a place where dreams come to life, and where culinary fantasies are brought to fruition.

If you're seeking a dining experience that will ignite your senses and leave you breathless with every bite, Sketch is an absolute must-visit. Be prepared to be enthralled, amazed, and utterly captivated by their extraordinary dinner service. It's a thrilling adventure that will forever be etched in your memory.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
From the moment you enter Sketch you are immersed into their quirky ecosystem. Sketch is a delight for all the senses. A vibrant gastro-brasserie and foodie paradise.We must credit our teenaged daughter for discovering Sketch-A truly exceptional experience for all your senses-Go for the adventure of the overall dining experience and enjoy it all.

The restaurant sits in the Gallery, which is decorated with fun wall-to-wall pink velvet seats. Service and food vie for the honors at Sketch. To be sure the culinary experience is truly exceptional, but the level of customized attentiveness is outstanding!

We had several entrees but the Pork Duck For Gras and the IrishBeef Fillet were outstanding. Lemon Panda Cotta was the wining dessert.

Lastly, you will feel like you are in a 70's science fiction skyrocket when you enter the spaceship like egg-pod lavatories complete with maid service and moving images circling the walls showcasing the cutting-edge feel. Enjoy!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
It is an incredible and pleasant place, its dishes are definitely very striking and with an impeccable presentation and without a doubt delicious
I think it is a perfect place to go with your partner and be able to get out of the monotony

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: London's most iconic, artistic, and quirky teahouse, Sketch, is a the it spot for London tourists. From ballet dancers and extravagant desserts, you really have to experience her for yourself. The tea and sandwiches are served without limit and the starters are simply delicious. While I abhor the tea room's remodel from unique pink to dingy orange, hold your bladders because the toilet "eggs" are unlike anything other restroom in the world.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: This place is magical and whimsical it's so cool ! They have different rooms with different themes you can have a drink at . We sat in this 70's theme room and the drinks was beautiful . I had the drop it like it's hot and it was so tasty . Really nice place . Great for groups . The servers were very nice .They also have this really cool bathroom they are like pods . It's so cool

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Tea was amazing, insane, over the top and unforgettable. Service was top notch, great choices of teas, beautiful space, great tea-type foods (which are basically mayo-based things or sweet things), very cool dining area (as well as the rest of the place) and of course those

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Came here for tea at the recommendation of a coworker. I was looking for a place that didn't require my husband to wear a jacket. It was just fancy enough for him to wear a shirt and khakis and for me to wear a dress and tights. I was so surprised at how beautiful it was inside it was like an art gallery. All of the food and drink was delicious. Staff was very attentive. And we also got a string band to play for us during our tea. I left so stuffed! Thank you so much for a great first tea in London experience.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: I had the afternoon tea which I enjoyed the experience more than the food. The service was exceptional, we were constantly checked up on and made sure our needs were met and the staff was accommodating as we could not finish our food and packed our extra courses away. They gave us extra macaroons and jam to take home. However, I personally felt that there were too many sweets vs savory items but I guess this is more for someone with a strong sweet tooth. But overall I enjoyed the experience and the setting of the restaurant is beautiful. The bathrooms are an experience themselves.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Tea was amazing, insane, over the top and unforgettable. Service was top notch, great choices of teas, beautiful space, great tea-type foods (which are basically mayo-based things or sweet things), very cool dining area (as well as the rest of the place) and of course those crazy pod bathrooms.

Would gladly do the tea experience again and would definitely try the other dining areas of the place too. What an amazing and unique experience!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: The service was great, the live string trio a nice touch. The ambiance crowded and a bit kitsch for us but ok. What we were very disappointed with was the quality of the food served for afternoon tea. The savory egg appetizer and finger sandwiches were good but it was downhill from there. The eclair, opera cake, and lemon battenberg were stale, like they'd been sliced in the morning and left to dry out (or even baked the day before). The macaroon disintegrated when biting into it (and was sickly sweet), and the creamy ginger concoction was served in a plastic glass with a plastic spoon. Seriously? The scone was in need of more tea to wash it down in spite of the average tasting strawberry jam and clotted cream, and by the time we got to the final slice of strawberry victoria cake we quickly realized it was stale as well and simply left it untouched. The martini and mango tango mocktail were also not above average. If you want really fancy afternoon tea go elsewhere, this was not worth the price by a longshot.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I absolutely LOVE this restaurant. The food is amazing. I ordered eggs and a croissant, and let me tell you, these were the best eggs I have ever had in my life!

The service was spot on and our waitresses name was Julia! She was so kind and helpful. The food also came very quickly.

The scenery... don't even get me started on how cool the inside was!!! This was by far one of the most unique restaurants I have ever been to! And not to mention... the bathrooms are so insane!! (You need to go to them lol)

Overall I definitely recommend Sketch!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Great service as well as amazing food! We had an amazing waitress named Julia, she was so sweet and welcoming. The restaurant was so cute and a great little spot to have some tea and more!

My wife found this place on Instagram and made us wake up early for it. But it was totally worth it!

You should definitely try this place out when you can!!!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch is always a must-visit when going to London! We walked in on Easter Sunday in the hopes of getting a seat and we were lucky enough to get a table at the Parlour.

The service was great as usual, our order came very fast and they were able to accommodate additional people to our table. We had tea, dessert and the fish and chips. Everything was delicious, and the prices were reasonable.

It was our first time at the Parlour and it was a very nice vibe, much better than the gallery that they updated since we last dined. Of course we could not miss a selfie in the bathroom which we did at the end of our meal.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Beautiful restaurant where every room has a different mood/theme. Service was impeccable! The food wasn't the best I've had especially at this price point but I'd say this is more of an Instagram and people watching type of restaurant.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
We went for breakfast during the week. The place is amazing - every room is just spectacular. (Make sure to check out the downstairs bathroom, which is wild.)

The breakfast menu was limited, but all the dishes we had were very good. The non-alcoholic juice mixes were really good too.

Our one complaint: Once we were served, a waiter never came back to check on us, even though the room wasn't even close to full. We were trying to get butter and order an additional drink, but they never even looked our way once the food arrived.

All in all, a really cool, interesting place to eat that wasn't crazy expensive.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: It has a nice ambiance. Definitely a place made popular by social media people. The food is underwhelming at best. Maybe a good place for drinks but skip the food.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Quite the experience
The tea and food js not that amazing
But the decor is nice and creative not the best $400 i ever spent but im not regretting it

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I recently dined at Sketch restaurant in London and ordered the steak tartare, beef bourguignon, and pasta, along with an earl grey tea. Overall, I had a good experience at the restaurant. The tea cups were particularly enjoyable and added a touch of elegance to the meal. They were thin and had beautiful artwork on them.

The steak tartare was a standout dish for me. It was well-seasoned and the presentation was beautiful. However, the beef bourgignon was a bit disappointing. While it was certainly hearty and filling, it lacked the depth of flavor that I was hoping for. Similarly, the pasta was a bit underwhelming and tasted more like mac n cheese than a high-end pasta dish.

Despite the mixed experience with the food, I appreciated the chic ambiance and color overflow of the restaurant. Overall, I would recommend Sketch for its charming atmosphere and unique tea experience, but would suggest being selective with the menu choices.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: We are in the gallery and it was definitely a unique experience that's unlike anywhere else I've eaten ... the food was good but not incredibly notable. Took a while to get drinks sometimes and had to follow up. Overall a cool experience to eat there once, but don't have a strong desire to go back.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
I think this place is a teeny tiny bit overrated. I am a foodie and I thought this place is more about being seen (and photographed) than enjoying the food. The aesthetic is beautiful and funky but I thought for the price the food was nothing exceptional.
We went to the Gallery for dinner as it's the only reservations we could get 2 weeks prior, so that should probably have been an indication.
The price point is just too high for the creativity and quality. Perhaps the 75.00 pre-fixed afternoon tea is a better value. Anyway, it's a cool spot for sure to make Instagram post and TikToks.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Amazing experience. It is more than just the meal it's an atmosphere that will effect all of your senses.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: Like the biggest waste of money. People go there just for Instagram (including me) but I was still excited to try the food being the foodie I am. Got the risotto. No joke the worst meal I've ever eaten. Sadly, it tasted like dog water. To make matters better the bread they "gave" us was worse than a stale bread stick and it costed $13. You money is simply better spent anywhere else.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Breakfast in the parlour! The green garden room was beautiful. Came here right when it opened on a Tuesday in January.

The only regret I had was not being able to experience their afternoon tea. I was here only for a day's stopover :( As a result, no pink room or futuristic pod bathroom could be seen.

Got the 9 Conduit St Breakfast, the porridge, pear tart, flowering osmanthus, and even donated to a charity back then (only like a pound for Place2Be, not sure what it is now but saw it on my receipt). All pretty good. Everything was about 30 pounds back in 2017. So like a $36 breakfast! I heard there are no more pink chairs though, sadness. But yellow chairs instead? Or has that changed? Well, hopefully the next visit to London, I'd definitely aim to go here again during regular afternoon tea hours!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
We only had cocktails in the fairy forest bar, so I can only speak to the drinks, but yes! Such a great cocktail menu thoughtfully curated to support the aesthetic of the entire location. A mix of whimsy and modern, Sketch is definitely an interesting, entertaining place that shouldn't be missed. They recently changed out the main dining area from all pale pink to this mustard, and there are three different bar areas, each holds its own theme.
The food is French inspired and looks very good, but we decided to just do drinks at Sketch, then move on down the road.
Oh, and the toilets are individual pods.
So pee pods.
Get it?

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: I LOVE this place! Every time I'm in London it's a must. Afternoon tea and late night drinks are both fantastic!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: When you walk in it's very whimsical. We sat in the gallery room. There are a lot of people walking around and attending to tables, almost too many it at some points. The chairs are uncomfortable and heavy and mine wobbled so I had to ask someone to switch it out. I ordered oysters and scallops. It was unfortunate that they can't make any changes to dishes as I would have preferred the risotto but with some additional protein. The oysters were presented well, with dry ice, but were too large (I prefer less meat and a hugger salinity) and had an unnecessary slab of butter on each. The frozen mignonette they came with though, amazing. My scallops were mostly raw except for a seared top and the sauce they came with was good. I'm happy we got the bread as I would have left hungry but the bread was neither warm nor was it soft and the butter was hard and nothing special. Overall this place is a little too pretentious for me.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: My wife booked us at the Gallery last night, which was an amazing experience. The ambiance showcases the bright hues of a cocktail room, reminiscent of a golden era. Filippo and the rest of the staff were very accommodating and attentive to our needs. They helped create a delicious meal from start to finish, paired with some good English sparking and wine. If you're looking for some great food with a relaxing vibe, the Gallery is the place to go. We are looking forward to returning to enjoy the Library experience later in the future.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Maybe the coolest restaurant we visited. The room for afternoon tea is really something else. Live music is perfect. Pretty decent amount of food here although everything is obviously very small. All prix fixe. Good sized champagne menu.

If it isn't obvious, this place is expensive. Be prepared so shell out $$$$ especially if you're drinking.

Would like to come back for lunch or a drink in one of the other rooms.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Sketch was a common thread in a few blogs I read about the best afternoon tea in London. Although I had a fantastic time at Sketch, I wouldn't say it was the best tasting afternoon tea food I've ever had. This title is reserved for a place I had in Malaysia. Nonetheless, Sketch is nearly a 5-star rating and deserves to be experienced at least once.

I totally get the appeal of the place. Sketch - in its entirety - was a feast for my eyes. They have multiple rooms that were eye-popping and/or avant garde. Even the bathrooms make a statement. GO SEE THE BATHROOMS.

I made reservations for afternoon tea in "The Gallery" at 12:30pm. This is the famous "pink room" that I read about. It was very elegant, and I loved the ambiance. The string trio (2 violinists and celloist) were phenomenal! They played contemporary music and were so good at it.

Customer service was excellent. Our server was so friendly and helpful. He was fairly attentive, but it wasn't hard to flag down someone if we needed assistance.

I could go down the menu list to describe everything I ate, but I'll summarize the food review on the favorite things I had.

The egg cream appetizer was incredible. I've never had anything like it. The texture was smooth and silky, and it had a bold, rich taste of egg yolk.

My favorite sandwiches were the smoked salmon and coronation chicken sandwiches. The smoked salmon tasted very fresh. I enjoyed the curry flavor of the coronation chicken.

I loved the mango tart and the desserts in the cups. There's sweet cream in both, which was the highlight of these desserts.

Lastly, Sketch made great scones. Personally I like clotted that's light and airy. The cream provided had the consistency of gelato.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: What a unique dining experience at Sketch. It feels like you're walking right into an Alice in Wonderland like world from the start. The ambience reminds me of a trippy Disney experience. Even the bathroom have included a fun twist. The wait staff were super polite and helpful throughout the night. The drinks were great and the food was top notch. The Risotto was the star of the evening. Super creamy and cooked very well. Definitely plan on visiting again while in London.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: This is the worst meal I've ever had. Also extremely overpriced for nothing. The tea room is totally hyped up because of the decor but you could not pay me to go back and eat that meal. Don't be tricked!!

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
First time at Sketch and found the atmosphere cold and unwelcoming. The staff at reception was more concerned with finding a way to turn would be patrons away rather than making customers feel welcome and appreciate their business. The staff came across as pretentious and uncaring and spent more time worrying about their appearance than in making customers have a memorable experience.

The food was bland and ordinary. The fishes lacked imagination as well as seasoning. The dishes came across as trying too hard and the service was lackluster and dry.

Not worthy of a second try.

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text:
Okay this place is pretty awesome, expensive but awesome! We went here to see what afternoon tea is about and could not pass up on a reservation to SKETCH! So iconic with the pink room. Presentation of food, decor, and customer service was outstanding!

Afternoon tea here is pricey especially with champagne, but the food and tea itself is unlimited. The finger sandwiches were small but so delicous. We only did got seconds on a few sandwiches and desserts, we were shock at how full we both were! We couldn't finish all of it so they were kind enough to pack our goodies into boxes, the scones and clotted cream with jam was the best thing I ever ate; so simple! We spent about 350 USD$ for two people, one person got champagne. If I was here again I would ask for 10 scones to take home.

We came during Christmas (highly recommend) the theme of the food was so festive! We also had a ballerina come out and dance it was so lovely!

If you're looking for a special treat

Name: Sketch, The Lecture Room & Library
Review_Text: After eating at four Michelin three-star restaurants in the past few months this was the best. First of all, the Lecture Room is like something out of a Fellini movie. A large Pegasus dominates the room. It is filled with bright colors and looks like an amusement park. The festive aspect of the room carries out to the service. Everyone is happy and pleased to be of service. Then there is the food. Off the charts. There was not a dish that did not receive a high standard. The food was beautiful, but most of all it was flavorful. And just the right balance so that the flavors did not mix together but held their own distinctive flavor. You can taste all of the various notes in each bite. The price point, too, was a bargain. We had four courses for lunch at 125 pounds each. It included a bottle of wine too. With tax it was 288 pounds. Among the many one-, two- and three-star restaurants, this Sketch offered the best value for the money. One note, there is also a vegetarian option and a vegetarian restaurant and bar below. All are festive and fun.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text:
Fantastic!

The food was amazing, every course.

An airy but warm space, reasonable room between tables.

They easily accommodated my aversion to sweetbreads and even changed the wine pairing.

Service was perfect. Courteous and attentive.

They organized a taxi for me, perfectly timed so that I had no wait after paying the bill.

I highly recommend The Ledbury. It's my new favorite restaurant in London.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text:
Simply incredible!!!
Booked the reservation when it was a 2-Michelin star and able to short time prior they received their 3rd star.

Service 10/10
Food 10/10
Pace of meal10/10
The space 10/10

We dined at lunch and chose the 8-course menu with wine pairing.

EXQUISITE experience

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text:
Been wanting to come here for a very long time and glad we finally made it. Four of us came for dinner and all of us walked out with big smiles. The evening was exquisite, service on point, friendly and funny staff and food that was exceptionally good and not a single course I did not like.

I had told them about our food restrictions before hand and they had individual menus prepared for each person, that alone is worthy of three stars. Their attention to detail is really amazing here. The food started arriving and course after course was amazing flavour, fabulous presentation, and the staff were just great with us in responding to our questions and elaborating as needed. My favourites of the night were the charcuterie that comes from their farm, the Portland crab, the venison from their farm, their home grown mushrooms and the mackerel. The dessert was nice but the pralines that came with the coffee put me on cloud 9 :-) the truffle praline was exquisite to say the least. They even gave me a small bag of those to take home, that's very special.

Great but expensive wine list, exceptional service and we never had to ask for anything during the evening and service with a smile. Loved every bit of this place and I would come back in a heartbeat. I was apprehensive considering I had been waiting a long while to get here but, they delivered beyond expectation.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text: had a lovely evening here. menu was the tasting menu. nice selection of wines. service is impeccable.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text: Amazing dinner! Nicest staff! The wine pairing was especially fun and I highly recommend it.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text:
Just got through with dinner. Nice airy yet small restaurant in a quaint neighborhood in Notting Hill.

Tasting menu was $145 GBP so about $219 USD per person. They offer 8 items. We choose the 6 item menu as there were a couple of items on the menu I'm not fond of.

The appetizers were delicious. Melt in your mouth delicious. The service was what you'd expect from a 2 Michelin star restaurant. Prompt, knowledgeable and very professional.

The sommelier was friendly and a perfect fit for The Ledbury. The ONLY reason we're giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the size of the portions of wine. They're literally tasting size yet you're charged for a full glass. They're not even a quarter of a glass. I've never seen anything like it. Coming from California and visiting Napa regularly we found this disappointing.

I hope they revisit that as I'm positive we're not the first people to comment on this. The wine selections were good but not worth the money if you decide to buy just a glass and not a bottle

Other than that try this restaurant. The food it wonderful.

Name: The Ledbury
Review_Text:
Fantastic dishes recently came here for lunch.
The dish was top-notch and had a decent taste in addition to being incredibly delicious and amazing. Fresh fish as well as salads.
Our lunch was delivered quickly and with good service.
The setting was wonderful inside as well as outside. good atmosphere We had a satisfying meal here. Most likely, we'll return.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text:
The biggest problem with eating dim sum is: there could be too many delicious bites to describe.

The restaurant itself is pretty big, maybe 60 seats including a dozen at the bar, and almost every seat was full during my weekday prixe-fixe lunch.

The servers were knowledgeable and personable... and busy.  A small new item arrived in front of me about every 5 minutes, plus the wines.

And the food was excellent: the "999 layered scallop puff," was technically exacting, and beautifully presented...

The "Memories of Peking Duck," was also delicious, although I can't ever remember having shaved truffle and caviar on my Peking duck... my local Cantonese restaurant must be in a more "working class" neighborhood.

The problem, of course, is everyone, including me, loves each bite, and wants more... but doesn't want to wait for the next visit. 

2024 04 30. M2.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text:
Food 4.5/5.0
Service 4.0/5.0
Value 3.0/5.0
Decor 4.0/5.0
Overall 4.5/5.0

Very cool spot in what has become a not-that-cool part of town. The dinner prix fixe pricing was certainly not shy, but the courses were aplentiful and felt okay. A bit disconcerting that few if any diners appeared to be Chinese, though the profile of the kitchen was comforting. The courses are designed to take the diner through certain regions of China. The food in general was reasonably creative and quite delish. Glad to see good Chinese food in town. Would love to come back for dim sum one day.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text:
We made a reservation here for a la carte lunch, and it was a wonderful experience, but not all of the food was a total hit. Everything is priced by the piece, so it does add up.

I definitely had some favorites and some I wouldn't order again, but everything was beautifully plated and I had a wonderful experience. One of my favorites was the scallop cheung fun. They had such unique and innovative plays on traditional dim sum food. Like the shumai and har gao were even done differently than usual (and done extremely well!!).

The service was also quite nice, but I did have to get their attention a couple times to notice I needed a refill on my tea. The restaurant itself was set up in an interesting way. If you arrive early, they take you to a waiting area in their basement which is quite interesting. However, I'm not a fan of their outdoor dining section--it feels a little makeshift and doesn't feel as upscale as what you might expect a 2 Michelin star place to feel like.

I'd love to come back here to do the tasting menu for dinner as I hear it's a bit different from the lunch menu. Overall, will likely be back, but it is pricey with some hits and misses, so won't be a regular occurrence.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text: It's been 3 months since I visited A. Wong, and the duck yolk custard bun still lives rent free in my mind. I think about it daily and look forward to my next visit.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text: What an incredible experience. Tashi and Matthew gave my mother and I an incredible dim sum experience. This restaurant is worth every Michelin star.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text:
Food: unnecessarily fussy
Service / ambiance: far from 2 Michelin worthy
Value: very subpar

I would not eat here again or recommend that anybody does for the price they charge. How this place got a Michelin star let alone two, I'll never know. The experience is just not worth the money, time, or distinction. Was it bad? Far from. It was perfectly okay. But okay is many steps from 2 Michelin stars or 225 pounds per person.

Strike 1: being locked out of the restaurant on arrival. 5pm seating reservation, arrived at 4:55 and was sent out in the cold bc they weren't ready as if we were the strange ones for being basically on time. 2 other parties arrived while we waited, all equally as confused, and they let us in late. Odd to make that first impression. Any other restaurant would welcome us in to wait at the bar with a drink in hand or something.

Strike 2: being sat basically outside in the makeshift enclosed terrace space. The draft every time someone opened the door. The streetside smoke that wafted in. The little lawn chairs, practically, that we sat in. Not at all the cozy and comfortable hospitality you'd expect.

That's before the food actually began to arrive.
I really wanted to like this food. We just ate at ATOMIX where they masterfully elevate korean cuisine and I wanted so much to see the same done for Chinese food. But it was very much showing technique for the sake of technique, fussiness for the sake of fussiness, but also ends up being a jack of all trades, master of none t type of situation.

I had a mediocre lukewarm soup dumpling. A mediocre cold tiny helping of Tofu pudding, a muffled down version of Yunnan raw beef salad, hand pulled noodles that got fried (but you typically eat that for the texture, not to be just shown a video of the technique??).. Basically all things you'd get for much better at a regular restaurant that specializes in these regions,at a fraction of the price. The dining experience here and the versions of these dishes didn't elevate the original dish with technique (in fact the original dishes are simple, humble but very technique heavy), did not provide a point of view from the chef, and was not anchored by and did not portray an authentic experience from the chef. These are the reasons you eat at a 2 Michelin star restaurant for many times the price. A wong's menu did not deliver.

the actual service - It was not rude, but also was a little clumsy, disingenuous, and impersonal. The backservers were actually super sweet but they were not trained for the elevated dining style. I personally don't care about service etiquette at all, but the stark contrast between the roles is kind of jarring. Probably the worst service we had in London and at the nicest restaurant we booked. I would just prefer a polished concept at least to be deserving of the price tag.

This was the most disappointing meal in our 2 week trip to Europe. Sadly a wong did not properly elevate Chinese cuisine to the western stage, in my view as a Chinese-American diner.

Name: A.Wong
Review_Text:
Typically, I wouldn't write about a restaurant that I didn't like, but A. Wong--the Chinese restaurant outside of China with the most Michelin stars--was that much of a crushing disappointment. With waiting lists until November, my mom and I literally ran across London when we got a call that they could squeeze us in.

Alas, the food just wasn't that good. For every dish, we could think of a significantly cheaper restaurant in China that could do better. We could make better-tasting food. With every dish served, we grew more anxious for the meal to be over.

A. Wong's issue is not 'inauthenticity,' which may be a concern for some diners. We have loved Chinese fusions and creative dim sum before. But unique is not always preferable, as evidenced by their xiao long bao soup that simply tasted off. Attempts to be innovative fell flat with overly salty or sour aftertastes, and gimmicks like a crunch on top of the xiu mai, or painting our peking duck wraps with a paintbrush, added little to the actual flavor, leaving us very much unmoved. Even dishes where flavors were ok, like the DIY lamb buns, could not possibly justify their price (for 肉夹馍, Murger Han is an option that provides far better value).

While some dishes were 'too' creative, others were the definition of mediocrity. The tofu starter or the beef rice bowl main were laughably pretentious -- a spot-the-difference game between generic Chinese food and supposed fine dining. The pickled vegetables atop the tofu could have been store-bought 涪陵榨菜; the so-called spicy wagyu beef mixture under the corn starter was suspiciously reminiscent of 老干妈. A restaurant whose flavors are either unpleasant or unexceptional is hardly deserving of the praise that A. Wong has garnered.

The best restaurants are good because their food is truly original and memorable, not just aesthetically interesting. A. Wong offers nothing special in flavor, service, or environment, yet is exorbitantly priced. Our repeated lamentation of the night was: what were you thinking, Michelin?

Dined: September 6, 2021

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text: Located on the ground floor of one of the most beautiful and ornate buildings in all of London, The Bibendum Oyster Bar was a very nice place for an early pre-show bite to eat. Service and food do not quite live up to the surroundings, but the casual vibe, nice wine list and very good food were exactly what we wanted. In particular, the fish and chips main course was an elevated version of the British staple and excellent! Recommend.

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
Unethical. vicious. unscrupulous, dishonorable - I'm trying to think of words that can properly encapsulate the unacceptable behaviors of this "Michelin starred" establishment and the adjectives I listed above cannot adequately denounce the horrendous actions committed by Claude Bosi. Think of someone who might try to push old ladies down stairs and post Instagram pics of the act - and then you're getting close. Think of the guy who beats baby seals to bottle the tears and then you're probably close to the moral compass of this circus act.

My wife became ill this morning. I called Claude Bosi to see if I could move, cancel or reschedule and avoid their 165£/pp charge. Unfortunately no one answers the phones there. I called 7 times. Nothing. I leave a voicemail them asking them for assistance. Nothing. Not giving up, I write an email and ask them to call me. Nothing. Suddenly 5 minute after leaving a voicemail I see them cancel my reservation on OpenTable and then charge me for 165£ twice. Luckily I was traveling and my card thought it was fraud and declined the charge. 45 minutes later a charge for 330£. Same declined charge. I call again. Nothing. I left my phone number on both the email and voicemail. They haven't called. It's still 5 minutes before my reservation but they are hell bent on charging me for a reservation that I have yet to cancel -that in both the voicemail and email where I was asking for help to discuss options. Instead they won't even call. They callously cancel a reservation 2 hours while relentlessly attempting to wield a punishment on a customer with a sick family member. If you want to go here, knock yourself out. Don't think they have an ounce of empathy. They'll likely spit in your food or use other bodily fluids to inflict punishment if things go awry. Bon a petit. I hope the Michelin review is reading. If not, I'll spread the love on Google.

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text: Great no frills fresh seafood. I ate downstairs but inside which was still cold in winter. But would do so again

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
I was really looking forward to trying this restaurant after passing by the historic building which was a draw.I made a reservation at the oyster bar on a weeknight.

They have another posh restaurant on the upper floor of this establishment which apparently has earned two Michelin stars.

Bibendum oyster Bar, on the street level, is the step sister of the fancier restaurant above. The French vinyl bistro chairs were quite uncomfortable. I was seated next to an Australian couple who were engaging and they took the edge off the poor food experience. Perhaps Claude should come down stairs once in a while to check on his staff in the Oyster bar kitchen because what they are sending out is truly disappointing. I ordered a pasta dish with crabmeat , the pasta was so undercooked it was crunchy, there was hardly any crabmeat in the dish and it was COLD. The squid was Just laying there in a pool of sauce that was bland. The fish I ordered was hardly seasoned and only on one side; it was void of any flavor with a crust on one side ~ no creativity, garnishes, or sides... bad presentation and a total letdown.

There were some cute touches like butter dishes that looked like ashtrays with a porcelain Michelin man sitting on the side. And, there were lots of vintage "Michelin" tire posters & memorabilia...The building truly has a lot of history & character, which is what lured me in originally. The oyster bar left me disappointed. I doubt I would return to this place. You don't mind paying good money for good food but you will mind paying good money for bad food.

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
A beautiful, delicious, fun dining experience! The ingredients were super fresh, and with just the right amount of decadence (e.g., foie gras, caviar, etc). The service here was also impeccable. Our menu (£185 each) was:
1) Bread
2) Foie gras ice cream - this dish was amazing. Like eating light fluffy clouds of foie
3) French onion soup
4) Bortaga caviar tart
5) Bibendum egg with cucumber compote and toasted sunflower seeds
6) Duck jelly with white onion, smoked sturgeon, and Petrossian Daurenki caviar
7) Cornish turbot à la Grenobloise
8) Brittany rabbit with Scottish langoustine, and French tarragon
9) Rabbit liver tartlet
10) Foie gras (which we ordered as extra), with crème caramel, cumin, and Macvin Japanese pear
11) Sake katsu with anise ice cream
12) 100% Chocolate soufflé cake

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
I can across this place while on a long walk from downtown to Chelsea/Kensington area.

The hosts were gracious. Food was delicious. Building was stunning.

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
NOTE: This review for the 2-Michelin starred Claude Bosi restaurant on the second level, not the oyster bar on the ground level.

I am actually quite surprised this place has just 2 Michelin stars and not 3. Every single bite of this multi course experience was ethereal... magnificent. Every. Bite.

It all started with some wonderful amuse bouches: a savory mini cake and a beautifully presented egg dish that was so delicious, I was literally trying to scrape every bit of it out of the shell.

The next dish - Duck Jelly - simply blew my mind. First of all, when the server lifted the cloche, I was in awe of how absolutely stunning it was, visually (see photos.) Then, when I took that first bite, I did that thing where my eyes automatically close so I can focus on savoring everything happening in my mouth... the unique cool, creaminess and the oh-so-interesting gelatinous layer... and the flavor payoff just soared. How on earth did they get so much rich, intense duck flavor in that jelly? My mind couldn't comprehend, but it was simply magnificent.

The meat pie was delicious as well - a strong French twist on a British classic. The pastry was flaky, and when I cut into a piece, you could see the gorgeous juices flowing out of the meat. Even the salad... I wish I would've asked how they dressed it... even THAT made me do that eye closing thing.

The beautifully presented cheese course and the lovely sweets were the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

By the way, their service was so special. Everyone was so incredibly warm and welcoming. I love when the staff makes you feel as though you are genuinely a welcomed guest in their home... that's how they made me feel at Claude Bosi.

Michelin team, you need to revisit this one!!! Hint: 3!

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text: Enjoyed the service and food at this location. It is a nice little restaurant in the Chelsea neighborhood. I ordered the crab linguine and my husband had the cheese burger. Both was delicious. We washed our wine down with the house white wine. Definitely recommend if you are close by. The staff were very friendly.

Name: Claude Bosi at Bibendum
Review_Text:
First of all: Claude Bosi is the Michelin restaurant on the first floor. Bibendum is the oyster / cocktail bar on the ground floor spilling out into the street. While both are housed in this beautiful, original HQ for Michelin UK, almost all the poor Yelp reviews are directed at the downstairs cocktail bar.

It has been a while since I've been to the restaurant (Covid), there does seem to be a few small changes change since winning their 2 stars, five years ago.

The decor, food and service are still excellent.

But there seems to be a bit more formality. When the restaurant first opened, I remember that the servers didn't even wear ties, "in an effort to encourage new patrons to enjoy fine dining," or some such logic. I guess that didn't work.

Also, I am glad to see that they have removed the 1920's Michelin advertisement posters which could only been positively described as, "a bit culturally insensitive."

In any case, I will surely return on my next stop in London.

2022 04 02. M2.

Name: Dinner by Heston Blumenthal
Review_Text:
Yum! We were looking forward to different flavors while visiting London. We were able to get a late lunch reservation, so it was very quiet. Service started out great and everyone was attentive. After we finished our first glass of wine, we had to wave to get the attention of another server because our original server was now gone? Service after that was mediocre.
