MUST ORDER: Clapham honey soufflé - divine intervention! I keep thinking about this dessert.

Service and presentation was impeccable. Great for a celebratory occasion or a fancy meal out.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Really great experience dining solo here. The service was impeccable.

The papads were crispy and chutneys were flavorful- I wanted to eat the whole box but had to stop myself or I wouldn't be able to eat the rest of the meal. 5/5

Squid & shrimps 5/5: crispy but not oily, tender and not tough

Duck chutney seekh 3/5: not super impressive or memorable, it was fine

Gongura Lamb 5/5: loved the deep flavor that had been developed. Hard to find this in the US. Really enjoyed the potatoes that came with it as well. The naan was overly salty though.

Mango & pistachio kheer 4/5: enjoyable if you like rice pudding

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: We had an all-around excellent dinner at Trishna. Back in London, where I first had high-quality authentic Indian cuisine long before it was ever available in the U.S.A., Trishna delivered on all counts: nice ambience in posh Marylebone area, excellent service and awesome, tasty cuisine. In particular, the Tandoori lamb chops were outstanding. Highly recommend.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Very refined Indian food served by friendly people in a comfortable setting. I was surprised by the variety of pappadum offered with three tasty chutneys. We ordered coconut curry leaf scallops, guinea fowl pepper fry, tandoori venison (Hiram ki boti), and gongura lamb. The venison was very tender and delicious. I don't always like lamb (it can be too strong for me), but here it was mild and very tasty. The guinea fowl was my surprise favorite and also the spiciest of the four. Also enjoyed my cocktail, a Kulukki Fizz (Ketel One vodka infused with Indian green chili).

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
We went to Trishna while visiting London. I was able to get an early dinner reservation last minute so when we arrived we were one of the first ones. Service was amazing! Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable. The inside of the restaurant was cozy and inviting. I liked the artwork they had throughout.

We tried the Chemmeen Manga Curry [Vannamei prawn, coconut, green mango, Malabar tamarind] & Cashew & Pepper Chicken Curry [roasted coconut & cashew nut, telicherry peppercorn]. We also added a bowl of rice and the naan to split since everything is a la carte. Overall, the curries were amazing and full of flavor. The naan was fresh and delicious too.

I do think it is very over-priced though. We left feeling not satisfied with what we paid. The allure of a "Michelin star" is what drew us in but I would have been just as happy food-wise at any other local Indian restaurant (and for less money). If you do go, I would recommend trying one of the tasting menus instead of the a la carte menu. It looked like a better deal with a variety of different plates to try.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Had the 5 course tasting meal. It was fabulous. Great choices for each course. Service and pacing were right on. Price was very fair. Vibe was casual but cool. Highly recommend Trishna.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Came here for a job celebration! Service was really nice, the waiters were cordial and polite. However they didn't bring water often enough..which was bothersome at times as the food was super spicy!!

My friend and I got the tasting menu which had a variety of food and also sizeable portions which was good. However the taste of the food was generally not my personal style - for instance, at the beginning they brought out a variety of papads and chutneys. This was quite nice of them but tasted really strange to me.

The tasting menu included an appetizer of Aloo Chaat (ratte potatoes, masala chickpea, tamarind, sweet yoghurt) which was maybe my favorite dish of the evening. It was really good! Then I tried the Duck Chutney Seekh (tomato tokku, Kashmiri chilli, shallot, pineapple chutney), which was also pretty good.

For the main course I had Cashew & Pepper Chicken (roasted coconut & cashew nut, telicherry peppercorns) which again was really spicy but tasted not bad. It came with rice and naan. And the dessert Custard Apple Kulfi (falooda, basil seeds, gulab jamun, patissa crumble) had a variety of flavors and looked really cool and interesting, but wasn't my style taste-wise.

In terms of ambience it was quite a few business people, some couples, relatively dim warm lighting, and generally a pleasant place :)

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: So disappointed with this restaurant. Got the prix fixe menu. The good was genuinely horrible and I have no idea how it got a Michelin star. The service was great but the cocktails were poorly made, weak, and a weird lukewarm temperature. The food was either overly salty, too vinegary, or completely bland with no other redeeming flavors to make the food complex. Even the dessert tasted stale and cheap like it had been sitting out on a bakery shelf for days. Save for your money and go elsewhere. Poor food for such a high price.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Having lunch at Trishna was a wonderful experience! The food is the best Indian food I have ever had, and you can't beat the value for dining at a Michelin restaurant! Great staff who really want you to have a wonderful experience!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Both the food and service at Trishna are truly exceptional. Both our waitress and the sommelier were friendly and eager to please.

Although they are known as one of the most price conscious Michelin stars in London, their food is amazing and you should absolutely splurge on the tasting menu and wine pairings, £180 combined.

We loved the bread service with chutneys, the guinea fowl, and the lamb. I also really liked that they served gin from India.

Perhaps what was most impressive was how well they paired wine with the bold flavors of their food. Every pairing was a wonderful match elevating the already excellent food.

The space is intimate, but sleek. And we perfect seat in the front window. Overall we loved our dinner at Trishna.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
I've been trying to find the words to describe my experience at Trishna, and to be honest, I'm not positive I'll ever truly find the words to do it justice. We were not entirely sure what to expect from our visit here, but it's safe to say that it surpassed anything we could've even imagined.

My partner and I both chose to do the tasting menu, largely choosing different plates so we could try a number of different dishes. Gotta say, I highly recommend this as the way to go. I could rave for hours about how incredible each individual dish was, but I will simply list a few standouts:
- Nandu Varuval
- Coconut and Curry Leaf Scallop
- Tandoori Lamb Chop
- Gongura Lamb
There was not a single dish out of the dozen or so we tried that I wouldn't order again, but these four in particular were mindblowing. It's been a few months since our visit, and I still dream about the Gongura Lamb. All of the flavors we had were exceptional, and the service was incredible to boot.

Trishna was not only our favorite meal in London, but one of our favorite meals overall to date. Michelin like I've never previously experienced. I cannot recommend enough making a reservation and swinging by for a meal that will change your life.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: OMG so much food!! Felt bad I couldn't finish it all! Everything was good to great. The service was super friendly, just top notch. Gave it four instead of five stars mostly because I thought the final plate just didn't live up to the rest of the tasting menu. But all in all a great meal!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: amazing experience. tasting menu and wine pairings were spectacular. service was excellent all around. intimate setting in a lovely area of london.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
This is easily my fav place to eat in London. The staff is EXCEPTIONAL. the food is outrageous delicious. My
Top 3 Indian restaurants i have ever been to.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: The best Indian food I ever tasted in my life. No wonder it's a Michelin resto! Wow. By far my favorite spot in London.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Wow this was perhaps the best Indian food I've ever had. I suggest you opt for the Tasting Menu which offers both a vegetarian and meat/poultry based. I went with the vegetarian menu and thoroughly enjoyed every dish presented. I paired my selection with a nice carafe of Riesling which really brought out the flavors even more. Staff are friendly, helpful and informed. Can't recommend enough.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Excellent food, cocktail and service. I would expect when wine is poured to have customer taste it before a full glass is poured. That's just customary in any restaurant that serves wine. Unfortunately not followed and wine that was poured was oxidized and lacked taste. As everything else was exceptional I just didn't send the wine back.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Straight up amazing. I make it a tradition to go to one upscale meal on vacation, and Trishna was a great choice.

Having a Michelin star, my expectations were very high and they were definitely met.

We first started with the drinks which were amazing; we then proceeded to order the short rib, scallops, paneer, and samoas. Think traditional Indian food with a slight experimental touch. Please note that the servings are very generous. Two entries and an appetizer should be enough for two people.

In terms of the customer service, all the staff is very helpful and cordial. And they are happy to explain the menu. As for the environment, it is a perfect place for a nice get-together or a date.

Quick tips, you will need a reservation if you arrive later at night. However, if you get there at the opening, you might be able to get a walk-in appointment. Thank you, Trishna for a wonderful night in London!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Cozy restaurant with the best Indian food I've ever had. The service, like the food: impecable. Great wine list. Need to book in advance.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Dinner here was the highlight of our London trip! We both got the tasting menu and each course was flavorful and generous. Highlights are the scallops, lamb, and shrimp dishes.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Everyone MUST come here. Truly every single thing I put in my mouth blew my mind. As an Indian and a vegetarian, I have had my fair share of amazing Indian cuisine. However the freshness and balance of flavors in these dishes simply could not compare. I'm not usually one to go for paneer, but wow do I dream about the paneer tikka here. The badami broccoli was similarly fantastic. Everything was inventive and delicious! And the service was spectacular!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Food 10/10
The perfect amount of spice for someone with an okay spice tolerance. Super flavorful dishes, and I didn't feel like the heat was overpowering or taking away from the flavors. We ordered the chutney to start, and I loved the lightness of the rice crisps, while the mango chutney was outstanding. For appetizers, we got the soft shell crab, fried squid and shrimp, and scallops. You can't go wrong with any of those dishes, but my favorite was the soft shell crab, as it came with a beautiful sauce. A lot of frying though, so I was already feeling the meal when the mains came. The cashew chicken can be skipped, but the lamb leg I highly recommend-a bit of smoke and a lot tender. Next time, would skip on the naan just due to the sheer amount of food they serve.

Atmosphere 9/10
Super cool vintage/rustic industrial vibes, with some mirrored panel walls and a beautiful selection of lighting. Comfortable seats and quite intimidate yet modern feel.

Service 10/10
Very friendly service, accommodating and made sure that we were happy with what we ordered and the pace of the meal.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: We arrived for dinner earlier than our reservation but were accommodated immediately with a table. Everything was a delight, from the dining area to the service and, of course, the food and drink. My adult son opted for an iced tea that he said balanced fruit with the tea and was not overly sweet. I had a gin and tonic with a recommendation by one of our servers of the best gin. Was a wonderful drink. For dinner, we ordered off the a la carte menu. We got the tandoor lamb chops (our favorite), the short rib (succulent), the chicken biryani, and the coconut cashew chicken, along with two types of naan and extra raita. We shared all of it amongst the four of us and we enjoyed every bite. For dessert we opted for the sorbet trio, a delight. Lastly, we were presented with truffles along with I believe were date squares, a perfect end to a perfect meal. Thank you for being the culinary highlight of our trip to London!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: Very deserving of one Michelin star. Trishna is in a cute and quiet (safe-appearing) neighborhood a few blocks from the Baker Street station. I was too full for one of the set menus so I ordered a La carte items. Got the beet salad (I think it was called the Tawa salad) and I really really loved it--I would highly recommend especially if you like unique/exotic flavors in salads. Also had one of the paneers and it was fantastic as well. For dessert I had the rose-lychee kulfi with excellent flavors although it was slightly over frozen when served. Service was excellent! It was also very easy to book online--I booked 1-2 days in advance and was able to get a late evening dinner spot.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
If you only have time for one meal in London, have it at Trishna. We were visiting London for less than one day so I could see family. It was a whirlwind of a trip that got us into London around 12pm and out again by 10pm.

Trishna had been on my to-eat list for awhile, and I was determined to make it happen this trip for our anniversary. We got there early before our reservations and were able to snag a table al fresco on a beautiful British summer evening.

The attention to detail is incredible at this restaurant. We had someone that explained the menu, another person for cocktails, another for something else. The parade of people taking care of us never seemed to end, and the execution of the meal was perfection to the last bite.

We decided to start with the coconut and curried leaf scallops. Each bite melted on the tongue with a symphony of flavors and textures. For our main course we shared the Dorset brown crab which was nothing like I expected and absolutely scrumptious. The Mango Shrimp Curry was a revelation on the tongue. The breads and rice made for the ideal accompaniment for these dishes. I'm so used to asking for chutneys and raita with my Indian food that we defaulted to doing so here, but it was one hundred percent unnecessary. Everything was so expertly balanced that the chutneys were superfluous although the raita offered some cool down from the heat.

The place also has a spectacular gin menu which tickled my fancy. The server recommended one he mentioned hailed from his home town in India. How could I say no to that?

Our meal finished off with a delightful slice of chocolate cake and decadent spiced truffles and rose sweets. Such a perfect ending to a delicious meal before we made the trek back to Heathrow.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: A must try if you're in London - more specifically the Marlyebone area! We stopped here late one evening and it did not disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious and the servers are very attentive! Highly recommend.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Of the several Indian fine dining restaurants I've been to, Trishna has been my favourite.

The service is impeccable and personalized. I was presented with a dairy free menu when I told them about my dietary preferences, and I loved that I had many options for each course (the two starters, main course, and dessert).

The lunch set menu comes with a beyond generous tasting of different dishes; the papads and chutneys were already quite tasty. The soft shell crab (with the crab paste) was a true delight, as was the broccoli second starter (perhaps my favourite broccoli dish of all time!)

The main course was tasty albeit less "creative" - a curried chicken with naan, potatoes, and rice. I was so full I had to ask for leftovers.

The tandoori pineapple to end the meal was a nice touch. Not too sweet, but also intriguing enough with a smoky flavor.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
Excellent food. Great service and tremendous ambiance.

Very South Indian food with coconut milk and South Indian spices.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
If Trishna was not a Michelin star restaurant, I would probably give it 4 stars at the minimum. However, I have to hold it to a high standard since it is a Michelin star restaurant. I had the tasting menu along with the wine tasting.

Appetizer - 5 stars
Mango chutney is amazing. Interesting choice of papadum but it felt some of this was more for shock value instead if enhancing the flavor. Others were good as well but it did not suit my flavor palette. I recommend trying each one to find which suits you.
Wine Pairing- It was a champagne that complemented the starter and appetizer perfectly.

Scallops - 2 stars
Underwhelming. I didn't take many notes on this but I can't even remember the dish.

Guinea Fowl - 5 stars
An absolutely amazing dish. I am a fan of spicy food but this wasn't spicy. Instead, it was packed with flavor. Highly recommended
Wine Pairing. Somewhat underwhelming. It should have been bolder since the fowl was so flavorful.

Lambchop with radish salad - 3 stars
Lambchop tasted amazing. One of the best I have had.
The salad pair well with the lamb but it left much to be desired. To get the full effect, you needed to eat it almost immediately afterwards. It provides a very refreshing taste with slight kick from the horse radish. I felt the salad was very mediocre on it's owns.
Wine pairing- best so far. It complemented the lambchop and salad perfectly.

Lambchop curry - 3 stars
Curry was ok. It was complemented the lentils very well. The produced effect was a good result. The issue is that neither of these dishes were great as a standalone. I also expected a complement to be better than a good result.
The highlight was definitely the spinach side dish which tasted amazing. Probably one of the best vegetable dishes I have had. Oh, I hate spinach btw.

Torte - 3 stars
chocolate
Torte with a chiki bottom.
Most disappointing dessert.
This is prob on of the best chocolate dessert I have had in my life.
Why is it disappoint? The flavor of the chocolate torte was rich that complemented the Chika crust. The issue was that this crust made up 1/3 of the bottom of the torte. I am not sure why it didn't make up the entire bottom. The ice cream that complemented it was mild in flavor. There were hints of cardamom when it was ate by itself but the flavor was overpowered when combined with the torte.
Wine Pairing - It was well paired. The wine was sweeter which complemented the dessert well.

I was pretty disappointed overall. I traveled to Europe on a solo trip and I had one of the best culinary experiences of my life in Portugal. I looked up this restaurant because I heard it was on par with Gymkhana and there no reservations available during my trip. Trishna does offer one of two choices for each entre. It could be the other choice tasted better but I expected more from a restaurant that has a Michelin star.

Name: Trishna
Review_Text: I was lucky to find availability for a late weekend lunch as I found it to be a popular place. To start off with, the restaurant itself has such lovely character, with various rooms, steps leading down to the WC, etc. Every course I had on the tasting menu was divine and the service was top notch! I was very pleased with the advice given on which courses to try as I debated between a few. I'll definitely recommend Trishna to family and friends visiting London!

Name: Trishna
Review_Text:
This place was amazing - great customer service and the food was delicious!

Some on the spicier dishes with some heat but really bold flavors. Pricier for indian food but worth it as it's michelin rated. I really enjoyed the indian inspirated cocktails as well. This was definitely a favorite restaurant while visiting London. Would go back for sure!

Name: Umu
Review_Text: Everything about this place is remarkable. The service was impeccable, the ambiance trendy yet comfortable and the food was outstanding. My only complaint is that you can't have the £250 tasting menu unless everybody else in the table gets it and the menu is not fit for everybody.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text:
This is the oldest Indian restaurant in the
City I see why its very good but it's a la
Too boujee for my tastes

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: There was really nothing missing from this Michelin-star historic London restaurant. The atmosphere was inviting without being a pedantic homage to India as is common in Indian restaurants. The food was excellent. We had the muligatawny (awesome) chicken masala, the mixed bread basket (which was way too much for a party of two - one selection would have been a better choice), the samosas and a lamb shank breaded, fried and with a delicious, savory sauce. The chicken and lamb were tender and delicious. The fresh, aromatic spices popped with every bite. The service was professional and friendly from the door to the good-bye. Do not expect American top-shelf obeisance. This is more of a casual feel but with an upscale crowd and excellent presentation of dishes. We appreciated the artistry.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Almost a 100 years old! Granted I'm from Miami, an Indian food desert. Previous best Indian was in Singapore, but veeraswamy was the best Indian experience I've had so far. The first dish we had was scallops, good but the weakest dish we would have here. The crab briyani and the lamb shank in pastry were phenomenal. Service was adequate without being overbearing. The restaurant is gorgeous and fun to get into entering through and elevator that takes you to the top floor.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Best food we had while in London and probably the best Indian food we've ever had. Service was great and the atmosphere was nice as well.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: One of our goals on our trip to London this month was to find the best Indian food. This was it! Comfortable ambiance. Great hospitality. But most importantly, excellent cuisine. Some others are more highly touted with more extravagant build-outs, but none were comparable in terms of what pleases the palate.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text:
Stumbled upon this restaurant yesterday and search of Indian food. As Destiny would have it, Veeraswy is the oldest Indian restaurant in London and has a rich history. There is a sense of classiness, and all the staff, including general managers are extremely professional and attentive.

The food was delicious, but expect to pay accordingly, as there was a minimum of £55 per head although we probably spent over 300 pounds, including the drinks with the party of three.

I'd highly recommend to anyone looking for authentic Indian food with great service and ambience

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Service and food top notch. Exciting setting. Great location. A little pricey. My go to whenever in London

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: just a wonderful restaurant. The food is delicious, succulent traditional, and yet inventive. Enjoyed every bite and it was worth every scent. I was at this restaurant 50 years ago and remembered it. It has changed, I think it's gotten better, more refined, and a bit less spicy! I highly recommend it for a special occasion

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: This restaurant is truly exceptional. I have been visiting veeraswamy every time I'm in London for over 25 years. This visit was my best yet. Try the tasting menu and you'll never be disappointed.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Food and cocktails were amazing. Service was really top notch... specially David! we loved the whole experience of dining in one of the best restaurants in London

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Best Indian food I've ever had in the best setting. I went for dinner 8 years ago for work, and back again a couple of weeks ago with my husband and he was so impressed. We had a great dinner, one of the best we had on our whole 2 week trip to Paris, Amsterdam, and London. 5 stars, worth taking a date or group for a special occasion or just when you want incredible food. No complaints. I also messed up the time of our reservation (booked 10p but meant to book 8p) and they were able to accommodate us at the time we showed up. Really appreciated that since we had plans for the other evenings we were in London and wouldn't have been able to eat here this trip if they wouldn't have been able to fit us in.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text:
Having just landed from a red-eye flight from San Francisco, the first thing I needed to do is to find a great place for dinner. All of my friends told me that London has the best Indian food and one of my colleagues recommended Veeraswamy. I didn't have reservations but they were able to take me at 5:30 pm. The signage is a little inconspicuous and I almost missed it.

The host welcomed me by saying "This is the best Indian restaurant in the world. We are not going to disappoint." They quickly sat me down and handed me the food and drinks menus. I saw that they had a four course tasting menu and that's almost an automatic thing for me to order. For my non-alcoholic drink, I chose the classic mango lassi.

The tasting menu started with an amuse - a really small cup of fragrant Mulligatawny soup. That was just amazing and I knew that this was a great choice for my first dinner in London. The appetizers included a Tiger Prawn and Chicken Tikka Masala - both were just excellent and full of different flavors. The main course was four different curries (lobster, chicken, lamb and pineapple) with some naan and their tomato rice. I was just blown away by the different curries. My favorite was the lobster curry and I couldn't stop dipping my naan in it. I am just stunned by all the flavors from the various curries and the balance accomplished in each dish. Indian food in the US doesn't come close. Dessert was chocolate ganache - not particularly Indian but it was definitely a Michelin-level dish. The mango lassi was very tasty as well.

Service was just excellent and the meal cost me about 95 pounds. The best part is that I didn't have to pay all sorts of fees and gratuity like in SF. The dining room was elegant and it's the type of anachronistic ambiance that I really enjoy. This was definitely a Michelin star dining experience. Highly, highly recommended.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Absolutely fantastic. Tucked away and hidden upstairs, it feels like a little secret when the elevator opens to the gorgeous dining area. Everything was beautiful, the service was impeccable, and the food was second to none. We had the tasting menu with wine pairings and it was a great experience. They paced the meal well and everything was delicious. We dressed up for a date, but several people were casual in jeans. We were just visiting the area, but I can see this being a place we hit every time we are in London!

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: 5 stars are not enough for this gem! Worth every pound! I recommend the tasting menu and if you're a wine drinker going with the wine pairing. Their food and wine portions are generous and delicious. Make a reservation.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Good food and wonderful ambiance! Just be the prepared for a $$$$ meal ( 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, 1 inexpensive bottle of wine and 3 cocktails $467USD). Great for a special occasion. We went before seeing Phantom at His Majesty's Theater.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: This is place is a must if you are visiting London and love Indian food. Amazing and friendly service, delicious food and beautiful decoration. Thank you Veeraswamy! You never disappoint :)

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: My first dinner here was twenty years ago, and I was so happy to return again for dinner last evening. It was exactly as wonderful as I remembered. Food was delicious, service perfect, and the atmosphere lively and elegant. The charming doorman sets a lovely tone both before and after dinner!

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Great food, service, and ambiance. The crab cake and lentil soup are fantastic appetizers. Highly recommend.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: First time in London and this was the one restaurant recommended to dine at. It isn't super cheap but worth every penny. Best Indian food I've ever had and beautiful interior in the heart of London.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Apps and cocktails were great! The lamb dishes were my favorite as well as the butter chicken. Pretty spicy dishes so get plenty of water! Amazing restaurant with great vibe.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: I loved the tasting menu and thank the chef for allowing me to order that for my birthday dinner!All of my friends who came with me last night spoke very highly of the food and restaurant both! It was a lovely time! They thought the whole restaurant was beautiful.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: The food is delicious and there is a varied menu, especially for vegetarians. More than that, the people here are more than friendly and gracious. I was with a party of 8--half of us were locals. We were served efficiently and it seemed that the people there actually loved their jobs, showing off their food, and welcoming guests.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: Absolutely the best Indian cuisine we have ever had and amazing service. We will definitely be back on our next trip to London!

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: The food service and ambiance were amazing. Really enjoyed our visit. Such a great way to visit with good friends over an amazing meal. We did the tasting menu. If you are with others, suggest one of you get the vegetarian and another the meat samplers and share.

Name: Veeraswamy
Review_Text: A must go if you are in London! unique dishes but also classics for the less adventurous. we will definitely be back. drinks are amazing.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
This was my first Michelin-star experience, and it was incredible. The modern, sleek interior felt upscale and cozy. Service was attentive and genuine.

We started off with some delicious sourdough bread, a pea tart, and puff pastry filled with chicken pate. I have never had pate, and wow was it good. Salty and tasty - both my wife and I made audible "yums" as we ate.

My next course was agnolotti with ricotta. It was divine. Truly one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. The pasta was homemade and the perfect al dente. There were so many textures in the dish. I cleared my place. My wife had the crisp Sutton hoo chicken, and she raved about it.

My entree was the Cornish monkfish. Another first for me, and the seasoning was perfect. There were so many layers of flavor, and the fish had a meaty texture, making it equally satiating as delicious.

For dessert, the Madeleines were an experience. Warm, freshly baked, incredible texture, and accompanied by vanilla ice cream with the titular wild honey! Just pure yum!

This was a delectable dining experience!!

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: One of the most wonderful experience we've had! We came to London for our anniversary trip and I wanted to dine at a Michelin establishment. From the service to the food, everything was perfect and amazing. The staff was so welcoming and the presentation of dishes were magnificent.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: We had a great dinner here back in November. The service was excellent, the drinks (negroni and salvia) tasty and the food outstanding. I wish I could remember the dishes we had specifically but we will definitely come back!

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
Their pre theatre dining is a fantastic deal.

I was a little nervous that for 40 pounds I'd leave hungry, but I left full and satisfied. We started with an a la carte snack of whipped cod's roe, fig oil, nasturtium. I'm glad they bring bread, because it went really well it with. Their bread is actually a huge highlight of the meal, it is delicious.

I started with a kind of chicken pate looking thing that was absolutely delicious. For the main I got cornish cod, which was also very well done, it could be cut with a fork. The only thing I was meh on was the dessert, the rice pudding. I found it just ok, but I wish they had a cheese plate option for the desert, I'm not really into sweets. On their sample menu there is a cheese option so it may be worth asking.

There isn't a bathroom close by, you have to walk through the hotel, which I find a little odd. Otherwise the ambiance is beautiful and the staff was very attentive.

I would be happy to come back here and would recommend it if you are looking for a pre theatre place to eat.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: Eating here was one of the highlights of our short London visit. The service, food, and ambiance did not disappoint. We had our one year old in tow, and our server doted on him as a nice bonus. 100% recommend

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: Amazing food, amazing service and a great ambiance. Will be coming back next time I am in London.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: Absolutely a five star experience. We celebrated our 20 year anniversary here yesterday. Reserved a table at 5:30 ahead of a show. The staff was amazing and very friendly. The barman makes a superb old fashioned. The three course a la cart dinner menu was excellent. 10/10 would definitely go here again.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
The ambience was lovely.
Michelin restaurant so the portion was small but excellent. The sauce was to die for.
Our server Vicky was great, very attentive.
We were celebrating our anniversary so they surprised us with dessert.
Definitely would go back.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: A bit disappointed unfortunately - on a Saturday night, the restaurant was half empty so the vibe was a bit off. Service was OK, they were attentive but slow and we didn't get to have our dessert before having to leave for the next scheduled event of the night (which we had told them that we had to go and asked if they could bring the dessert out but there must have been a miscommunication because they ended up just taking it off our bill). Food was good but not inspired, probably wouldn't go back.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
Not impressed at all. Wild Honey was one of the restaurants with a Michelin star that we chose to eat at on our vacation. We specifically chose it due to its proximity to the West End, and the fact that they had a pre-show dinner menu. That didn't work.

- It was freezing outside. London was experiencing a very cold December. When we arrived and told the individual at the desk that we had a reservation, she sat us at a table quite near the door. I'd like to point out that the restaurant kind of has two layers to it. An area near the door, and an "upper" area that seemed much more cozy and away from the door. We were literally the only people sitting in this area near the door letting in the freezing cold air, right next to the welcome desk.

- Despite being right next to the front door and the hostess, we were effectively forgotten. It took them ages to take our order, and it took them ages to bring out each course. Eventually a man walked by and saw us sitting at our table with no drinks and no food and said, "I'm sorry. Have you all been helped? And are you in a hurry?" We said we were very much in a hurry and we were this-close to bailing on our dinner. He was pretty horrified and got us our food as soon as. I am thankful for this man. The hostess came and offered a weird, patronizing apology, like she was speaking to a child in kindergarten.

- Even with all that? The food wasn't good. I am amazed they have a Michelin star. My experience with Michelin star restaurants is that if you have a pretty dining room, charge a lot of money, and present your food well - you'll receive a Michelin star. Wild Honey's food just wasn't very good. I had a stew which tasted like something I could easily make. I also had a pate dish that was inundated with anise.

After all this, Wild Honey had the audacity to charge us for our experience. I paid the bill and got the hell out of there. We had to anyway because we were running late for our show.

Caveat emptor.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
I was so excited to make their early/pre-theater dinner part of our West End day. But I shouldn't have been. I didn't find the food to be particularly outstanding. It was fine, but nothing I would write home about. I'm only writing about it here because, well, that's what Yelp is for. The plating was so odd- my fish was served lukewarm on a hot, hot plate and in a way that made it impossible to put all components into the same bite. My partner's pork belly came in the saute pan with a plate on the side. I don't even really remember dessert unfortunately.

My biggest comment is on the service. We arrived before 5:30, and barely made our 7:30 show. We waited nearly 45 minutes between the first 2 courses which is rather absurd. The only reason we were able to be on time was because someone noticed us checking our watches and getting anxious. He was the 1 person on the wait staff who was friendly; the rest were just downright rude. I'm sorry I did not get his name but he saved our night.

We admittedly chased Michelin stars when making our dining plan, and the experience at Wild Honey showed us the error in doing so.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: Service was great! The food was great as well, the chicken was ok, the pasta was superb. And the dessert- wow! The honey ice cream was such a unique flavor and the madeleines were so warm n fresh with a lemon filling inside

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text: We came here for lunch after visiting Buckingham Palace. I saw a ton of great reviews, so I expected a great experience. We ordered sangria and a honey based drink-- both drinks were ok, but not great. Our waitress was really bad though, she messed up our drinks and our orders. The food was just ok, nothing great. We had the quail -- which they gave us a butter knife to cut up--- not ideal. The plates were stoneware pottery so the too dull butter knives screeched every time you tried to use them and the whole restaurant turned to look. LOL it was a disaster. I would not go back there again.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
Fantastic!

Wonderful food and service. The tasting menu was outstanding with well-chosen wine pairings. I thought the halibut course was sublime. A great experience that was worth every pence.

I highly recommend Wild Honey.

Name: Wild Honey St James
Review_Text:
Came here for a work dinner and they had great ambiance.

We ordered a couple of snacks to share - cheese croquette and a couple of salami. I honestly loved all of them!

The eel starter was not my favorite, but the veal main was amazing. Tender, perfectly cooked, and paired well with the jus and sides.

Oh, and dont skip on the dessert! The wild honey ice cream served with fresh honeycomb is

Definitely a solid choice for dinner. I saw they had a pre theater menu as well which looked really good!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
I've now been to most of the Bib Gourmand Italian spots in London, and Bancone is really good. I loved the fried artichoke; the sauce brought so much flavor without distracting from the guilty pleasure of a fried artichoke. The signature item, the hankerchiefs, had amazing flavor. Enjoyed all of the plates, which were sized right for a three course meal. Service was good.

Only note was that the Negroni, while priced nicely, was really small. Would appreciate if they were on the larger side. Regardless, would absolutely come back.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: The food was delicious and the staff were lovely. It was wonderful to enjoy a dinner in London that was exceptional for a reasonable price.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: This was an incredible meal for a reasonable price in our opinion. We ordered the Hankerchief Pasta and it was one of the best things I've ever eaten. Delicious spot.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Amazing pasta!!!!! And so well priced.
Highly recommend this place! Also michelin star

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Waiter so mean and they don't do take away containers... did not tell us until after our meal when we asked for boxes. Who doesn't do take out??)?!! So wasteful and horrible. Pasta was oily, greasy, and not good. Cauliflower salad was horrendous.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Rude hostess who wouldn't seat us as soon as she saw we had children in our party. It was obvious because she was about to see us before she saw my kids and quickly changed her mind. She said they had a reservation that was already 10 minutes late but had to continue waiting another 15 minutes which made no sense. When I told her that she wasn't seating us because of the kids, she lost her mind. And said that she has kids too and they seat kids all the time. One look around the restaurant completely negated her statement. Not a kid in sight!! She was rude and disrespectful to 5 potential customers. If you are in the area check out BUCA DE LUPO which was packed and extremely kind to us, especially my kids and had excellent food and service.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Outstanding! Two tips:
1. No reservation? Ask if there is space at the community tables.
2. Get the silk scarves pasta dish! We cannot stop thinking about it. Wow.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: 5 stars on the food, but service left a lot to be desired. The price was super reasonable for the quality of food.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Bancone has the appearance of an upscale and fancy restaurant, but many of the diners came in dressed very casually. The menu is simple and we enjoyed the grilled artichoke as a starter. The pasta dishes we ordered were also tasty, but the walnut butter was a bit on the heavy side. The staff were nice and kind. Overall, this was a great pre musical dinner for my wife and me.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: The ambiance and service were great and it was easy to get a seat alone at the bar. The drinks are also delicious. However, I was surprised by my disappointment with the food. I had high expectations given its on Michelin guide and was recommended by a friend. I was especially excited for the handkerchief, walnut butter, and confit egg yolk but I found it to be too bland. The texture of the pasta was great and clearly made very well. I also had the brown shrimp, keta caviar, anchovy cream, and fettuccine. I expected it to have a seafood flavor but it tasted way too fishy for my taste. The shrimp and caviar were fine but I felt that there was too much anchovy cream. The portions were also fairly small given I had two pastas to myself.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Went here after my Master's graduation because I'd heard really good things. I got the silk handkerchiefs, my mom got the ravioli, and my dad got the venison. Each dish was good, simple, and straightforward. Honestly, it might have been a little *too* simple for me, but still good nonetheless.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Bancone has been one of our favorite restaurants thus far in London!


Ambiance (5/5): Online the ambiance is described as "upscale" but I disagree. It's a casual pasta bar where most of their tables are counter top seating. We loved sitting along the kitchen as we got to see how the Chef's cooked each dish. We had both a dinner and show which we truly appreciated!

Service (2/5): Service does not exist here! We were actually very disappointed with the service as I had to constantly hound our waitress for water. She didn't check up on us not once to see how our meal was going and when it came to getting the check, we waited over 15 minutes until we gave up and called her over. Additionally, we waited over 30 minutes for our food to come out which we will give them the pass only because everything was made fresh.

Food (4.5/5): Their pasta was very delicious and for sure memorable! We ordered the Silk Handkerchiefs, Spicy Pork Ragu, and Brill Seaweed Butter Paccheri. As someone who doesn't typically order Ragu at Italian restaurants, I can say this was probably one of the best I have had. The meat portion was generous and the flavors just blended so well. I also loved the Silk Handkerchiefs, it's similar to a carbonara. I loved the nuttiness mixed with creamy taste inside each bite. Lastly, if the Brill Paccheri wasn't drenched in olive oil, I think it may have been my favorite dish of the night. Sadly, there was wayyy too much olive oil causing the pasta to get soaked in it (taking a 0.5 star off because of this). I can tell the flavors were there if they had used less oil--- the use of fish and pasta was iconic and unique. Overall, the pasta was cooked to perfection, it was not too hard and not too soggy. Bravo!

*** UNETHICAL BEHAVIOR: On the menu it states "an optional gratuity of 12.5% will be added to the total bill". However, when the bill came out the gratuity was already added to the total? As someone who is big on principle, if you want to charge 12.5% gratuity to all bills, fine. Just don't say it's optional when it's not and don't force customer to ask for the "optional" gratuity charge to be removed. Let the customer choose if they want to add it - that makes it truly optional***


As someone who is a food snob, I highly recommend visiting Bancone! Don't expect much from their service but their food will not disappoint.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Went here for my birthday and it was amazing. The food was delicious, I couldn't tell you a favorite but all their pasta is cooked to perfection.
The portions are pretty generous as well.
Try their signature cocktails, small servings but packs a punch!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Solid but not great nor worth the hype. Party vibe, well lit establishment in the heart of the action. We had reservations and walk ups were getting turned away for the night (but we also noticed a bunch of two top tables available around 7pm). Seated promptly. Some delay for drink and food order, server seemed surprised we wanted it in sequence (not all at once). Starters were not great, dry focaccia and prosciutto, cauliflower salad was bizarre and had clumps of a mayo like
substance and was dying for a citrus or acid. Negroni selection was good but they are small. Wine selection limited which was a little odd. Pasta quality was high, venison and cacio e Pepe were best selections. Skip the spicy pork. More service delays. Desserts were fine, served ahead of coffee. There are much better Italian or pasta focused restaurants.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
What an experience. What a dinner. Call for a reservation and ask to be seated where the action is. Tableside. Chef was absolutely in the zone and it was awesome to see the consistency of the food being pushed out real time.

We sampled three pasta dishes. Because we can. We were not disappointed. I wish we could have ordered all the dishes to try. The service was amazing. The staff was kind and chef....beast. Negroni was good. Dessert. Everything. We just couldn't help watching the food being platted. The way chef tasted dishes and how effortless he made it seem plating. Also, you would never guess he was on full display because he is so in the zone.

I would return in a heartbeat.

Y'all. Don't forget to thank chef on the way out. While you might think you're disturbing chef, you're not. A simple "thank you chef" is enough. Give credit where credit is due.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Wowwwww. HIGHLY recommend this pasta spot in London. I was very skeptical having been in Italy last year but this place absolutely measured up. Handmade pasta at a super reasonable price every single dish I ordered was incredibly delicious. Service was FABULOUS and full of knowledge and recommendations. We walked in for an early dinner with no problems and were immediately seated but the later it got the busier it got. A absolutely worth it though. Will dream of it until I'm able to return!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Bancone is a casual place in central London. I liked the atmosphere of the place. Quality of pasta was great.
Only thing ..service could be a bit faster.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Food here is great. Ambiance is quite pleasant, with a bar feeling, but more private. The young man served us was in very good manner and introduced the food precisely.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Overall, awesome atmosphere. I came in the summer when the weather was nice so the front of the restaurant opened up to the street which was nice. I loved the open concept of the kitchen and bar also. We had a reservation and they seated us almost as soon as we got there. We ordered the famous silk handkerchief pasta. It was good, with hazelnut butter and confit egg yolk, however, the burrata and tomato appetizer left a lot to be desired. Both dishes needed a little acid, but the appetizer was begging for it. There was red onions mixed with the chopped tomato which made it more reminiscent of a salsa than an Italian tomato burrata dish. Interesting. Also, it came after our mains. Overall, for the price point, I felt the pasta was worth trying, but the appetizer was not and was disappointing.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Bancone has three locations and as one of London's best Italian pasta restaurants, Bancone is a casual and easy spot though recommendations are recommended for prime hours

Their menu focuses on classic Negroni cocktails and simple pastas for an unbeatable combination

We started off with the delightful focaccia bread and their signature burrata which they sell over 35,000 orders of annually

As for the pastas, each was perfectly al dente and the duck ragu, cacio e pepe and anchovy cream tagliatelle were our faves

Rosemary and Sea Salt Focaccia £4 / Burrata, tomato, basil, crispy fregola £11.5 / Silk handkerchiefs, walnut butter, confit egg yolk £11 / Bucatini Cacio e Pepe £12 / Scottish Mussels, Anchovy Cream Tagliatelle / Duck Ragù, fazzoletti, crackling £17 / Orange Blossom Negroni £7 / White Bancone Signature Negroni £7

Bancone (London, UK)

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Highly recommended , food is soooo goood, decor very modern and clean , server is super !

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: We were recommended Bancone by a friend who frequents London. We got the Burrata, Focaccia, Handkerchiefs, Duck, Cacio e Pepe, and a couple cocktails. DIVINE. The pasta was fresh and the flavors were delicious, without being overpowering. We had a couple picky eaters in our group, and they loved it so much, that we ordered a second round of Handkerchiefs and Cacio e Pepe . The service was very attentive and everything came out well timed and warm. It felt very comfortable, where we could eat after running around all day, but not so upscale, where we felt out of place at any point in our day clothes. I cannot recommend Bancone more.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Bancone has been on my list of restaurants to try for some time and it didn't disappoint. We had the focaccia starter, and I had the silk handkerchiefs with egg and walnut. The handkerchiefs were lovely and unlike most pasta dishes I've had in town.

My friend had the beef cheeks pasta, which I didn't try but he finished his plate and said it was delicious!

I would definitely recommend a reservation. We stopped in about 6pm on a Sunday and we're quoted an 1.5 hour wait for walk-in. Luckily the wait was only 45 minutes and the hostess was extra attentive to ensure she could reach me on my US phone number when our seats were ready.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Fabulous hand made delicious food. Good prices too, but we did wait about 40 minutes for our first course. Maybe a bit precious in their own minds?

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: This was the place my husband was the place where my husband was most excited to dine while we were in London last month. We went for lunch when it wasn't to crowded. The space is nice and the service was top notch but the food was honestly kind of meh. As you can see their famous silk handkerchief pasta photographed beautifully but was a little too one note for me. We ordered the grilled artichoke to start and then the silk handkerchief pasta, kale rigatoni and spicy pork mafalde. We overordered because there were so many dishes that we were excited to try! The grilled artichoke was my favorite dish, it was very fresh and the romesco it came with really packed a punch. The pastas were all cooked perfectly Al dente but the flavor just wasn't there for me. The ones that were supposed to be spicy could have used more pizzaz. Overall a little disappointed but still a lovely experience.

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: A casual and lively spot for great pasta in central London. Highly recommended!!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text: Everything at this restaurant was absolutely delicious! The inside it a bit tight size wise and they do have set time allotments for each reservation size. We had counter seating, which was a great spot to watch them make all the dishes. Both our appetizers were very well executed. I thoroughly enjoyed the burrata with the salt baked beet root. I would highly recommend the silk handkerchief for the main dish! It seemed to be one of the most popular items and did not disappoint. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was divine! I've never had pasta quite like it. Also have to give a shout-out to the chocolate dessert. We even got a second because we like it so much!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Our favorite meal in London.

We ordered the silk handkerchiefs with egg and walnut, Seaweed butter & mackerel, and celeriac rigatoni for entrees. We also ordered the cod roe dip for app. The dip was very flavorful and the standout was the seaweed butter and mackerel! I have never had a dish like that before and would recommend it if you like seafood.

All the pasta is handmade and overall I think this place is worthy of their bib gourmand selection. Make a reservation!

Name: Bancone
Review_Text:
Very great food. It seemed pack from the outside, and when we talked to the host, she was super nice and actually gave us two options of tables. We sat upstairs and the room was great. More private, quiet than downstairs but definitely not uncomfortable.
Everyone loved their food. I had the cacio e Pepe and chocolate dessert. My party had the handkerchiefs and spicy pork mafalde. Everyone finished their plates.
Great little place to randomly stumble upon and definitely worth the recommendation!

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
During a recent London downpour, I took shelter in The Palomar (with a pre-planned reservation). It was a really great Middle Eastern/Mediterranean meal; with starting with the fluffy and filling kubaneh together with the labneh. The sesame chicken schnitzel followed, leading up to the tarka octopus. Flavors on everything were outstanding, as was the presentation. Service was really good as well, and it was set up nicely for a single diner.

The meal closed with an ice cream sandwich which had me really excited, as the "cookies" are baklava. Unfortunately, the baklava was a bit plain, and didn't deliver much sweetness. I also thought the price point was on the higher end for a Bib Gourmand, given the smallness of the plates. Still, The Palomar greatly expanded my horizons of Middle Eastern food, and I'd gladly return.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Very good food and service ; chicken is a standout ; good cocktails; great ambiance and location;

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
Loved this place. So small and different from any other Mediterranean type restaurant in the best way possible. All the dishes were amazing and incredibly delicious. We split everything per our waitstaff's recommendation.
If in London, get a reservation ( required) and go here.
You will be so pleased

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Had an impromptu meal here after seeing a matinee around the corner, having had Palomar recommended to us by some friends. Host was gracious enough to offer us two corner bar seats with the promise we'd only be 90 minutes or so. We were warmly greeted by Will, one of the barkeeps. In addition to fetching us a 1/2 carafe of nice, reasonable Chianti, he ran through the menu, including favorites and recommendations. We placed orders for bread, salad, and a tartare with no pressure to quickly select a main. The bread, a Yemeni kubaneh, was fresh out of the over and lighter, but just as delicious as a good brioche. To go with it we ordered a labneh drizzled with oil and topped with za'atar and pistachios. The Palamar salad was equally nice, the tartare quite good, and the chicken--richly spiced and sitting in a pool of labaniah, drizzled with orange spice oil--was amazing. We quickly met other servers behind the bar--Dionne and Shia--both of whom were super attentive, friendly, and quick to share stories and ask questions. The space itself is mostly taken up with a long bar, with a few tables at both the front end and more in the back. If you like to cook, you can request bar seats overlooking the kitchen area, which is what we will do next time in London. We finished our meal with their ice cream 'sandwich'--pistachio ice cream layered between two thin but rich, crisp layers of baklava. Overall, an exceptional meal.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: One of the best meals we had our entire trip! The tahini was the best I've ever had!! Even our kids couldn't get enough. Don't miss out on this hidden gem. Tiny but mighty.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Hoy me quedé muy sorprendido dela atención y la comida tan deliciosa que sirven en Palomar ..el pulpo esta muy rico y la arrachera bien suavecita en fin todo perfecto les recomiendo este lugar y no les va a defraudar..y las margarita son de lo mejor..le doy un 10..

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Whenever we find ourselves in London The Palomar is an absolute must go to for dinner - and it never fails. All the dips and bread, ribeye, the beet salad was phenomenal with mint, orange and horseradish BUT the show stopper this time was the chicken main entree. We are not ones to regularly order chicken when we're out to dinner but our lovely server recommended it and we thankfully took her advice. Sit at the counter and enjoy the interaction and show. You will never be disappointed.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
The Palomar was a last minute dining to decision for us, and boy are we glad we 1) were able to get a reservation, and 2) able to find this hidden gem!

The restaurant is on the smaller side, and while we have only been there once, I can imagine the place is usually pretty packed as it was the night we went for dinner during our travels in London. After we were initially looking to go elsewhere for dinner but were turned away because we didn't have a reservation, we found this place and a last minute reservation (the only one left for the night; must've been a late cancellation) that we were able to slide into. So grateful we did!

The server we had really made the experience. I cannot remember his name, but he was a kind gentlemen who walked us through the menu, made drink and food recommendations, and was attentive throughout our time there. The drinks list was creative and I enjoyed each of the two cocktails I tried. The food itself was incredible. I highly recommend doing what my fiancé and I did - sharing a few appetizers and small plates together, vs. the traditional order separate entrees. I will particularly call out the breads and dips our server recommended (especially the white one, which I think was a feta cheese based dip). The steak was also incrediblely flavorful and cooked to perfection.

If we ever get the chance to come back, we certainly would!

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
We entered into a mostly empty restaurant @ 12:30; by the time we left it was hopping.

3 types of bread. The Kubaneh was too cakey, but the pita was warm, freshly baked and unique. We opted for the humus and "spicy experience". The seabass tartare was fresh and had a zing. Mackerel was savory. For dessert we opted for the Tahini tart.

The friendly & helpful staff helped to select our options. The combo was fabulous. I would def return.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
Absolutely brilliant!! If I lived in London, I'd be at The Palomar weekly.

We enjoyed such a lovely dinner here. Everything about this place is 5 STAR. The energy is intoxicating in the best way. The vibes were spot on from the moment we stepped through the door until the second we left. High frequency bustling energy = my fav type of energy.

I usually don't comment on staff appearances but this team is smokin' hot! I dare you not to notice.

We didn't have a booking and stopped in a bit after 21:30 on a Thursday evening. We were seated within ten minutes. Make a booking to be safe, we just lucked out.

My bestie and I both took note of the menu and loved how they listed everyone's names down the center. This spoke to us before food or drinks even hit the table. It's such a thoughtful shout out to the people who put the work in to create such a wonderful experience. We didn't sit at the kitchen bar but I can see how that would be a fun spot too, not a bad seat in the place.

I had the spicy Paloma. It was so good, I could have had two! This bourbon girl also LOVES tequila. The spiced fig old fashioned was calling my name, I'll have to have it next time.

We shared the Chicken Schnitzel, Kubaneh, Labneh, Hummus and Ribeye. We had ordered the carrots but somehow they didn't make it out to us, which was no problem at all. We'd just flown in from France and had chicken with carrots for lunch, so we were not carrot deficient ;) We were plenty satisfied with our selections. Everything was mouth watering delish.

We had a couple desserts on the house which was very sweet of them. The sorbet and ice cream sandwiches.

We also shared a port, and two additional brownie bites arrived.

I'd fly back to London this week just to dine at Palomar, it's that perfect.

Highly recommend.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Very much enjoyed our meal here! The ambiance is very relaxing and classy and the service was very kind. The starters are decent though perhaps not the most stunning example of hummus or falafel I've had for the price; however the mains are stunning! I had the slow roasted carrots and I'll dream of them for years to come -- highly recommend trying as many of the mains as you can!

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Memorable, phenomenal food; great service. Reservations a must. Sit at bar at front window.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
We were fortunate to get an early dinner reservation on our 2nd to last night in London. This was our favorite restaurant in our 3 week European tour.
Middle Eastern small plates in lower Soho area. Kiki, our server, delightfully helped navigate us through the unfamiliar menu. Started with Kubaneh bread and two hummus dips. Sesame chicken starter, followed by fattoush salad, oyster mushroom polenta and grilled chicken. The seasonings, preparation and quality were amazing! Kiki recommended a Chablis that perfectly paired with our meal. We finished with
"Jerusalem Mess" and a recommended Sauterne.
Heavenly.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Terrific food with delicious sauces, spices and vegetables accompanying every dish. We were lucky to get a reservation!

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: This is a hidden gem in soho! It's a small restaurant that specializes in Mediterranean food- small plates smile! Their hummus and labne are super tasty and the chicken schnitzel was excellent. Also the courgettes and smashed cucumbers were excellent compliments to the main dishes. Basically - there was not a dish that I didn't love. They have great cocktails as well- the fig old fashioned being one of my faves. Make reservations early as they tend to book up but you must check this one out if you're in London!

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
One of the tips I got before my London trip was that I should get some Middle Eastern food here. I'm staying in Covent Garden and found Palomar in the Michelin Guide. I came here for lunch on a Friday afternoon and was nicely seated at the counter in front of the grill.

The server recommended that I try the trio of dips (labneh, hummus and babaganush) and the kubaneh to start. The kubaneh was just amazing - it's an airy Yemeni bread that paired really well with all of the dips. I was torn between the lamb and the octopus but decided to go with octopus. It was really nice and tender and all the sauces in the plate just blended well. For dessert, I ordered the lemon and arak sorbet since it was hot and humid outside. I had the sirocco for my non-alcoholic pairing and that was great as well.

This was just the perfect lunch on a vacation trip and cost £67. The counter seats at the restaurant were the best and I really enjoyed the music playing in the background. Highly recommended if you are in the area and just craving some good Middle Eastern food.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text:
Must Try: Lamb Skewers
TLDR; High class service and exemplary food in a casual space

The menu - The Palomar has a variety of amazing modern Jerusalem dishes, we tried almost everything on the menu and there was nothing we didn't want more of. You can't go wrong so just pick anything that sounds good to you! The lamb skewers are particularly amazing.

The staff - The servers behind the counter were attentive and friendly and even chatted us up about other places we could try and restaurants we were looking at for dinner (after lunch at Palomar). They knew everything about the menu and gave us tips on great things to pair.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Lovely lunch at the bar. We enjoyed the polenta, labneh and crab kofte. The drinks were also great. Watching the chefs as you eat is also fun.

Name: Palomar
Review_Text: Great ambiance, friendly staff and amazing food! Book in advance and try the Persian Chicken. If you are looking for non alcoholic drinks, their mock tails are really good as well

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Very tasty experience in a cosy setting. Every dish was a treat for your taste buds (the fried chicken definitely being a highlight - try dunking it in the vegetarian take on 'butter chicken'). Only caveat is you'll be kicked out at 11pm (like at many places in London), even with a late reservation (ours was at 9:30pm). Experience would've even been better if we weren't seated at a long 'picknick' table right alongside (and in the social bubbles of) other guests.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Fabulous food! Best meal in London. Loved trying so many different things. Highly recommend!

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
So many people told me to go here and I wondered how could it could actually be so I went on my trip to London.
Everyone was correct. The food here was phenomenal. I actually recommend sitting at the top floor high chairs because you can see them making your food and it is very entertaining. Everyone here was extremely kind and they were very attentive to us. The menu has option for vegetarians and everything is rich in flavor. Their chai is very good and they have good beer options as well. Our absolute favorite thing we got was the fish curry. This was my favorite meal we had on our visit to London thanks Kricket!!

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Not impressed. I had pretty high expectations of this place. The appetizer was fine, but I had the chickpea small dish and the grilled lamb, both of which were meh. And their naan is also meh.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
Came here last night. I don't understand why this restaurant is so highly rated. The food is awful and the place is noisy, basic and chaotic. We received at least three things we didn't order and we were missing a couple of dishes that we did. I felt we were encouraged to over-order, so I did try quite a few things on their very limited menu.staff were nice but clearly harassed by the sheer number of customers and extreme tightness of space at the communal banquettes downstairs.

Snacks:
Mirchi vada - the best thing on the menu. Light and spicy. Gave me misplaced hope
Butter chicken kofta - also good, the snacks were the only good things on the menu.

Small plates
Samphire pakoras- tasteless. Avoid
Chana masala- chick peas with hummus. Really weird. Did not work
Lamb ribs - basically lamb fat, disgusting

Larger
Mutton curry- ok but very ordinary and bland
Smoked pork belly - inedible as way too salty
Dahl- utterly tasteless

Sides
Naan - ok but they initially have us some bread with green sludge all over it. Don't know what is was but it was soggy and horrible
Meera pulao - ok
Broccoli - possibly the worst thing we ate, but it's hard to choose. It was absolutely drowned in a 'walnut chutney' which was like an overpowering blue cheese sauce. Completely inedible

Desserts
Bhappa doi- a mishmash of all kinds of things which did not go together and tasted revolting
Mango and lime kulfi- not frozen. Much too sweet.

Obviously I am not returning.


Definitely does not merit the high prices.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: excellent food and creativity in the menu. lots of small bite appetizer plates. i sat at the bar and the service was pretty good as well.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Excellent, innovative food, service excellent. Music was too loud for us old folks but we adapted. I

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
Excellent ambience and food, slightly unexpected bill. Clearly this is a place of distinction but keep in mind that your bill will have an additional 35% added to it after they add in a 15% discretionary charge and a 20% extra charge.

The vibe of this place is great. Subtle interior design, wonderful lighting, and great music. Kricket definitely makes a good impression.!

Food is mostly good. Fried chicken dish was cooked perfectly and a bit of interesting spice to it. Brown buttered naan was quite lovely. The daal dish was a bit strange and almost tasted gamey so we didn't have much of that. Cocktails were pleasant and subtle - just what was needed at about 4pm.

The ridiculous charges at the end of the meal were eye popping. I've never seen an upcharge on the meal in my entire life, and that includes many, many fine dining institutions and places of distinction. It wasn't good enough to warrant that.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
Our favorite place we dined in!

They were able to accommodate 16 of us and our waiter was insanely kind/patient with our large group. He took the time to help us make the right decision with food recs and took our different dietary restrictions into consideration. There are also foods on the menu that are halal friendly.

We decided to go with "A Taste Of Kricket" to make it easy for a family style brunch. Our standout foods were: pistachio kulcha, grilled butternut squash, goan sausage croquette, and dark chocolate dessert. I would come back just for the kulcha and squash!

The cocktails were also very delicious. I ordered an espresso martini which was perfectly balanced with coffee and liquor. The North Of The River cocktail was my favorite on the menu.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: So delicious and my husband is gluten free. When we first sat down, the helpful staff asked if there weee any food allergies, and she was completely helpful for him...ensuring he had an amazing meal while still staying well. I can't rave enough about this place with the devour, food and staff. Simply amazing!!!! We're lucky to have found it!

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
Snagged a last minute 8:30 table and was welcomed with great customer service. Water was constantly coming. Servers were beyond knowledgeable and helpful. Perfect balance of attentive without feeling like they're kicking you out.

Started with Bhel Puri, an interesting rice dish. The fried chicken was super bland which is why I couldn't give a 5* rating.

Tenderstem Broccoli was a great surprise with an awesome sauce. Great texture since everything else was heavy.

The grilled lamb was a bit tough, but the sauce was a yummy balsamic which was perfect for the roti.

On the flip side, the fish curry was cooked to perfection.

Skip the dal. Very boring. We didn't even make it through half.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: A delightful and amazing meal! We were fortunate to have theatre seating at the bar to watch all the magic happen! Chef Will Bowlby of Kricket Soho, offers a creative menu that features exceptional Indian flavors. And just as impressive as the food, the kitchen, bar and hospitality staff are a well oiled machine working together in harmony while keeping one of the cleanest and organized work spaces I have ever seen. We loved everything we ordered. Each of the small plates had a distinctly different flavor profile and we loved ALL of it! It was great talking to the chef and sous chefs during our meal, but watching Executive chef Will put his own final touch on absolutely every dish before it was delivered shows his passion and pride in his wonderful food! Everything is good, but don't miss the fried chicken, hake curry and the yogurt dessert. Bravo!!

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: The most incredible "Indian" cuisine I've ever had. It is a mixture of traditional seasonings with a haute presentation. It's well worth the experience and expense. Everything on the menu is worth trying.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: We had a great meal here! Awesome, friendly service, with very solid food. Would recommend overall!

Name: Kricket
Review_Text:
Amazing food, amazing service!
Highly recommend!
Can't wait to go back, the nuts were the best ever

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Very cozy and buzzy vibes in an unbeatable neighborhood and atmosphere. Hand crafted menu with amazing meat and vegetarian offerings - everything comes out quickly and pairs well together. I have to get the pakoras and pistachio naan every time. The cocktails don't disappoint either. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful but might rush you out to accommodate the next table.

Name: Kricket
Review_Text: Amazing flavors! Awesome staff, very friendly and accommodating. The place is small but intimate. I felt like I was visiting the chef in a special place, not just ordering, eating and leaving. Definitely try this place if you like a modern twist.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: Loud, hot, cramped. Lovely server who was top notch. Food incredibly spicy and no option for toning it down. Couldn't discern flavors due to the spice. No typical Thai food and no noodles on this night. Not at all relaxing or enjoyable. Corkage was allowed, 30£. Pass on a return visit. If you go--check the menu first.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: Solo for dinner in June: Really really good experience. People who work there were super; atmosphere and view sitting at the counter were terrific; clay pot noodles were outstanding and a treat, chicken was delicious, bavette was not good (mistake by me and should've known better...bavette is a shit cut - when sauced/spiced it'll have flavor, but was just difficult to eat jerky). Happy to tip, but what's with the "optional"-but-not-optional 12.5% service charge?

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: OMG. This place is amazing!!! Really excellent flavors and everything we had was delicious. Especially recommend the glass noodles. Would recommend ordering several dishes and sharing rather than having individual plates, as the options really do blend together well. Service was very friendly and efficient, reasonable prices for the quality of food. So happy this dinner was such a success!!

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Ambience is nice, food is delicious (especially the noodle) but the portion size could have been better.

Not sure about the hype but definitely worth of trying if you're a foodie and like trying south East Asian food.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Came by for lunch the other day and it was a world class experience! Kiln is a Thai restaurant located in the bustling Soho district and is featured in the Michelin guide as a Bib Gourmand. Made a reservation online and I was able to be seated upon arrival.

Dining is available at the kitchen counter, bar, or in the basement dining room. Managed to get a seat by the kitchen counter and it was a very warm experience sitting in front of the grill. Bring a mask if one is sensitive to spices!

The waitstaff were lovely and spent time explaining the menu that changes daily.

Started off with the chicken and soy along with the rump with ubon relish and they were both excellent. The chicken thigh was grilled to perfection and super flavorful from the marination. The rump was cooked to perfection at a medium rare and the flavors were on point. The chef that made this personally presented this to me at the counter. Amazing!

The glass noodles were fragrant and tasty. The crab portion was minimal and the pork belly had a smell to it...

~£30/head including VAT and service for lunch. Kiln takes credit cards and there was a £1 donation that was added to my bill which I requested them to remove...

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Service = good.

Ambiance = romantic & hipster, yet, casual at the same time.

Drinks = had 2 cocktails which were tasty but not strong. Glass size is smaller than what I'm use to. No garnish used on cocktails.

Food = Thai influenced but had a "western" flavor forward profile. Portions were very small but tasty, nonetheless.

12.5% auto gratuity and 1%(?) charge for something else on all bills

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Food was fantastic
Staff was super friendly and helpful.
Highly recommend it.
Make a reservation

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: Burn baby burn...it was nice to be near fire in the cold of the winter. Oh and it doesn't hurt to have some good food along with it. Small menu, just try whatever and you'll be fine.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Phenomenal experience here. Had a bit of a wait so popped out to a nearby pub. Worth the wait. Got the laap sausage, slow grilled chicken, raw mutton, grilled rump cap, ox heart, glass noodles, and brown rice. All were great and almost all were fairly spicy, ranging from 4-7. The mutton and ox heart were the spiciest but went well with rice. The chicken was the best, had to go in for seconds. Glass noodles were great too. Everything we had was great, would definitely come back to try more.

Vibes were fantastic. Fitting for the name, if you sit on the first floor it's all bar seating and you can see the prep line with big flames and clay pots. All in a dark setting with UK grime blasting in the back. Downstairs vibe is more chill, much more lighting with proper tables. Would recommend first floor bar seating if your party is small enough.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Great: citrus salad, pork sausage, Jin toob, roasted chicken, clay pot glass noodle, stirred fried veggies
Meh: lamb chop
Don't try unless you really want to: turmeric & ginger lemonade, curry pollock

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: We had 5 plates of various food. Except for the chicken marinated in soy sauce and spices it was some of the worst tasting food I have ever had at a restaurant. Some of the dishes were not edible. It seems Very strange that Kiln has such high reviews.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Was jazzed to check this place out after seeing the great reviews. Overall, the food was good and the service was attentive. It was jammed packed on a Thursday evening.

Would highly recommend getting a reservation if you want to check it out. The dishes are super flavourful. A bit pricey but given the area, should be expected.

I'd be willing to come back again!

Name: Kiln
