Review_Text: Great low key place! Not the Thai I'm used to having, but I still really liked it. The 'chicken and soy' dish was my personal favorite. We got to sit at the bar right where they cooked our food! W experience. Definitely suggest trying to sit at the bar next to the kitchen. It was cool to watch the cooks in action. They only serve for a limited time so be sure to get there quick! We were the last group of eaters and we ate around 3-3:30. Overall (as the kids say) 'hip' place.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
To be fair, compare to the take out Thai place that open til 2am in the morning, this is way better. But if you're looking for amazing Thai food and pay a decent amount, this is not it.

We ordered literally the entire menu. Not only did nothing really wow us, the price was not exactly nice either.

Most of the food is either not big enough to share or it tasted very bland. The more flavorful dishes are waaaaaay too spicy and we are the kind of people who have experience Asian spicy in asia.

I mean don't get me wrong - it's not the worst Thai food but I guess I have too much expectation for it to be flavorful.

We booked 3 months in advance to get a table on a Friday night so it's not exactly somewhere you can just pop by.

On top of that, there's no dessert at all.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
I came in with high expectations and left feeling a bit disappointed. In a vacuum, the food tastes good, but I felt the restaurant missed on a few executions. Considering its price point, I'm hesitant to go back.

What went well: the stir fried Cornish greens with soy. A very cool aspect about the restaurant setup is that many seats are seated by the open kitchen, and I particularly enjoyed watching the flames and stir fry. There's a certain "spirit of the wok" ("wok hei" 锅气 in Cantonese) that, when imparted into veggie stir fry, is incredible. This was one of those hits.

Unfortunately, that was the only standout. For some of the other dishes, the flavour (and textures) just don't come together:
1/ Langoustines with green strawberry and mint felt like a random assembly with no clear narrative, and the langoustine meat was hard to pick out. Also, there was nowhere to discard the langoustine shells.
2/ The spicy red curry (forgot the fish) did not contain strong seafood umami as I'd expect! The fish is only plated into the curry a few moments before serving, meaning the natural flavour of the fish doesn't get much time to seep in. The fish also comes with bones too, be warned.
3/ Each diner only gets a small plate that isn't switched out before courses. This is rather inconvenient because: (a) how does one eat curry from a small plate (not bowl), and (b) where do the discarded bones/shells etc. go? Form over function was unfortunately a recurring theme throughout the meal.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: Perfection! The ambiance from the bar is great. Every dish is light and flavorful. Worth the try!

Name: Kiln
Review_Text: Hella ya this place is the bomb food music atmosphere .. menu is different daily ! Damn 10 out of 10

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
I stopped here for lunch and I was delightfully surprised. The curries are flavorful and indeed spicy.

Although some mishaps in the dishes served, service was good. I got a dish that I did not order and they took the dish I originally ordered (which later arrived) and the wrong one off the bill.

The place is a little bit tight and probably sitting on the counter is your best option to see the kitchen at work. The ambiance, though, is that of a street food in Thailand after all.

Name: Kiln
Review_Text:
Came for lunch - sat at the counter. Fast service, great flavor.

Laotian curry- herbal, fragrant. The fish was super tender and flavorful. It is quite spicy, the spice builds, so be warned!

Radish salad was really refreshing- not overdone.

The only dish I wasn't keen on was the clay pot with glass noodles. While the noodles were fine, you could hardly taste any crab meat. So that was disappointing.

Tip: they do take walk-ins for bar/kitchen counter seating. But try to come early. There was a line already even before the restaurant opened for lunch.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Second time in a year, really good food but nothing special for a Michelin star restaurant. Had to book a few weeks before, hasn't changed much except for the new dessert that has soft serve included. They could do better with the kitchen staff wearing gloves and hair nets to be honest

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Food is amazing. We went with course menus and it was delicious. Service also is great. Highly recommend to book in advance since the place is always busy. Location next to the market makes it very trendy and cool. For sure next trip we visit this restaurant again.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: My favorite dinner while traveling in London (2023). We opted for the tasting menu and chose the chicken and lamb kababs and enjoyed all of the different mezze options immensely. Trying the tasting menu let us explore options we might not have otherwise ordered. A meal I'll wish I could relive

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing! I showed up at 5:15 on a Monday night and lined up. They opened at 5:30 and they sat folks who had reservations and then I got a seat at the bar which was a great experience seeing all the action. I was immediately packed but organized. I ordered Persian white cocktail which was meh but then the food immediately caught up. I ordered kashk e bademjoon which was great and Olivier salad. I got a taftoon bread which they bake there fresh and you can watch them baking the bread. I ordered the lamb/ barreh for my entree that was also perfect. I ordered too much but also shared with the person sitting next to me at the bar. Keep it up Berenjak. I'll come back.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text:
I could eat here daily and I'd never get bored. The hummus!!! I mean all of it's just so so good. The staff are always beyond accommodating with dietary requirements. My husband & I live in New York City but are from England & Egypt and every time we come back to London this is our first stop. It's almost become a bit of a ritual.

James the manager is so wonderful and always remembers us. Can't recommend this place enough

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: I really wanted to like this place. Pricing was kind of ridiculous for the quality. The kebab was not tender & very elastic, and the service was almost nonexistent. They forgot to bring out a few things that we ordered and ended up having to cancel them. Didn't understand the hype at all, unfortunately disappointed.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Food was great!! The yogurt type dish was delish and the naan very tasty and toasty. Small place though not alot of room and must make a reservation.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text:
*Lunch special review*

3 courses for £28 and you will leave full and happy! We sat at the bar and that ended up being great because you can watch them making the food. It is very impressive and they are working hard. You choose from a dip (many options) with breads, a meat (lamb or chicken) and a side (either rice or salad). There is a lot of food, do this is a great deal. We loved everything we got! Service is great and food comes out quick.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: One of my new favorite spots. The fresh bread was absolutely incredible, as were the various sides. If I were to go back, I would try and get a variety of sides instead of mains, because everything seemed so unique and wonderful. The juicy chicken, the eggplant spread, the crispy rice, 10/10

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Came here for a quick lunch before the play. Without reservation, only an outside seating was available so we took it. They have a small interior and some high top seats outside. Started with some kashke bademjaan and mirza ghasemi. They have fresh sangak or round bread which goes well with these apps, though unfortunately is not complementary. The quality of the skewers were out of this world. Super tender. Clearly marinated overnight. Absolutely tasty and delightful. My only missing star is because of the slow service. It took a while for them to get our order. Otherwise very delicious Persian meal. Highly recommend a try.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text:
One of those finicky places that can't decide if it wants to be high end or not. I checked in around 1:45 and it was an hour or so wait for lunch. They have a text system and their wait time quoted was pretty accurate. I came back and was able to be seated immediately at one of the stools adjacent to the bar. I ordered a glass of wine and some dips. Despite great bar seating the menu is definitely designed to be shared.

Prices are on the moderate to high side. Dips are around £8 each, breads £4, kebabs around £20. With that said, I found that the quality of the food matched the prices. The balal (£7) aka corn on the cob was unbelievably good. The hummus (£7.50) was unbeatable. The mast o musir (£7.50) was missable. The bread was great.

Service was fine but pretty impersonal. One of those rare instances where the service fee seems a bit of a farce.

Docking at least a star because the toilets (only two for the whole restaurant) were vile - one was completely clogged, the other was missing toilet paper and the waste basket was overflowing. A complete embarrassment for any restaurant.

Overall I was a bit disappointed and wouldn't rush to recommend.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: They sat a party that didn't have reservations ahead of us and ignored our request to be seated sooner since we were already there. Then they offered us seats at the bar instead. When asking the host how he could seat people who didn't have reservations ahead of us, he claimed that those people had reservations. That was a blatant lie since we were present when they were telling the host that they DID NOT have reservations. Cannot say anything about the food but I can say that dishonesty and deceit are not signs of perfection or a dedication to any culinary perfection. Zero is what they are going to get from me. I left 100.00 pounds on the counter for them to keep as the price for their dishonesty. They will never have anything more from me.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: My husband and I make it a point to look for Persian restaurants anytime we travel and wow, Berenjak did not disappoint! The restaurant is so beautiful inside and the staff were all great! But that's not even the best part -- the food is out of this world! I mean, I have a higher set of standards when it comes to kabobs and middle eastern food in general, but man, this place is easily in the top 5 category. We ordered the chicken, beef, and liver kabobs and they were all mouthwatering-delicious!

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: This restaurant was unbelievable! The people were so kind. The food was phenomenal. It had the best corn, chicken salad, and lamb I've ever had in my life! Will absolutely be coming back and recommending it to many. Has many gluten free and vegetarian options.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: I have eaten at Berenjak about seven times in the last year and it never disappoints. The atmosphere is lively (sit at the counter if you can), the staff is friendly, and the food....ahhhhh, the food. Perfectly cooked bread, succulent kebabs, rich hummus, fresh mint/dill/walnut/feta/radish....there is nothing here that is even close to subpar. Get a reservation and bring an appetite!

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text:
Arrived 5min early for an 830pm dinner on a Friday. The place was a zoo, staff moving around furiously. After checking in at the front we were seated at the hightop bar. Super excited to try my second Persian kabob joint in London.

We started off w/ cocktails (the tahini old fashioned and a gin fizz sharbat) and ordered a few dips (mast Khiyar, kashk bademjoon, mast moosir and salad shirazi). We also ordered the sangak bread which was super light & crispy. We were hoping for a less hectic ambiance and felt rushed to get in/out.

For the mains we ordered the koobideh, jujeh tond (spicy chicken on the bone), and the ghorme sabzi.

The ghorme sabzi comes poured out of a sealed plastic bag and warmed. The koobideh was too gelatinous for my liking and had a strange texture to it. The jujeh tond was really good as was the ghorme sabzi.

They don't do traditional rice w their entrees so make sure to order rice. Also, the tadig isn't traditional but is like shaved into a powder which I assume is to mask it's not fresh.

Overall, was looking forward to a Bib Gourmand Persian restaurant but was let down. It appears the Brit's don't have taste buds for Persian cuisine. Pretty much anyplace in the states has this place beat.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: We heard a lot about this Persian restaurant!got reservations for one& half hour dinner at6.00 pm. The ambiance is very nice, modern, welcoming. Ordered mastomosir, kashkobademjan, mirzaghasemi, salad Shirazi all were delicious but the only problem they don't bring everything at the same time& portions are very small. The bread they make is so yummy. We tried barbari . The taftoon bread didn't come to the table in some point we had to cancel. The koubideh came half burnt look like the grill wasn't even & very salty. The chicken kabob was very juicy. The Zaferan polo very delicious specially the tahdigh . The chicken with zereshk wasn't cooked well. We didn't get a chance ti try tea & dessert because the food came very late & as soon as we eat they asked to leave because the others were waiting for the table.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Absolutely phenomenal food. My family and I have eaten at too many Persian restaurants to count and Berenjak's food is some of the best we've ever had. With two Michelin Stars, this is not surprising, but what is surprising is how reasonably priced everything is. You cannot go wrong eating here.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Food was marvellous. Service was stellar and staff were polite and delightful. All setting the perfect ambiance for a lovely night with one other person you might fancy taking out, or even a group of friends! 10/10 will return.

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: LITERALLY AMAZING! I found this restaurant from Dua Lipa's top 5 London restaurants on Eater.... and if Dua Lipa loves it...that means I had to try it for myself to. I swearrrr the hummus was probably one of the best hummuses I have ever eaten. The atmosphere of the restaurant is fantastic-- lively but also quiet enough to have a good conversation. If you go here, you have to try the baklava ice cream dessert; so freaking mouthwatering, everyone was absolutely stunned by it. Everything here was amazeballs

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Um...what? How can a kebab be this good? How can a kebab menu be this inspired? Why hasn't this place been in my life before this? The search is over. I have found the best kebab ever. This is it. Get on a flight. Go to soho and visit berenjak. Casual friendly place. Staff is super kind and helpful. Come with a group and order everything. Kebabs and bread cooked in an amazing oven on premise. If you have a group go with the feast menu, but if it's just you and a friend do not forget to order a jigar. The jigar is the star. Sweetbreads and liver perfectly grilled and filled with flavor! Amazing. Also, an indication of the class of this place. They gave us free sides because they felt our food took too long. We were fine but gladly accepted. You can not beat this place!

Name: Berenjak
Review_Text: Astonishingly good hummus and lamb skewers. Small place but a warm atmosphere full of cooking and energy.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: Food was delicious! We made a reservation ahead of time and were able to get seated quickly. The inside is pretty small, but the tables don't start to get completely filled until after 7pm. We ordered the dosa, lamb kari (curry), coconut chutney, pol sambol, bone marrow varuval + roti, and the hot butter squid. For drinks, we got the guava lassi. Star of the show was definitely the bone marrow which melts in your mouth and goes perfectly with the flakey, soft roti. Guava lassi was absolutely perfect as well to wash everything down. The dosa and lamb were great, the lamb was very flavorful with a bit of a kick (I do wish I had maybe gotten a hopper instead to have more substance to mop up the sauce.) The hot butter squid reminded me a bit of calamari. Overall, a delicious meal in a prime location within SoHo.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Hoppers- London, UK
4/26/2024
What I Had:
*Passionfruit & Elderflower Soda
*Lamb Kothu Roti
*Dosa
*Prawn Kari

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Hoppers has amazing food and a menu with a lot of variety. I ordered a guava lassi, masala dosa with coconut chutney, and a drumstick sambhar on the side. It was all fantastic - the potato filling in the dosa was delicious, and the sweetness of the coconut chutney was the perfect classic complement (if they sold jars of the chutney separately to take home I'd definitely buy it)! I ordered the sambhar as a last-minute addition and was glad I did, because the spiciness of the stew rounded out the meal nicely.

Hoppers is just far enough off the Strand to not get overly crowded during the pre-show dinner rush, but it's still just a 10-15 minute walk away from most theaters. Lovely spot that I'll definitely return to!

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Unpleasant Experience

I recently dined at this restaurant and unfortunately had a very disappointing experience. The staff exhibited behavior that made us uncomfortable and seemed discriminatory - refused to give us a proper back resting chair because we did not make reservation instead walked in. Though the restaurant had lot of empty tables and chair they just refused to provide one! The service was subpar, and we felt unwelcome. I hope the management addresses these issues to create a more inclusive and welcoming environment for all customers. Wouldn't recommend this place!

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: Exploring Soho and stumbled upon this gem - hands down one of my top meals in London. The black pork curry with rice and dosa was an absolute delight. Drinks were also pretty good. It was my first time trying South Indian food, and the speedy and attentive service made it even better. Perfect for solo diners too, they've got a table overlooking the outside for people dining solo.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Vegan-friendly Sri Lankan place with a bunch of different offerings. They used to have a veggie mushroom kothu (£12) listed on the menu, but not any more apparently; regardless; they were still able to make it for me luckily, and it is default vegan.

The food came out in under 10 minutes. Reasonable portion, with a nice chewy texture from the roti, all sorts of mushrooms (including oyster mushrooms, which was nice), and other shredded veggies. Very solid, but not quite at the elite level of vegan kothus I've had. 4/5

They add a £1 optional charity charge to the bill by default, and another 10% for service -- you can wave these if you tell them, but that's still shitty to automatically add both. Not appreciated.

All in all, mediocre service and good vegan-friendly Sri Lankan food.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: If you enjoy Indian food, then you will enjoy this, I found it about 6 degrees separated from mainstream Indian . Flavors were different , interesting and tasty . Roti was good

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Phenomenal food. Authentic, with a balance of the right spicy level.
Highly recommend the beef chilly fry.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: The food was delicious with just the right amount of heat. It came really fast. The best meals were the chicken bites and the goat roti. The eggplant Kari turned out way better than the lamb Kari.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Food was good, environment was nice and the service was friendly. We bought different plates and shared and enjoyed everything. This place was in a thriving part of Soho. There are a few other locations in London.


[unhappy a 12.5% tip was added AND a 1 pound donation (Donation Not explained on the bill but was on a card provided, and seems for a good cause, but I always like to research organizations before donating to assure they are fiscally responsible.). Forced tipping doesn't even happen in the US except for large groups, the tip capital of the world. Note that All the restaurants in London have been doing this and when you leave the city tips are not added or expected except token or for superb service.]

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: Excellent South Indian / Sri Lankan food set in picturesque Morlybourne Street. Who doesn't love a coconutty hopper with a coconut milk based chicken or fish curry? The food here is fresh flavorful and authentic. Interior decor is well done and in line with the London restaurant scene. Outdoor seating is pleasant on a summer afternoon - Hoppers and people watching go well together. Drinks are delicious as well I enjoyed the pineapple lassi. Pricing is on the higher side three adults and two children ate well for 100GBP. Service is prompt and friendly, the food comes out pretty quickly. Truly worth the hype highly recommended.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: One of the best south Indian / Sri Lankan restaurants in all of London. The dosa was crispy and on point and went perfectly with some shrimp Kari. The uthappam was also top notch. We really had no complaints at all. I'd probably skip the mutton rolls as there are many other great options on the menu. We'll be back here to try more soon!

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
I had the Lamb Kathu Roti, and it hit the spot! This place is busy, and rightfully so! Make a reservation if possible, and do not miss this as a stop when you are in SoHo! This place is one of my favorite restaurants that I have been to in London and is well worth your stop!

Order a Guava Lassi as well while you are here - it is an amazing twist on the traditional Lassi!

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: This place should be 5 stars because the food is quite good. The problem is that their portions are ridiculously small and expensive for what you get. I have lived in Sri Lanka for many years and know what is normally expected. Curries should be served with rice; however, here you pay quite a bit extra for a little bit of basmati rice. Hoppers and string hoppers are usually inexpensive items and there should be copious amounts to sop up the sauces. Here you pay a super inflated supplement for very small portions of these things. The condiments are served in thimble sized containers and should be free; here you will pay quite a bit for these extras. Even the main courses ie: curries are served in small containers that would at most be enough for one mildly hungry person. And yet, the food is really quite good! If they served larger sizes, were more generous with their supplements and less rapacious it would be a terrific place.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
This was one of the best meals I had in London (if not the best). I came on a weekday evening around 7. We didn't have a reservation and were told the wait would be about an hour to an hour half for a party of 4. We waited at a cafe nearby until they texted us.

Service here was very good and everything comes out very quickly which is nice.

WE ORDERED:
fish kari - pretty good! You should definitely order this if you love fish 4/5
black pork kari - amazing amazing option. Robust flavors and unforgettable taste 5/5
butter squid - highly recommend 5/5
dosa - very fun and interesting way to eat curry. Everyone should definitely try it! 5/5
fish rice - flavorful and delicious 4/5

Everything was amazing. There is a restroom. They also serve alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks and there is bar seating as well.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
My favorite food in London is at Hoppers, which I first discovered 5 years ago on my honeymoon and have been coming back to every time I'm in London. Their curries (or "karis") are just so flavorful and the meat is cooked so perfectly -- plus there are fun "hoppers" and "dosa" dishes (which are a gluten-free, lighter, crepe-like kind of bread vs. naan/roti -- although they have that too). I absolutely love Indian food, but Sri Lankan food is even better. I just think the combination of spices is smoother (less "Christmas" spice), and there's more use of coconut milk vs. dairy/yogurts (which adds another depth of flavor) -- and the spice levels can be customized to be just as spicy as your favorite Indian curry.

Must-try: "masala dosa" (a light crepe filled with mashed potatoes and spices) and a "kari" (my favorite is when they have the lamb shank kari, but I also love the chicken).

This spot in SoHo is the first of their 3 locations I think, and it definitely feels homey and cozy inside (which also means this is their smallest location and gets a little cramped). Reservations in advance are a must, since there aren't that many tables.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Bone marrow Varuval + Roti 6.21/10- this was good but honestly way too creamy for me and I've come to the conclusion I'm not to keen on bone marrow as I don't really like the texture/consistency. It was very rich in flavor, however I got tired after the first few bites. I was hoping the roti (pictured on slide 5) was more like the consistency and taste of a paratha however it was a bit bland in my opinion. (One of their most popular dishes)

Chili Cheese Dosa 7.32/10- this was delicious. Normally not a chili cheese person however the combination was perfect and the breading felt like a thicker, more rich crepe. Incredibly filling though- could only eat a few bites

Prawn and green mango Kari 6.45/10- good but not really what I was expecting. Tasted incredibly coconut-y and honestly way to creamy for my liking especially in combination to be served with the chili cheese dosa. (Apparently one of their most popular menu items but I'd suggest getting the chicken/lamb kari)

Mutton Rolls with Lankan Ketchup 7.68/10- this was really good the breading reminded me of a mixture between churro and mozzarella sticks (not nearly anywhere as sweet as churros outer layer) the lamb melts in your mouth with a mix of creamy cheese. So filling but worth. (Also one of their most popular dishes)

Egg Hopper. 4.87/10- this reminded me of a more bland version of Ethiopian bread but with a coconut flavor to it. The egg yolk in the middle made it taste really good with the curry however this wasn't really my vibe. (Also really popular)

This was a cool experience. This is an award winning restaurant that serves Sri Lankan and South Indian dishes. It was a great experience, however incredibly filling and creamy. Their dishes definitely had lots of flavor to them and it is quite popular.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text:
Hoppers is a fantastic Sri Lankan restaurant with a couple locations around London (there's also one in south Marylebone and one in King's Cross). This one is the original and has all the same great food -- albeit I'm not as much a fan of the ambiance or layout here (it's a bit cramped and more run-down -- hence the 4 stars).

In terms of menu, you can't go wrong with the Taste of Hoppers -- though beware it's a ton of food! The mutton rolls and the hot butter squid are especially good, and the kottu roti is always a winner. Obviously the food is very flavorful and spicy, so think twice if you have a British palate!

Overall one of the gems of London's food scene.

Name: Hoppers
Review_Text: We came for lunch and ordered the chicken bites, two karis (aubergine and chicken), egg hopper, and masala dosa. The chicken bites were amazing, very juicy and tender, and perfectly marinated. The karis were good, but would have preferred more aubergine in the vegetarian one. The masala dosa was very good - probably our favorite, and perfect for sharing. The egg hopper looked aesthetic, but a rather bland egg white taste. Personally I preferred the coconut chutney to the karis, but good meal overall!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Dinner in June: fantastic experience. Staff was super, solid atmosphere, our waiter was terrific with wine and food recommendations (sorry don't have her name!). Dips with naan plus grilled lamb and octopus were soooo delicious. A really really great meal.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: This spot is a stunner! Wow! The food is incredible! Secure a reservation for sure. We saddled up at the bar seating with direct views of the bustling kitchen. We asked our server to completely take the wheel on food decisions and she gave us a perfect star showing of the restaurants treats. Everything was booming with flavor. I highly recommend the pork neck. It's legendary. You won't be disappointed! Absolutely incredible restaurant making a mark!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: We are regular patrons of The Palomar so we wanted to try one of their other restaurants and Barbary didn't disappoint. Excellent food, cocktails/wine and ambiance. Love all the small plates and dips.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Absolutely spectacular cuisine ! Quaint and small which makes it an experience of its own .

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Fun atmosphere, incredible food and flavors, impeccable service! North African / Mediterranean influenced food delivered to perfection! Must-try!
I found Barbary on the Michelin app as a recommended Bib Gourmand, and it fits! I loved EVERYTHING!
This is the perfect stop pre-theatre / before a musical or theater performance. I came between Harry Potter showings of the cursed child and could not be happier -- fun atmosphere, singing and juggling to the music, delicious food, well balanced drinks, friendly staff. I totally was satiated while I sat and ate despite no reservations. This is a small round restaurant where the chefs and bartender are in the center stage to show you their magic. Highly recommend this unbelievably fantastic restaurant.

I loved the cauliflower Jaffa Style and Pata Negra (star of my meal - tender with charred crunchy edges and sweet savory garlic sauce). The Naan was excellent and fried violet artichoke were served on a bed of delicious dip.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
This was definitely our favorite restaurant during our latest London trip! Couldn't recommend enough

I had a few friends rave about this place, so I was on top of making a reservation as soon as it came out. The restaurant is fairly small, pretty much with only bar seating around the kitchen, so make your reservations early.
I love the open kitchen concept, where everyone can get a view of the kitchen since you're in a very large semicircle.
We came with a veteran Barbary friend who knew exactly what to order.
They fire grill everything to PERFECTION! Highly recommend getting the jerusalem bagel with a few mezzes to dip

I don't think you can go wrong with any of the dishes, but our favorites were probably the cauliflower, chicken, and octopus. But just get everything!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Our favorite meal in London was situated in the iconic Neal's Yard in Covent Garden. The dishes are inspired from the Barbary Coast, identified by 16th century Europeans as the area settled by the Berbers in the Atlas Mountains.

The menu focuses on the culture + heritage of countries from the Atlantic Coast through to the Mediterranean Sea leading to the Middle East.

Fire is at the center of everything they do.

*| what we ordered

Spinach Borani
Ikra
Whipped Feta
Naan e Barbari
Beetroot Tzatziki
Octopus
Pata Negra
Hashcake - pistachio tart

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Amazing Mediterranean find in London! Tiny little spot with only bar tables, but wow!!!! Great, fun staff and we were lucky to get a spot without a booking due to a no-show. Definitely make a booking. Best house made lebne (which we watched them making), and hummus and the naan and their "bagel" were ridiculous. Also enjoyed the halloumi and the fattoush salad. We barely had room for the lamb which was moist and full of flavor. The open kitchen is fun and interactive. Must try for sure!!!!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
The Barbary is in located Covent Garden and the food is absolutely delicious. It serves flavorful and fresh tapas right in front of your eyes with the open kitchen concept.

The vibe is casual. There is limited seating so make a reservation!

The menu is divided into land, sea, earth, and heaven (dessert). I tried the prawns, mushroom, naan (two servings), pork, and 3 dips. Almost every dish (I kid you not) gave me a wow factor. My only gripe is the pork was a tad too salty at times. (I didn't choose this dish).

I would totally recommend this restaurant to anyone. It served us well the first night. Loved watching my food being made. Excellent experience.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Ok, I have this habit of closing my eyes when I want to focus all my attention to a taste that that is spectacular to my taste buds. The pork dish is such a dish that all my senses focused on the taste. Wow!
Such a cool place to have a seat around the kitchen bar and see how all the food is made. The cooking is really basic like cooking around a group of friends. The servers are terrific too. We just traveled through Egypt, Portugal, Jordan, Kenya and Tanzania and they seem to capture the food tastes of all these regions.Amazing. Run don't walk to this amazing restaurant.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Had a Unique and intimate dining experience at the Barbary. It's a limited seating, Tapas kind small plates restaurant. Recommend making a reservation before hand. Great services from the staff. Food was delicious.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Great food, great service. Interesting food and presented beautifully!Cramped and very loud-not intended for a romantic dinner. We would recommend.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Don't miss going here . Best dinner I had in London's Covent Gardens district .
If you know of Ottolenghi it's like going to his personal restaurant .
The food the drinks and service are outrageously fantastic . We are at the Barbary counter service and the show of the kitchen dance was a major plus.
Don't miss going here .

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Great dinner spot in a cool area. Loved the whole bar setup and vibe here - everything we tried was great. The highlight was the spice chicken, which was super moist and tender. Would definitely make a return visit when I'm in London again.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Just got back from eating here and it was amazing! We stopped by to see if they had any walk in availability, expecting to not get in but, luck have it, a reservation didn't show up and we were seated almost immediately. The staff walked us through the whole menu and identified their favorites and we went with most of the recommendations. We started with the Jerusalem bagel with the aubergine dip. The bread was so soft and chewy with an amazing crust of sesame and zatar, it paired perfectly with the spreadable eggplant that was spiced so well. Our mains were the lamb kebab, oyster mushrooms, and cauliflower. The lamb was tender and grilled just right with the simplest salt and sauce that really let the protein shine through. The mushrooms had a very understated flavor but had the right texture and became so good with the mixture of char, lemon juice and tahini that it sat in. The star though was the cauliflower. The seasoning and sauce were so well balanced and the lightly fried texture could not have been better. We finished with the pecan baklava. I prefer pecans to pistachio and this was delicious with a nice crunch from the philo. It could have been warmed up just slightly but still tasty.

I can't finish the review without talking about the staff. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. I didn't get anyone's name but the staff working the night of July 30th showed how a restaurant should be run.

Def a must try when you're in Soho!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Phenomenal restaurant in Neal's yard. The concept is cool, you sit on the bar and the chefs cook in front of you. Make sure to have a reservation and I recommend only going with one other person since it's bar seating

I tried the labneh, naan, octopus, lamb, cauliflower and pistachio hash cake. Everything was out of this world, especially the dessert.

Service was great and the vibe was awesome. Would recommend this iconic restaurant to anybody in London

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Our favorite dinner in London on this visit. Wonderful, interesting food in an energetic atmosphere. Attentive, positive service. A piece of advice...it is loud and the way the seating works, I suggest this is a place for couples and not groups, not even groups as small as four, if you want to talk...it's loud and hard for more than a couple to talk. But for a couple...especially a hip couple dressed to kill for a night on the town...The Barbary will be magical!

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Great restaurant with amazing food, and great service. Place is a bit small, with seating just around the bar/grill area so make sure to have a reservation .

Between the two of us we did the labne, cauliflower, octopus, and lamb - which was the perfect amount of food. Cauliflower and lamb were my favorites. We also did the pistachio cake for dessert, which hands down was one of the best dessert I've ever had.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Intimate one to one friendly service defines this outstanding chef run kitchen. I've never been to the south of Spain or not in Africa but now I'm motivated by a taste of the food I had at Barbary. This restaurant is small and tightly packed but that makes for better engagement with their charismatic and knowledgeable staff. Sam did a great job of explaining the food and helped us choose just the right wine to go with it. The menu is simple and is laid out like a tasting menu - it's good to try one from each section at least. The breads and dips are delectable luckily the portion size is small so there's no fear of filling up too early on. I had fish for main course and it was just fantastic. Thinly sliced and perfectly cooked. I was already mighty impressed but I was blown away by the dessert. Who knew the simple and humble baklava could taste so good? Loved every moment of my time here I'm definitely coming back and I'm recommending that everyone try it. Book in advance because very rightly this place gets full.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Best meal and experience while visiting London. So many pieces have to come together to create a magical night. We loved every bit and every moment at the Barbary.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Had an excellent dinner at The Barbary next door which is connected to the Barbary! Vy and Sam were incredible as well. The vibe, the food, the staff was just pure "chefs kiss."

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
I was lucky to get a seat without a wait on a Friday night. Unfortunately it wasn't at the main bar where you can watch the chefs cook. It's a tiny place, with about 20 seats.

I got the naan, spinach borani dip, cauliflower, and pata negra. The naan was fluffy and well cooked but had way too much salt on it, which kind of ruined everything. The dip was ok. The cauliflower had a slight kick to it and was served with some sort of hummus which was nice. If I could do it again I'd ask for no salt on the naan and skip the dip.

The pata negra was definitely the star. Nicely cooked to a medium rare, well seasoned, and the sauce that comes with it helps balance out the fatty-ness. I only wish there was more sauce!

Overall, a fun intimate place in a cute little corner of Neal's Yard with good food. I'd go again to try more dishes.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: Freaking amazing, This was our last day in London and was looking for a great restaurant, this one had unbelievably high ratings in google and yelp, so i though, hey let give it a try. I am so glad i did, it took us a bit to find the place as it is a tiny place located down a equally tiny side street, once we got in the waitress was incredibly friendly and even though we did not have a reservation, she managed to find a place to seat us, We had the cauliflower jafa style - mouthwatering with just a tickle of spice, the naan - cooked to perfection - we ended up ordering 2 of them, the Jerusalem bagel - Lie a pretzel with alot of toasted seeds and severed with a cream sauce, the morrocan cigars - this is a monkfish dish, very tasty , the lamb armonim, the chicken shawarma & the pata negra - holy mother!!, the pata negra was over the top, it was one of the most unique dishes i have ever had, I am salivating remembering it now, a must have. then to finish off this amazing meal we had the hashcake, which of course was incredible. This is a must visit restaurant in London if you are craving Mediterranean food, or even if you have never had it before, this will be a great introduction to it.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
Whoa!

I was in town for some work and heard this place had great food. I decided to take a 2 mile walk across london so was starving when I arrived. I was just a party of one so was hoping i could snag a seat at the bar since it was a fairly small restaurant. As you walk in you see the central cooking area and bar area and everyone sat around the bar or along the walls. I waited about 30 minutes and was able to snag a seat on the wall. Not the greatest view, but i had no reservations. The waiter came up and asked me how hungry was I. I said i am ready to eat and told him that i trust him to deliver me a great meal.

The onslaught of food started and the food was just outstanding end to end. So highly executed. The standouts for me were the Cauliflower, Lamb and Pork dish. As you can see from my pictures i got a little of everything and Everything was delicious. Highly recommended.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text: The Barbary is a fantastical restaurant with all seats centered around the open kitchen. The food was amazing. Every thing is made to share, and small plates means you can order tons of different things to try. I went with two others and we decided not to ask any questions or google any of the dish names. We went in blind and ordered about 8-9 plates, including dessert and wine. Highly recommend. One of the best restaurants I've been to in recent memory.

Name: The Barbary
Review_Text:
What a great restaurant with North African inspired food. Great vibe and service. Place gets rocking as they have 2-3 seatings a night.

All the appetizers, dips with the naan and bagel were amazing. Lamb grilled bites were fantastic. Chicken shawarma was super tender and the pata negra was fantastic in the sauce. Finished with knefeh dessert.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
This restaurant would have been a 4 for the food, especially the the fried chicken bao but the service and ambiance were pretty awful. We had wrong dishes brought to us, we were hassled to leave multiple times even though all our dishes hadn't been brought to us.

Having no dedicated server and a totally packed restaurant, it was a cramped and hectic experience. However, the food was really great, so here we are at 3 stars. Maybe takeaway would be advised!

Name: Bao
Review_Text: Definitely a small place! Quick service, great food, and left with fully belly. Great place to stop when in SoHo. Beware you will be required to wait outside during busy hours.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
An absolute pleasure.

Small, intimate, and simple yet flavorful options. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and attentiveness of the staff and instantly wished we had a place like this in the states.

A new favorite, everything was great and I highly recommend it.

I had the classic bao, beef bao, chips and mushrooms. Will be back.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: We stopped on our walk by and it did not disappoint. Great service and the confit & fried chicken boa buns were off the charts good. Great time.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
Buns are one of my favorite foods in the world so expectations were high. I was still blown away!

There's often a line outside and the interior is small so it can feel a little hectic, but it's a really beautiful space that also feels trendy.

We came in a party of two on a weeknight and they were able to squeeze us immediately, with that caveat that we had to leave within an hour for another party's reservation.

We ordered 3 buns to share between the two of us and we immediately ordered more.
The confit pork was extravagant. Soft and absolutely melt in your mouth. It's like they took all the best qualities of a traditional pork belly bun and put it together.

The party next to us was halal and they had a little trouble ordering because all the fried items are fried in the same oil.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: I cannot recommend Bao highly enough. The food was amazing, the staff was friendly and provided recommendations, and I left feeling satisfied and that I'd gotten my money's worth. We tried a lot more than what is pictured here, but we couldn't stop eating long enough to take the pictures.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
This is a very small, intimate place in the SoHo district. Walking in the staff was extremely friendly and we were immediately seated. Our waiter reviewed the menu with us and gave us great suggestions.
I filled out the little order form and handed it to our waiter. In total, we ordered the scallop appetizer along with the confit pork, fried chicken and braised beef bao buns with a side of sweet potato chips that came with an interesting plum pickle ketchup. As a tea lover, I couldn't resist ordering the 10-year aged Oolong tea as I've never had an aged tea.
The order came out in less than 10 minutes and so we dug in. The scallop appetizer was really tasty with a nice char on the outside.
Each of the bao buns themselves were so soft and just melted in my mouth. The filings for each were super flavorful. The confit pork and braised beef were very tender and packed a flavor punch. The friend chicken was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
The sweet potato chips (fries) were nice and crispy, and the plum pickle ketchup provided was a nice change from a regular tomato ketchup.
As for the 10-year aged Oolong tea, it has an earthier taste than most Oolongs I've tasted. It was worth trying just for my own personal knowledge.
Overall, this is a great place to grab a quick, light bite while in the SoHo district but take note that the establishment is very small and not good for large groups.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
Amazing food! Everything here was excellent. I honestly bought the cookbook after going here. It's pricy, but the quality is amazing. Sometimes, it's hard to find good Taiwanese food, and this place met all the criteria. They even do the menu the Taiwanese way - you write down the quantity next to the menu item name.

I recommend getting reservations in advance. It is very tiny inside, so be prepared to be squished next to everyone.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: Bao is across from my office in London and I tried to find a time to go there the first few times I visited the office and was never able to fit it in. On my most recent trip, I was determined to try it and on the last day told my colleagues I would not be eating with them but going to Bao. I went inside to tell them I wanted to get take out and they told me to wait outside until someone came to take my order. Once that happened (about five minutes later), the bao took less than ten minutes. I had the pork and the fried chicken and probably could have had another. While both were very good, I didn't find it to be that much better than the Bao that I often have in New York City so it's probably not somewhere I had to go so far out of my way to try. That being said, I live in New York City. In London this may well be the Bao place to go to.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
Food was good but we had a big issue with one of the dessert buns.

We were seated at the bar and at the end of the meal we ordered a dessert bun. A few minutes later we saw the person sitting next to us get the dessert bun we ordered. We didn't say anything because maybe she ordered one as well. But sure enough the person waves down the waitress and says she didn't order the bun. We kept an eye on the bun (from the bar you can see the kitchen) and saw the chef hold the bun up to a heat lamp to reheat the bun and had the waitress give us the same bun!

When the waitress tried to give us the bun we told her we knew the bun went to the wrong person and we wanted a new one. We also told her it wasn't her fault but it's unacceptable and gross for the chef to do what he did.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: Bao WOW! Loved the Bao buns. Lively atmosphere, it will be packed, don't expect to stretch out and be cozy, expect great food.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: A fun restaurant with great vibes and even better food. There is a great lunch special that allows you to try bao and rice bowl! All the bao that I tried were delicious, with my favorite being the pork belly. Appetizers were amazing as well, especially the beef. The drinks were also very delicious - would recommend!

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
Absolutely incredible. The highlights were actually the rice bowl dishes! SO flavorful and yummy (though quite small for sharing!)

My friend and I ended up ordering from the set menu (15 pounds?) as well as the regular menu, and got the confit pork + lamb shoulder baos, the fried chicken, the beef soup with braised daikon, the scallop, the guinea fowl rice (+ the specialty rice bowl they had that was lamb IIRC). Also had the yakult and peanut milk drinks. Everything was absolutely amazing. The soup was perfect for a cold day in London. The rice was so good, and my friend and I marveled at how the rice itself managed to taste so good (it's hard to find places that make rice plates taste homemade in Europe, we agreed).

The drinks were also very unique. Never had a pineapple drink with yakult foam before ... but here we are!

We came as walk-ins a little around 5:30-6pm and were able to be seated right away but the restaurant was definitely busy the rest of the time we were there, so I recommend reserving in advance or going earlier when they open.

(We also got the cute tote bags and even the little neighborhood map ... too iconic to pass up!)

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
I ordered the classic, fried chicken, and confit pork bao. I was lucky enough that there was no wait and I had my food within about 10 minutes. Having eaten a late lunch, this was the perfect amount of food although you'd likely need something with it if you go in hungry to truly fill you up.

The pork was tender and had just the right amount of fat. The fried chicken had a perfect crunch and the classic failed to disappoint. My only complaint was that I wolfed them down too quickly :). Otherwise, a great spot for sure.

The restaurant was incredibly small and seating was more "bar style" where you aren't able to face anyone. Makes it a great spot for solo eaters or friends, but definitely not anyone on a date. I'd highly recommend making reservations as I've heard plenty of stories of people waiting 50+ minutes for a table.

Highly recommend though. Everything was made deliciously and had great flavor.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: I've been here on several occasions. The food is the best I've ever had. It's authentic from what I can tell, and ingredients are fresh. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the wine selection is awesome.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
BAO is a cute, tiny lunch spot, so make sure to make a reservation or get there early! Unfortunately, the confit bao was out of stock when my family was there, so I ordered the classic and the daikon baos. The classic came with braised pork, peanut powder, coriander, and fermented greens; the peanut powder added a nice nuttiness and the buns were so fluffy. The daikon bao came with crumbled daikon, daikon pickle, hot sauce, and coriander; the pickled daikon worked so nicely against the crispy piece of daikon that almost melted in your mouth once bitten into. I also got a yakult float drink, which was unique and delicious.

The one issue my family had with BAO was that the service was incredibly slow. While we understand it is a small place that is packed and busy, it took quite awhile for the food to come out. My dad ordered the pre-fixed menu, but his rice bowl took so long to come out that he eventually asked them not to bother making it so that we could leave and get on our way. Luckily, the service was very accommodating. They handled the situation remarkably well, which was definitely of note and something we were grateful for. Overall, I would come back again for a (hopefully) quick bite with friends or a takeout meal!

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
First of all, let me start by saying I have been religiously following Bao on Instagram for years even before I've ever been to London. When I finally got to visit post-Covid in January, I went to their SoHo location and got to try their fried chicken and confit baos which I both loved! These are textbook amazing baos that are of quality and surprisingly filling for what it is. The bun of the fried chicken one is also somewhat made with sesame which I liked. I got one of their alcoholic spritz which complemented my order well.

I went back here for the second time last week, same location though I should've went to the Covent Garden (?) branch not too far from SoHo since they only serve the pork rice dish I was intending for! I wish they made that clear on their social media page for future reference since they introduce limited menus once in a while that turns out, will only be available at specific locations.

I got seated as soon as they opened at 12nn (pretty late for my opinion,) and the place easily got packed right away. They don't really have a lot of rice bowl options in this location but only mostly small plates and the baos. I re-ordered the confit pork bao which is always a winner and got the Spicy Taiwanese fried chicken along with it. The chicken was absolutely juicy and flavorful! It wasn't too spicy at all, too. I judged it beforehand and didn't really expect how it will blow me away for how juicy it is. Aside from that, the real star of my meal was the house made peanut milk with vanilla which was so refreshing! Never tasted anything quite like it before. Even the thin-rimmed glass they serve it in was perfect for the whole drinking experience. I would definitely go back to Bao over and over whenever I'm in town and would never not get the peanut milk!

This is also a great restaurant for solo diners. I got to sit at the bar twice and loved the experience of being in front of the barista. They also have a "long day menu" which is a curated order for solo diners. I would've gotten it but I was skeptic to try the guinea fowl dish.

Also, vibe is a 5/5. Cute staff and cute people dining in!

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
The Bao's were so good! I got the original and the fried chicken. Perfect for take out. I should have gotten 3, they were so good but a bit small and I had a big appetite that day after lots of sightseeing. Seating is quite limited so it is not suited for groups. Services is fast and friendly!

The fried chicken was perfectly crispy and not heavy. The pork was flavourful and sweet.

Highly recommend to eat and walk around or take out and eat at the park.

Name: Bao
Review_Text:
amazing bao ! everything was super delicious. my favorite bao was the confit pork because it was flavorful with super duper soft meat !

the table was super small, but service was excellent. prices were also fair.

without a reservation we only waited 30 minutes to be seated.

Name: Bao
Review_Text: GREAT for solo dining! Everything was delicious and unique. I got the confit bao and the Guinea fowl rice bowl, which both did not disappoint. The pork and guinea fowl were both so tender and juicy and all the textures of the dishes meshed together well. Additionally, get their chicken Kaarage too!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: What a gem of a restaurant, best pasta I have had in years, great service and the owner is a sweetheart of a person, staff was delightful and the food was incredible! As a New Yorker, I would recommend this place to any foodie I know! MAKE a reservation, the place is packed all night and rightfully so!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Wow wow wow. Can't recommend Padella highly enough. Each and every pasta dish we tried delivered its own unique brilliance.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Best pasta I have ever had! Worth the wait, especially when food comes out quickly. Pici cacio & pepe, the beef shin ragu, even my daughter's plain pasta was like nothing we've ever tasted!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
This showed up in a list of must places to try when in London. We walked over and gave it a try.

3/5 Cacio e Pepe - was good but I thought it tasted a bit off

2/5 - Tagliarini with crab - this tasted very weird. The pasta was too thin for our liking and wayyy too lemony

So many great reviews. Guess I'm just basic?

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Great value for quality Italian food in London. This was one of my favorite meals on my trip to London. It's right by the borough market. You can add your name to the queue and they'll text you when your table is ready (so you don't have to wait around). We had the pappardelle and cacio e pepe. The pastas were amazing! They make it out in the front so you know they're fresh. The seats aren't the most comfortable but the place always gets pretty busy. The service was pretty good here. I'll definitely come back and try some other dishes because the meal was excellent.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: This Pasta Place in London is still some of the best Italian food that I've ever had. It rivals and maybe exceeds the taste and quality of food we had in Italy. It is no wonder this place is completely packed every time we visit, with a line waiting out front to dine. The food quality is outstanding, the prices are fair and the service is great. I only wish I could find Italian this good in California. Bravo!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
We were in London for a weeek and was looking for a good pasta restaurant. All their pasta were homemade and taste AWESOME! Their menu is simple but every dish is done to perfection. We ordered 4 pasta dish plus asparagus. The asparagus was on the expensive side. But the pasta were flavorful. How can we not end the meal at an excellent restaurant without a tiramisu?! We ordered one and as expected, it was great.
It's busy so expect a queue (virtual).

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Don't let this spot pass you by! Coming here you wont be disappointed with the fresh pasta made and prepared in front of you. The Tagliarini was both fresh and creamy complimented with chili and leamon which was complimented with a nice red. Suggest to get on the waitlist ahead of time because the line is ridiculous and even the virtual waitlist gets full however... worth it.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Simple great menu, high quality food and great service! A new favorite. We didn't have a reservation but they fit us in, which is what a place focused on delighting customers should do vs throwing shade at you!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Make sure you get the dojo app ahead of time so you can put yourself on the waitlist when you are close to the restaurant. For us the wait time was actually only about 1/3 of the quoted wait time, which was a pleasant surprise so make sure you are in the area.

As for the food, everything was generally decent, but the pappardelle in with beef ragu was exceptional. The bruschetta was a bit too rough and dry and a bit bitter for my taste and the cacio & Pepe was a bit greasy and too thick for my taste. I'd actually rate this place about 3.5 stars rounding up to 4. I've had better Italian food without this much of a wait, but the food overall was good and service and ambiance was solid.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Incredible pasta! Every dish we tried is perfection. Service was just right and welcoming. Enjoyed their non-alcoholic options, can get loud at night but worth it for this food.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Another frequent London recommendation that was totally worth the hype!! As a solo diner I only had to wait ~15 mins for a bar seat, and walked around Borough market as I waited.

What a cool vibe at the bar as you get to watch your food being made right in front of you!! Fresh pasta is always a win for me. I ordered the pesto and I kinda wish I had gotten a different sauce as this was good but a little boring after a few bites. But the pasta itself was fantastic, as was everything else I had. A little pricey but I'd pay again for that view of the kitchen!

Highly recommend stopping by before a show at the Globe if you can swing it!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Queued up here just before it opened so we were able to be seated at the window right away. After my visit to Italy, I realized that Pici is my favorite type of pasta but I struggle to find it in many restaurants in the US or UK. I was excited to see it on the menu here so I had to try it. The prices were quite steep and the portions quite small, but the food was tasty. I'm glad I was able to try it, but I would not come back for this price.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: I think I need to stop ordering cacio e pepe at restaurants outside of Italy because I always end up disappointed. It was recommended to me by the server so I tried it but...I don't know. It certainly had the right amount of pepper, which I was thrilled about but the cheese was just not cheesing the way it should have.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
The last time I was here was 2019 & this place still has great quality pasta. They always has a line so make sure to get on the queue before the restaurant opens via the QR code. Wait is usually 40 min or so.

Food is freshly made, service is great, & the ambiance is a cool 2 story spot next to borough market. The pici cacio e Pepe was a bit too aldente for me but nonetheless delicious. Will definitely be back!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: I tried the famous pasta which was delicious, but i felt like the quantity was not it. Service was stellar and we were treated very well, and the ambiance is great as there are two floors with lots of space - feels like you are at a hidden spot!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Absolutely the best pasta I've ever had. We got the Pici cacio & Pepe and the Fettuccine with Cobble Lane Cured nduja, mascarpone & lemon . Fresh, great service, and in a great part of the city being closed to Borough Market.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
This was amazing all around.

Short of it, the pasta is outstanding because it's not drowning in sauce. The light olive oil and spices give it a bold flavor while allowing you to really enjoy the pasta they're making on-site. If you have room, the tiramisu is light and fluffy and probably the best I've ever had. The pasta is probably top 3-4 and I pasta very often.

Servers were passionate and funny, and you get in and out in record time. I wish I didn't need to fly 10 hours for pasta this good. Londoners are so lucky to have Padella.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Great food and service. Sat at chefs counter and chefs were very affable and pasta was amazing.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Hands down the best food I've had in all of Europe!! Passion and care goes into each dish and it shows. You will not be disappointed

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Casual Italian restaurant. We shared bread, a ragú pappardelle, and a tagliarini with a crab and lemon sauce. We sat in their lower level which had two gender neutral restrooms; one had a baby changing table and had a airplane bathroom feel to it.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Pretty good Italian food. Definitely try the linguini. Luckily there was no line or a wait when we went. But be prepared, the portions are small, and you also have to pay for bread!!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Quality/Quantity -
Wow, what a GREAT find; probably one of our best meals in London!
Small simple menu, made fresh. Small and simple both for foods and drinks, see pictures of the menu.
Pappardelle - I am a spaghetti kind of person, but my recent go to pasta has been pappardelle. I have been getting this very frequently, especially when I know it is made in house.
Fettuccine with Cobble Lane Cured Nudja, Mascarpone & Lemon - Don't get me wrong, I really liked my dish, but I wish I had ordered this one. It had just the right amount of "kick," a slight spice to it. The sauce was amazing.

Unfortunately, they only had one beer on tap, the Helles Lager. The good news was that it complimented my dish perfectly. Light and refreshing.

Atmosphere - Very small two floor local restaurant. Normally a long wait, but we were lucky enough to get the last two seats in the downstairs bar.
Indoor/outdoor dining.
Open 7 days a week, see their website or Yelp for specific hours. Both differ slightly.
Borough Market is also a very cool place to hang out.

Service - Okay, they are crazy busy, so don't expect personalized service. The good thing was that we were not in a rush.

Price - 35 pounds + tip; good price for what we got. Fine dining quality pasta in a fast casual atmosphere.

Owner Comment - Congrats on your success with your two locations, three restaurants. We will be sure to come back and visit on our next London trip.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
I happen to be in London on business, and found Padella while wandering around the Borough area of the city. I was traveling alone and looking for a meal at peak dinner time on a Friday. I was pleasantly surprised to get a seat within 10 min!

Simple food prepared with care and fresh, high quality ingredients, that's how I describe my meal. It was delicious!!

I had a rocket and mint salad with a light, bright dressing. You should get this healthy, refreshing salad.

For my main course I opted for the fettuccine with pistachio and pesto. It was terrific! The pasta was made fresh, with just the right Al Dente-ness, and the sauce was creamy, fresh and amazing.

It should also be noted that the server was enthusiastic, friendly and helpful.

Two thumbs way up!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Best food I've literally ever had. So adorable and savored every bite. Please go you'll think about it forever and ever. My food with beef on top was amazing

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Very delicious place. Came from the states and was unsure what to expect. Food was fresh, drinks were delicious. Like many places it was small and compact, with very little air flow. That being said I would certainly go back.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Though you have to wait in line, it really is worth it. Really good Italian just like my Sicilian grandmother used to make. This place is not fancy or pretentious in any way. It's a rather small, crowded place with great food at great prices. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have. I try to eat here anytime I'm in London.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Best pasta I've had in awhile. Was so cool to see the kitchen in action sitting at the bar. Service was quick! Highly recommend. Probably not good for big parties though.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Pasta was delicious! Perfect place for me to carb up the night before the London marathon.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
I've researched places to eat near Borough Market that was delicious and affordable. This place was it. They had a QR code that you had to scan to put your name on the queue. The wait time was around 45 mins or so and we went on a late Monday morning. (Granted it was also Easter holidays too.)

I had a hard time figuring out what to order but with recommendations from the waiter I ordered a picI e cacio Pepe and my husband ordered their ravioli. Having had a good amount of wine the night before I opted for water whilst my husband ordered their cloudy lemonade. He said it was some of the best he's had and so he ordered some more.

For an appetizer we ordered the bruschetta and sourdough bread with olive oil. The bread itself was so divine and it soaked up the oils from the tomatoes and made it that more delicious. We both loved it and split the last alice of bread. As for the sourdough bread itself we used it to soak up the wonderful sauces from the pasta that we had ordered.

The ravioli was freshly cooked and the sauce was very light yet delicious. I've never had cacio e pepe but was delighted by the flavor and texture. The firmness of the pasta was a bit on the tougher side for me but not enough to turn me off completely. I would definitely order a side of the sauce if they had the option.

The space inside of Padilla was small and the outside dining area could easily seat 12 people. It was a relatively nice weather day and so sitting outside wasn't so bad.

The bill came to £58 for the two pasta, bread, appetizer and lemonades. We'd recommend going here if you can squeeze in a little bit of time.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Wife and I agree - best pasta we have ever had.

Cacio e Pepe and pappardelle were both excellent. Get the sourdough bread too so you can dab up the sauce at the end to leave no trace behind

Service was great. Wait was very nice with the virtual queue. Food came out very fast and hot!

10/10.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
This popular pasta place has been on my to-eat for a while as I gave up queuing several times seeing the long queue outside the Borough Market branch. Thanks to my friend who arrived at 11:30, we managed to get a table at 11:45 on a Saturday! If you are arriving before 12:45, head straight to the restaurant and scan the QR code at the entrance. Otherwise, you can download the Dojo app and join the virtual queue in advance. Knowing it's our first visit, a staff members kindly introduced their pasta dishes in detail which was really helpful for a picky eater like me. (w/ 12.5% service charge)

Tagliarini with Dorset crab, chilli & lemon (£16)A lightly seasoned dish with fresh crab meat that whetted my appetite. It's not very spicy and I like the long-lasting taste of lemon zest. Nice but not as overwhelming as the ravioli.

Ravioli of Westcombe ricotta with Sardinian tomato sauce (£12.5)
Chewy ravioli stuffed with ricotta with a pleasant dairy flavour. The tomato sauce was so flavourful with a hint of basil. Simply amazing!

Salted caramel & chocolate tart (£6)
Don't skip dessert because this tart is Phenomenal! The chocolate layer is crispy outside and gooey inside. I hate desserts that are too sweet but this tart was just perfect as the thin layer of salted caramel along the crust balanced well with the bitterness of chocolate.

Tiramisu (£6.5)
Tiramisu is creamy and rich in chocolate flavour but I like the version with Marsala wine better.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: This is my second time visiting London and my second time eating at Padella.. and for good reason. The food is phenomenal. The pasta is fresh and the portions are perfect. The staff is friendly and it is clean. It is a very tight space but I promise it's worth it!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
My favorite meal in London, I would recommend it again and again!

Opens weekdays at 11:30am so I showed up around 11:20am and put our name on the list via QR code. Table was ready but I was browsing the market so got back around 11:45am-11:50am. Wow, the place was so packed already!

The ground/top floor seemed cool with bar seating where you can watch them make the pasta. We were sat downstairs at the bar where the bartenders are.

The bar stools are goddamn uncomfortable. Worst part of the experience.

We shared 2 dishes:
-PAPARDELLE WITH 8 HOURS BEEF RAGU. The pasta noodles were so perfect but I wasn't in love with the meat. It wasn't bad though.

- TAGLIARINI WITH CRAB (LOBSTER?) I forget which one it was. Gosh the pasta noodles were so perfect on this one too and I loved the crab and all the spices blended together. A+

Glad I got to try both as they were pretty different from each other, but both oh so good.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Wow wow wow. This was incredible. Some of the best pasta I have had. We put our name into the queue and we're surprised to be sat within five minutes.

Staff could not have been friendlier and each staff member pleasantly interacted with us as they served our food.

The food was divine. Some of the best pasta dishes I have ever had. Try the 8-year old beef pasta- that was our group's highlight. So fresh and light. Incredible!!

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Yum! I don't think Padella even needs my review-everyone seems to already know it's the best!
Visiting from America, we spent the afternoon exploring Borough Market and the surrounding area. Padella had been recommended, and we happened to stumble upon it as it is quite literally right next to the market. Anyways, as we did some online research, we realized we'd want to join the queue ASAP since they don't take reservations. We joined at 4:30 right when it opened up (via QR code outside the restaurant), and then continued to explore Southwark. Got a text a little after 5pm, and we headed back to be seated.

The restaurant is small and simple, but that's usually a good sign. We were pleasantly greeted by the host who seated us at the end of the bar and mentioned we would have 1.5hrs (understood, because this place is busy!) We enjoyed sourdough bread, a Negroni, white wine, Nduja pasta, and cacio e Pepe. It was all delicious, and the atmosphere was great. Within 15 minutes of us being there, there was a line outside and every seat was full! Padella is a must. The pasta is handmade right in front of you, and you can really taste the freshness. We concluded our meal with some tiramisu which was also perfect! The service was quick!
Our server was very sweet as was the rest of the staff. Not a single negative thing to say. Wish I could visit London more so I could come back to eat this pasta!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: It's hard to do pasta much better than this! They serve all the classics plus some more unique seasonal recipes of their own. We tried the Cacio e Pepe and the Ravioli which were delicious but the Tagliarinj blew us away. We still talk about this pasta whenever we go anywhere else and can't wait to try it again! Be prepared to queue but it's so worth it!

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Literally Perfection. Amazing service and dynamic. So fire. A guy with glasses, red beanie, and earring amazing dude.

Name: Padella
Review_Text:
Do yourself a favor and come here.

The hype is real, every time I'm on London I make sure to come by. They don't take 'reservations' but you can download an app or scan the QR code outside their building and get in the queue. I usually come in the afternoon since it's less crowded.

The food overall is always on point and I've never had an issue. The drinks compliment the food well (I had a negroni) and you can't beat their prices -- they have plates for around $8! It took a bit of time to decide what to have because everything looked so good, and the staff were very helpful and patient with me. All the food tasted fresh and flavorful and major points with the heavy hand on the parm cheese.

Name: Padella
Review_Text: Wow, must visit for hand made pasta in London. The cacio e pepe is to die for and better than most I've eaten in Rome, where the dish is most famous. The pappardelle was also good, although I prefer the cacio e pepe. The line can be quite long, so be prepared to wait. The portions are small, so for two people 3-4 pastas should be enough.

Name: José
Review_Text: Let me start by saying we came across this restaurant by accident.... It was busy on a Monday and the ambience was fun! We decided to try. We were greeted right away and wanted to get a table outside. Didn't have to wait long. Luis was amazing and we asked him to recommend his favorites.... We tried every one of them and all were delicious. Started with Jamon Iberico, mushroom croquettes, prawns in chili and garlic, olives stuffed with oranges!( amazing btw), Pluma iberico(outstanding)... drinks were Sherry to start, wine with dinner and finished with Carajillo's and dessert! We are in a food and drink coma now and walking the long way back to our hotel! loved loved loved this place!

Name: José
Review_Text: What a gem. Stumbled into this VERY authentic Spanish Tapas restaurant in a charming little borough. We are Americans and had just left the Tower of London and Tower Bridge Tour and we're ready for a nice break. The restaurant was about a 5 minute walk from the Tower Bridge. We found it on Yelp. The wine was excellent. We had an Albariño and a Tempranillo that were outstanding. The food was as authentic as it gets. We had pan con tomate, jamón ibérico, clams in white wine and garlic the fried goat cheese and honey. And the almond cake. All were perfection. Highly recommend!

Name: José
Review_Text:
Bermondsey Street was a main thoroughfare for us. It may not have always been the most direct route but when you don't know where you're going, it's good to go where you know as you figure it out. I will say that the app - City Mapper - is worth installing on your phone. Oh, but when you're travelling out of the US, you don't want to pay the high roaming charges. Then I say, go to the "airalo" website and see if what they offer might meet your needs, and if it does, install it too. Most newer phones allow you to install electronic SIMs. If you follow the instructions very carefully, you can set your phone up to use this second line for local data access and that will allow City Mapper to run for you while you roam around. I know that I'm sounding like a commercial but that's how much I liked using the app. While I didn't always know which direction I was facing, by watching the app as I moved, I could see if I was heading toward or away from my target.

Okay, back to Jose. We walked by this place several times, both during the day and at night. They always had guests, especially at night when the crowd seemed to spill out of the restaurant to the outside tables and surrounding area. People looked happy as they indulged in their food and wine. We stopped once and read the menu. It's quite small and written on a chalkboard. It looks like every now and then, they erase something and write something else up. Having been to Barcelona, we weren't particularly impressed with the menu and didn't plan on dining there. Until I read the reviews. And looked at their website and learned about Jose Pizzaro, chef, owner of six restaurants in London and one in Abu Dhabi, author of six cookbooks, a regular on BBC cooking shows AND that the Tapas Bar Jose is mentioned as a Bib Gourmand in the Michelin Guide.

Service was wonderful. It was cool watching Chef prepare our food. The Pan con Tomate was so simple and yet so delicious. A slice of bread, toasted, rubbed with garlic, rubbed roughly with a ripe tomato, slightly salted and drizzled with olive oil. I could eat that every single day and LOSE WEIGHT.

The Bermondsey Bomba was like a giant Porto Bakery (forgive me Jose) Potato Ball with more meat in a spicy sauce placed on top of a bed of aioli with a dollop of seasoned tomato paste on top. I could eat these every single day and GAIN WEIGHT.

The Boquerones were heavenly. The Clams with Garlic and Parsley, devine. And the Patatas Bravas...come on man, they're just potatoes! Crispy on the outside, soft and warming on the inside. Once again, the aioli and seasoned tomato paste just brings it all together.

Service was warm and friendly. They were kind enough to let us order in rounds so we could gauge how much to order. Honestly, we had five dishes and were stuffed.

Pictures to follow.

Name: José
Review_Text: Great food - excellent service - nice vibe - not too expensive. Highly recommend. Will seek out next time in the area.

Name: José
